loans.name: Khodor

texts.en:
Khodor is a 26-year-old man who lives in Saida, southern Lebanon with his wife and their three children. Khodor has been collecting broken iron for eight years. He collects the iron and then sells it to his friends or to iron workers who use the iron in their work. He decided to start his business because he had the help of his parents.

Khodor has requested a loan of USD$1200 from A. Majmoua for household expenses. This is his third loan and he has always paid on time. In the future, he plans to purchase a bigger truck.

loans.use: Khodor needs the loan for household expenses.

loans.name: Bilal

texts.en:
BilA. is a 35-year-old man who lives in Saida, southern Lebanon with his wife and their three children. BilA. has been a barber for 27 years. BilA. is renowned in his work for his good prices. He has a very broad clientele.

BilA. has requested a loan of USD$1100 from A. Majmoua in order to purchase a new armored window for his salon. This is his second cycle and he has always paid on time. In the future, he plans to open an academy.

loans.use: Bilal needs the loan to purchase a new armored window for his salon.

loans.name: The Truth Group

texts.en:
This is Anjay A. T., B. Neneh J., J. B. Neneh, Fatmata T. and Mamai T.. They named their group The Truth.  They are all local entrepreneurs in Makeni in northern Sierra Leone. This is their fourth loan from Kiva through SMT. Previously, each one of them in the group received a loan of 800,000 Leones (a little over USD$250). That loan created meaningful impacts in the lives of these borrowers. They were able to use the proceeds to pay for their children’s school fees. They’re also able to feed and clothe themselves and their children with the income generated from the loans. Now, they are requesting a loan of 1,000,000 Leones each to buy more goods to add to their businesses.

Anjay (left) is the leader of the group. He is thirty-nine years of age. He was born in Makeni. His wife is a businesswoman and the two have four children – two in secondary school and two in primary school. He has been a businessman for over 10 years now. Anjay owns a small, local recording studio where he also sells tapes. He will use this new loan to buy two more cassette recorders and blank and non-blank tapes. The tape recorders, locally referred to as Simba, will cost him 350,000 Leones in Freetown. He will be using one of the tapes to play songs and the other for recording songs.

Traveling to Freetown so often to buy the tapes is the only major challenge facing Anjay in his business. He hates traveling so often and whenever he runs out of tapes, he is forced to make the trek to Freetown to buy the required number of tapes needed to replace the sold ones. But with this loan, the amount of traveling he’ll have to do will diminish as he will be able to buy a lot of tapes in one trip.

With the increase in profit Anjay will make as a result of the loan, he will be able to develop his business by reinvesting the profit into the business. With more profit, he hopes to start including compact discs in his music collection.

loans.use: To buy two more cassette recorders and blank and non-blank tapes.

loans.name: Zaynab

texts.en:
Zaynab A. H. is 40 years old and lives in Saida, southern Lebanon with her husband and their three children. She has been working in clothing sales for a year. Zaynab has requested a loan of  800 US dollars from A. Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for her store that will allow her to have a larger collection of clothes. This is the first time that she has requested a loan.
Zaynab hopes that the loan will help her solve her financiA. issues. Zaynab is exceptionA. in her work. She has low prices, as well as diversity and a good quality of clothes. Her clients are friends, neighbors and tourists. When she first started her business, she faced difficulties like knowing the retailers and having a good idea about what was in fashion. She decided to do this type of work because she knows how to convince her clients and she is quite competitive in her business. In the future, she plans to own her own store.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 43-year old married man with two children, living in his village Al Kfour in Nabatieh in southern Lebanon. Ali has been a taxi driver for 15 years. Today he wants to borrow $500 to change his taxi tires. In addition he plans to fix his taxi's engine.

loans.use: Change his taxi tires in addition to fixing his taxi engine

loans.name: Wissam

texts.en:
Wissam is a 29 year old man who lives in Saida, southern Lebanon with his wife and their child. Wissam has been in the car body repair business for many years. He has requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from A. Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his business. Wissam has been a micro-credit client for four years now and has always paid on time.
The loans have influenced his life in a good way. When he first started he faced some difficulties such as not having enough clients and his clients not paying on time. His clients are his friends, neighbors and others. He decided on doing this business because he started learning it once he left school. That’s why he has a lot of experience. In the future, he plans to expand his business and have more clients.

loans.use: Wissam needs the loan to purchase merchandise for his body shop.

loans.name: Nabielah

texts.en:
Nabielah is a 43 year old woman who lives in Aley, Mount Lebanon with her husband and their two children. Nabielah has owned a toy and gift store for four years. She has requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for her store. This is the first time that Nabielah has requested a loan.
Nabielah hopes that the loan will help her improve her business which will improve her income. She is special in her work because she has a large variety of items in the shop. Her clients are her friends, neighbors and others from her village. When she first started, the difficulty she faced was to please all her clients and have variety in her merchandise. Nabielah decided on doing her business because of her dedication to children and her experience in retail. In the future, she plans to expand her business.

loans.use: Nabielah will use the loan to purchase merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Struggle Group

texts.en:
This is Aminata J., Kadiatu B. and Fatmata J.. They named their group Struggle.  They are all local entrepreneurs in Makeni in northern Sierra Leone. This is not their first loan from Kiva through SMT. They had all previously received several loans from Kiva through SMT. Those loans created meaningful impacts on the lives of these borrowers. They were able to use the proceeds to pay for their children’s school fees.  They’re also able to feed and clothe themselves and their children with the income generated from the loans.  Today, they are requesting a loan of $400 each to buy more goods to add to their businesses.

Aminata (right) is the leader of the group. She is forty years of age. She was born in Magbinty village in the Port Loko district in northern Sierra Leone. She is married to a teacher and the two have five children. Two of her children are in college, three in secondary school and one in primary school. She has been a businesswoman for over twenty years now.
 
Aminata sells market food. She sells onions, salt, pepper, sugar, etc. With this new loan, she will expand  her business.  She will be able to buy about ten bags of onions, five bags of salt and two bags of sugar. 

So far, Aminata faces no serious challenge in her business that is worth noting. Business is going fine . She enjoys what she does for a living. To Aminata and her colleagues in the group, an increase in profit means making their lives better. They will be able to take good care of their children, specifically with their educational and nutritional needs, and save some money for emergencies.

loans.use: Buy at least ten bags of onions, five bags of salt and two bags of sugar.

loans.name: Central B1-Kimata Sarah Group

texts.en:
Namugaya I. is a creative and hardworking business lady. She has a poultry farm, offers tailoring services and at the same time  fries and sells snacks like samosas,pancakes and cassava chips in her locality. She rears both broilers and layers. 

I. is using her loan to expand her business by purchasing grower feeds for the layers. Besides good feeding, she ensures her poultry are vaccinated against diseases and are in a clean environment. This has enabled her to attract more customers since her poultry are healthy and large. I. is married with 6 children and also looks after 4 of her grandchildren. Her ambition is to expand her business to selling chicks, mature poultry and eggs on a wholesale basis.

loans.use: Purchasing grower feeds for the layers.

loans.name: Eyman

texts.en:
Eyman is a 21 year old woman who lives in Aley, Mount Lebanon. She has owned a shoe store for couple of years. Eyman sells shoes and bags. She has requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase shoes for her store. This is the first time that Eyman has requested a loan.
Eyman hopes that the loan will help her improve her business which will  improve her income. Eyman is special in her work because she is well organized. Her clients are her friends, neighbors and children of her village. When she first started, she faced some difficulties; the lack of experience and she also didn’t have enough knowledge of how to deal with clients. She decided on doing this business thanks to her father's support by giving her the store and she likes working in  commerce.

loans.use: Eyman needs the loan to purchase shoes for her store.

loans.name: Tafuf Group

texts.en:
This is Ya Marie K., Mary K., Isatu F., Adiatu B., Aminata K. and Hassanatu B.. They named their group Tafuf, a Temne word meaning “let us talk.”  They are all local entrepreneurs in Makeni in northern Sierra Leone. They have received several loans from Kiva through SMT. Previous loans have created meaningful impacts on the lives of these borrowers. They were able to use the proceeds to pay for their children’s school fees.  They’re also able to feed and clothe themselves and their children with the income generated from the loans.  Now, they are requesting a loan of $200 each to buy more goods to add to their businesses.

Ya Marie K.(back row right) is the leader of the group. She is fifty years of age. She was born in Sanda, about thirty miles from Makeni. Her husband is in the transportation business and the two of them have five children – four in secondary schools and one in primary school. Ya Marie has been a businesswoman for over twenty years now.
 
Ya Marie sells local produce like rice, palm oil, groundnuts and any other related items she finds available in the market. With this new loan, she will use it to expand  her business by buying bags of rice and groundnuts and gallons of palm oi.

Ya Marie uses some of her profit to buy food for her family, some is reinvested back into her business and some to pay off her monthly loan installments.

loans.use: Expand on her business by buying bags of rice, groundnuts and gallons of palm oil.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Amin

texts.en:
Amin is a 26 year old man who lives in Bourj el Barajneh in the southern suburbs of Lebanon. Amin has owned an Internet shop for a year. He has internet lines as well as a central telephone. He hasrequested a loan of 1200 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase five computers and a machine for international phone calls. This is the first time that Amin has requested a loan.
Amin hopes that the loan will improve his shop conditions. He is special in his work because he is the only one in his area and he has a good relationship with his clients. His clients are friends, neighbors and tourists. Amin started his business because he wanted to be independent. In the future, he plans to increase the number of customers.

loans.use: To purchase five computers and a machine for international phone calls.

loans.name: Ifdal

texts.en:
Ifdal is a 33 year old woman who lives in Tripoli in northern of Lebanon. Ifdal owns a grocery store in where she sells groceries, canned food and candies. She has requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase canned food, detergent and other merchandise for her store. This is the first time that Ifdal has requested a loan.
When Ifdal first started her business, she didn’t have the capital needed to start her business because she is a single woman. Her clients are her family members, friends and neighbors. She decided on doing this business because she gained experience by working in other shops. In the future, she plans to improve her business by having more merchandise in order for her to insure sustainability.

loans.use: Ifdal needs the loan to purchase canned food, detergent and other merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Houda

texts.en:
Houda is a 54 year old widow who lives in Beirut, the capital of Lebanon with her child. She has been working as a vegetable seller for forty years. She sells fresh vegetables, eggs, lettuce, mint and lavender. Houda has requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise, more specifically vegetables and eggs. This is her second cycle and she has always paid on time.
When Houda first started her business, she faced a lack of knowledge of sales. Her clients are her friends and neighbors. Houda decided to do this business because she was a widow and had to make her living. In the future, she plans to increase her productivity.

loans.use: Houda needs the loan to purchase merchandise, more specifically vegetables and eggs.

loans.name: Wusum Women Association Group

texts.en:
This is Maseray K. and Marie K.. They named their group Wusum Women's Association (named after one of the two main hills in Makeni).  They are local entrepreneurs in Makeni, in northern Sierra Leone. They have received several loans from Kiva through SMT. Previous loans have created meaningful impacts in the lives of these borrowers. They were able to use the proceeds to pay for their children’s school fees.  They’re are also able to feed and cloth themselves and their children with the income generated from the loans.  Now, they are requesting a loan of Le 800,000 each, to buy more goods to add to their businesses.

Maseray K. (left) is the leader of the group. She is fifty-two years of age. She was born in Makari village, only five miles from Makeni. Her husband is a truck driver and the two of them have four children, all of whom are in secondary schools. Maseray has been a businesswoman for over fifteen years.
 
Maseray sells firewood. Previously, she sold dishes, buckets and slippers, but bad debtors have forced her to change her business to firewood.  The firewood business is a no credit business.  It is a cash business only. She will use this new loan to expand her business by buying two truck loads of firewood. Usually, a truck load of firewood costs Le 500,000, including transportation. She travels to the back country of Binkolo, about seven miles from Makeni to purchase the wood.

During the dry season, wood sellers like Maseray, encounter a drop in sales, which poses a great threat to her business. Sales drop in the dry season because trees are dry and many people can just chop one down and make their own firewood instead of buying wood in the market. Others simply go to a near-by bush and chop dry sticks and turn them into firewood. This is a challenge to her business and she has to face it head-on. Maseray uses her profit to pay school fees and other related expenses for her children, including medical care and food.

loans.use: To expand her business by buying two truck loads of firewood.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan is a 38-year-old man who lives in Beirut, the capital of Lebanon, with his wife and their four children. Hassan has owned a grocery store for ten years. He sells vegetables, chocolate and canned food. Hassan has requested a loan of 800 US Dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise. This is his third cycle and he has always paid on time.
The loan will help him have more merchandise in his shop. Hassan is special in his work because of his honesty and good behavior with his clients. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When he first started, he faced a lack of cash. In the future, he plans to improve his business.

loans.use: Hassan will use the loan to purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Houwayda

texts.en:
Houwayda A. H. is a 36 year old widow who lives in Bint Jbeil, southern Lebanon with her two children. Houwayda has owned a bakery shop for ten year. She makes “markouk” and “mankoucheh” on the “saj”. The “saj” is the metA. oven where you bake the saj bread. The saj oven is a traditionA. Lebanese cooking dome used to make markouk (“thinned”) bread and doughy confections called mankoucheh. A mankoucheh looks like a folded pizza. Most common toppings are zaatar (thyme), jebneh (cheese) and lahm bi ajin (minced meat). You can eat it anytime of the day, but somehow it tastes better in the morning. 

Houwayda requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from A. Majmoua in order to purchase flour and some tools for her bakery shop. This is the first time that Houwayda has requested a loan. Houwayda hopes that the loan will help her to cross the bridge to a better situation. She specialty is the good quality and taste of her markouk. Her clients are her friends, family members, neighbors and neighborhood shops. Houwayda got into this business because she had learned the business from her mother and she does it well. In the future, she plans to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase flour and tools for her bakery shop.

loans.name: Jassar

texts.en:
Jassar is a 22 year old man who lives in Bint Jbeil, southern Lebanon. Jassar has been a carpenter for few years. He makes wooden doors, bedrooms and sitting rooms furniture. Jassar requested a loan of 650 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase tools and machines. This is the first time that Jassar has requested a loan.
Jassar hopes that the loan will help him increase his productivity. He is special in his work because of his honesty and his good behavior with his clients. His clients are his friends and family members. When he first started his business, he faced the lack of cash. Jassar decided to do his business because for the love of his work and his experience. In the future, he plans to expand his business and have more machines.

loans.use: Jassar needs the loan to tools and machines.

loans.name: J. Jesús

texts.es:
Jesús inició el negocio para tener una fuente de ingresos que le permitiera mantener a su familia. Comenzó el negocio en junio de 1990, siendo ayudante de su tío en el oficio de albañilería, aprendió con relativa facilidad el mismo, y una vez que tuvo unos ahorros decidió independizarse con el apoyo de su tío. Este oficio aparte de permitirle mantenerse  le ha permitido generar fuentes de empleo con todos sus sobrinos evitando así que emigren hacia el norte, ya que las opciones de trabajo son pocas.

El necesita un préstamo por MXN $5,000 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar más materiales para continuar la exitosa carrera que ha tenido hasta la fecha.
texts.en:
Jesús started his business in order to have a source of income that would permit him to support his family. He began working for his uncle in June 1990 as an apprentice mason. He learned with relative ease, and once he had some money saved, with his uncle’s assistance, decided to branch out on his own. In addition to allowing him to support himself, this business has provided sources of income for his nephews, who therefore did not feel the need to emigrate north because jobs were scarce. Jesús needs a loan of $375 (5000 Mexican pesos), which he will repay in six months time, in order to buy materials to continue the successful career that he has had to date.

Translated from Spanish by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials

loans.name: Martha Imelda

texts.es:
Martha inició el negocio para obtener un ingreso que le permitiera vivir mejor, ya que se jubilo del Instituto Mexicano del Seguro Social (IMSS) y con la pensión que recibía no era suficiente. Por lo que comenzó en Noviembre de 1995 su negocio, cuando una amiga le comentó que ella se dedicaba a vender ropa y le iba muy bien, fue así que la invitó a hacer un viaje a los E.U. para comprar cosas. Primero empezó vendiendo entre sus compañeros de trabajo y vecinos y le empezó a ir muy bien. Después se dediqué a la venta de ropa y viajaba a la ciudad de Moroleón, Guanajuato, pero en la actualidad encuentra ropa mas barata en Michoacán y en Villa Hidalgo, Jalisco por lo que surte directamente haya además de que es ropa nueva.

Ahora ella necesita un préstamo por MXN $8,000 que pagara en12 catorcenas para realizar un viaje en cual va a comprar ropa para vender en esta época de fin de año que se acerca.
texts.en:
Martha started the business to have an income that would allow her to live better, since she retired from the Mexican Social Security Institute (IMSS), and the pension she received wasn't enough. Because of this she started her business in November of 1995, when a friend told her that she was selling clothes and it was going very well for her. She invited Martha to go on a trip to the US to buy things. Martha started selling among her friends from work and her neighbors, and that started to go very well for her. Afterward, she sold clothes and traveled to the city of Moroleon, Guanajuato, but she found clothes cheaper in Michoacan and Villa Hidalgo, Jalisco, because they got their stock directly (from the manufacturers), plus, it was new clothing. Now Martha needs a loan of $600 that she will pay back in 12 installments. She will use it for a trip during which she will go to buy clothing to sell during the end-of-year time that is drawing near.

Translated from Spanish by Olivia Engkvist, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Juan Francisco

texts.es: El Sr. Juan tiene 32 años de edad, habitante de barrio El Paraisito en la capital de Managua, estado civil casado, su esposa es operadora de la zona franca. Los planes para su familia es terminar la construcción de su casa. Don Juan se desempeña en su pequeño negocio de enderezador y pintura automotriz con Diez  años de experiencia en el ramo de automotriz y un  año de independizarse, inicio como ayudante de pintura y ahorra tiene su negocio propio. Sus metas para su negocio es aumentar el volumen de producción mediante el desempeño con  mejores herramientas y ofreciendo servicio de calidad a nuestros clientes. Gracias a los prestamos de Afodenic lograra comprar herramientas como: soldador, un teche y otras herramientas que le puedan generar beneficios  en su trabajo y ofrecer cada día mejor calidad de trabajo a sus clientes, y así lograr captar mas clientes para obtener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Juan is 32 years old, living in the Paraisito neighborhood in the capital of Managua. He is married; his wife works for the Zona Franca ** His plan for his family is to finish construction on his house. Juan runs his small auto repair and paint shop with 10 years of experience in automotive work, and one year of working independently. He started as a painting assistant, and now he has his own business. His goal for his business is to increase his volume of production by having better tools and offering a quality service to his customers. Thanks to the loan from Kiva partner Afodenic, he will be able to buy tools such as a welder, a roof (for his business), and other tools that will allow him to generate more profits at work and, each day, offer his customers a better quality of service. Therefore, he will be able to gain more customers to have better income. **Translator's note: The Zona Franca is a governmental organization that regulates exportation from Nicaragua. See www.cnzf.gob.ni for more info (in Spanish).

Translated from Spanish by Olivia Engkvist, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy tools such as a welder for his automotive shop

loans.name: Abilio Guillermo

texts.es: El Sr. Abilio tiene 53 años de edad, habita en el  barrio Memorial Sandino en la capital de Managua, estado civil casado su esposa es ama de casa, sus planes para su familia es terminar de construir su casa y tener un patrimonio seguro. Don Abilio se desempeña como conductor de una empresa privada desde hace diez años con experiencia en el manejo de transporte, sus objetivos en el ámbito laboral es cambiar de trabajo a uno mejor. Gracias a los préstamos de Afodenic lograra realizar mejoras a su vivienda comprar materiales como: cemento de cerámica, bloques y cerámicas para poner en la sala ya que es de tierra y quiere  ofrecer a su familia mayor comodidad, seguridad y protección.
texts.en:
Abilio is 53 years old, living in the Memorial Sandino neighborhood in the capital of Managua. He is married, and his wife is a housewife. His plan for his family is to finish construction on his house and have a secure asset. Abilio has run a private business for 10 years with experience in management in the transportation sector. His objective in his work is to switch to a better job. Thanks to the loan from Kiva partner Afodenic, he will be able to improve his house and buy materials like grout, bricks, and tiles for the living living room since it is now just dirt and he wants to offer his family better comfort, security, and protection.

Translated from Spanish by Olivia Engkvist, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials to fix up his home

loans.name: Roger Antonio

texts.es: El señor Roger Antonio Pavón tiene la edad de 35 años habita en el barrio santa rosa ubicado en la cuidad de Masaya , junto a su compañera de vida ; la cual trabaja para ayudarle con los gastos del hogar ya que tiene dos hijas que estudian , los planes hacia un futuro es mejorar las condiciones de vida a su familia , este señor se desempeña como ayudante de albañil y a la vez como agricultor , don Roger tiene dos años trabajando como albañil y catorce años trabajando sus tierras , el sueño de él es llegar a terminar su casa ya que con muchos esfuerzos y apoyo de su esposa han construido la mayor parte , pero por falta de financiamiento no lo han logrado terminar . El cliente Roger solita el apoyó de nuestra institución para comprar materiales de construcción y llegar a cumplir sus sueños de tener una vivienda digna para su familia
texts.en:
Mr. Roger Antonio Pavón is 35-years-old and lives in the Santa Rosa neighborhood in the city of Masaya. He lives with his wife, who works to help him with the household expenses, as they have two children in school. His future plans include improving his family’s standard of living. Roger is both an assistant bricklayer and a farmer. He has spent two years as a bricklayer and fourteen years working his land. His dream is to finish his house, which, thanks to a great deal of effort and the support of his wife, is nearly complete. However, lack of finances has prevented them from finishing it. Roger is seeking support from our organization so he can buy construction materials and realize his dream of having a decent home for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials to finish building his house

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is a member of the Bonanza Village Bank. Irene is 40 years old and is married with four children. Irene has a farm on her land in the Tambillos District, which is located two hours from the city of Ayacucho. She grows potatoes which she then sells in the Abastos Market in the city of Ayacucho. Irene needs a loan of 1050 soles to buy fertilizers and pesticides. Irene dreams of producing more and generating more investment capital.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Fellow.

Irene es socia del Banco Comunal Bonanza. Irene es casada, tiene 40 años y 4 hijos, Irene se dedica a la agricultura en sus tierras del distrito de Tambillos que se ubica a 2 horas de la ciudad de Ayacucho en donde cultiva papa que luego los comercializa en el mercado de abastos de la ciudad de Ayacucho. Irene necesita un préstamo de 1050 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de abono y remedios. Irene sueña con producir mas e incrementar su capital.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Cesar Augusto

texts.es: El Sr. Cesar tiene 58 años de edad, habitante del barrio Laureles Sur en la capital de Managua, estado civil soltera, tiene cinco hijos mayores. Sus planes para la familia es tener un patrimonio para sus hijos. Don cesar se desempeña como vendedor de ropa variadas de niño y adulto vende al contado y al crédito, su pequeño negocio lo tiene desde hace treinta años, lo inicio con fondo propio, los planes para su negocio es aumentar el volumen de venta mediante nuevos productos y nuevos sectores de mercado. Con esta solicitud es la tercera lo cual ha sido de muchos beneficios ya que ha hecho mejoras a su vivienda con este préstamo de Afodenic lograra comprar materiales de construcción como: cemento, bloques, zinc y así  seguir mejorando la infraestructura de su casa obteniendo mayor seguridad para su familia
texts.en:
Cesar is 58 years old, living in the South Laureles neighborhood in the capital of Managua. He is single and has five grown children. His plan for his family is to have an inheritance for his children. Cesar works selling various clothes for children and adults. He sells for cash and on credit. He has had his small business for 30 years. He started it with his own money. His plan for his business is to increase his sales through (selling) new products and (reaching) new sectors of the market. This is his third loan. The loans have been of much benefit, as he has already made several improvements to his home. With this loan from Kiva partner Afodenic, he will be able to buy construction materials such as cement, bricks, and zinc, so that he can continue improving the infrastructure of his house and gaining better security for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Olivia Engkvist, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials to fix up his home

loans.name: Afia

texts.en:
Afia M. is thirty five years old. She is married and the mother of three children. Two have completed senior high school while the youngest still attends school. She has been a local manufacturer of palm oil and palm kernel oil for the past three years. Palm oil and palm kernel oil are produced from palm kernel. The palm kernel oil is a by-product of palm oil, which is produced first. The palm kernel is processed through various stages to obtain the palm kernel oil, which is used to prepare many local dishes like frying fish and pastries. Afia produces and supplies these oils to food vendors to prepare their meals. However, her production is on the low side as a result of insufficient working capital to buy a processing machine.
 
She wants to use the loan to buy more bags of palm kernel and an electric milling machine to reduce the manual effort and produce larger quantities. In addition to the oil business, she also sells smoked fish to earn income to support her business; she buys her stock of fish from a town called Yeji which is close to her village and retails it to customers in the village. She believes the loan will enable her to increase her savings toward her child’s education. She belongs to the community group called ‘Nyame Nhyira’ which means God Blessing Trust Group. In this group, members provide a guarantee for each another to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy seventy bags of palm kernels and an electric milling machine

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
Diana F. is a 35 year old married mother of six children, who are in school. Her children are in elementry school and junior high through the help of the government's free and compulsory education program. She has been a food vendor for the past two years. She prepares and sells rice with stew, fried yam, and cooked beans with fried ripe plantain, by the road side, in Babiani where she lives. Beans and gari is a delicacy meal that many Ghanaians enjoy everyday as a breakfast, lunch or dinner. She also sells fried rice and fried yams alongside her beans with gari. 

Her business is doing well and she wants to expand her operations to serve more customers. With this loan, she wants to buy more beans grains, vegetables, yam, rice and assorted meat for her business. She hopes this loan will help her increase her savings to improve her family's well being. She would be very grateful for that assistance. She belongs to the community group called ‘Nyame Nhyira’ which means God Blessing Trust Group. In this group, members provide guarantee for each another to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy bags of beans, grains, rice, yam, vegetables, assorted meat, etc

loans.name: Esperanza Imelda

texts.es: La Sra. Esperanza tiene 41 años de edad, habita en el  barrio Laureles Norte en la capital de Managua , madre soltera, tiene dos hijos ya mayores de edad. Los planes para con su familia es terminar la construcción de su casa y levantar los muros del otro terreno, obteniendo un patrimonio con la seguridad que requiere, ya que es insegura su vivienda por que es de tabla y de zinc, ella ya tiene un comienzo con el muro y desea terminarlo también ya que para ella es importante estar mas segura por la delincuencia Doña Esperanza se desempeña como conserje en una institución desde hace tres años, sus metas en ámbito laboral es cambiar a un trabajo mejor donde pueda ganar mas dinero, lo cual seria de gran beneficio para su familia para cumplir sus objetivos. Gracias a los préstamos de Afodenic lograra comprar materiales de construcción como: cemento, hierro, bloque, zinc y alambre, obteniendo una casa protegida, segura y solidad.
texts.en:
Mrs. Esperanza is 41 years old and lives in the Laureles Norte neighborhood in Managua. She is a single mother of two, and her sons are now financially independent. The family plans to finish construction on their house and to build walls around their plot of land. When the walls are built they'll have the security to obtain a patrimony. Their house is made of planks and zinc, and it's not very safe. Esperanza has started the wall and would like to finish it, because it is important to her family to be safe from crime. Esperanza has worked as a receptionist for the past three years, and her goal is to change jobs so that she can earn more money. This would benefit her family and enable her to achieve her objectives. Thanks to the Afodenic loans she'll be able to buy construction materials like: cement, iron, blocks, zinc and barbed wire. With these she can have a secure, solid, and protected home.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials to build her house out of concrete

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy A. is 21 years old, married and the mother of two children. She is still nursing her youngest child, while the other is in the elementary school. She is a food vendor with five years experience. She prepares and sells rice with stew, and cups of uncooked rice by the road side of Babiani, where she lives. Her food is delicious and has attracted many customers to her stand, especially during the rush hour. She also sells uncooked rice in cups traveling (hawking) through her village. Her business is doing well and she wants to expand her operations to serve more customers. With the loan, she wants to buy more beans, vegetables, rice and assorted meat for her operation. Mercy hopes this loan would help increase her earnings to improve her family's well being. She would be very grateful for this assistance. She belongs to the community group called ‘Nyame Nhyira’ which means God Blessing Trust Group. In this group, members provide assistance and guarantee for each other to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy bags of beans, grains, rice, yam, vegetables, assorted meat, etc

loans.name: Akosua

texts.en:
This client was a food vendor, but for the past year, she has been selling food, like plantains, and cooking utensils. Akosua K. is 45 years old and is married with five children. Four of the children are independent, releasing her from the burden of their basic needs, but her last born, who lives with her, is in the final year at the junior high school. 

Akosua lives in Agya Baaniikrom, which is a suburb in the western region of Ghana. She treks to the surrounding villages to buy plantains and then transports them to the Volta region, her hometown, to sell them. She says is it a very lucrative business. On her return, she buys cooking sets from Togo, a country that borders Ghana, and sells them to her customers in the community where she lives. 

Her major challenge has been raising adequate funds to improve her business. Akosua is requesting a loan to buy more plantains and kitchen sets to increase her inventory even in the lean season. She belongs to a community trust group called ‘Nyame Nhyira,’ which means "God's Blessing." In this group, members guarantee for one another and assist one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: Akosua wants the loan to buy more plantains and utensils to sell

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Abena A. is thirty years old. She is married and the mother of three children, two of whom are currently in school. She has been a local manufacturer of palm oil and palm kernel for three years. Palm oil is produced from palm nut fruits and the palm kernel is a by-product of the palm oil, which is produced first. The palm kernel is processed through various stages to obtain the palm kernel oil. 

Abena produces and supplies her product to food vendors, who use it to prepare their meals. She even treks to the villages to purchase the finished goods when demand becomes very high. She wants to use the loan to buy bags of palm nuts and gallon containers to store the oil, so she can increase her efficiency and produce in larger quantities. 

Fortunately, the government of Ghana has provided the community with a machine that most women can use to manufacture oil in bulk, saving them from using the antiquated method of getting the oil. She believes this will help to expand her business and raise more income to support her husband, to provide food for her family, and finance her children’s education. 

She belongs to the community trust group called "Nyame Nhyira," meaning "God's Blessing," and her picture was taking during their group meeting. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and provide peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: Abena wants the loan to buy more palm nuts

loans.name: Gifty

texts.en:
Gifty N. is 24 years old. She is married and the mother of two children, one of whom is in school. She has been a local manufacturer of palm oil and palm kernel for five years. Palm oil is produced from palm nut fruits, and the palm kernel is a by-product of palm oil, which is produced first. The palm kernel is processed through various stages to obtain the palm kernel oil. 

Gifty produces and supplies her product to food vendors, who use it to prepare their meals. She even treks to the villages to purchase the finished goods when demand is very high. She wants to use the loan to buy more palm nuts, and gallon containers to store the oil, so she can increase her efficiency and produce in larger quantities. 

Fortunately, the government of Ghana has provided the community with a machine that most women use to manufacture the oil in bulk, saving them from using antiquated methods of getting the oil. She believes this will help her to expand her business, and to raise more income to support her husband, to provide food for her family, and to finance her children’s education. 

Gifty belongs to the community trust group called "Nyame Nhyira," which means "God's Blessing," and her picture was taking during their group meeting. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: Gifty wants the loan to buy more bags of palm nuts

loans.name: Oscar David

texts.es: El Sr. Oscar tiene 22 años de edad, habitante del barrio Villa Venezuela de la capital de Managua, estado civil soltero y no tiene hijos. Los planes para su futuro en el ámbito familiar es formar un hogar sólido y ofrecerle un patrimonio seguro. Don Oscar tiene su pequeño negocio de videos juegos, con un año de experiencia en el servicio de alquiler de videos juegos de todo tipo, iniciándolo con fondos propios pero sus objetivos para el negocio es aumentar la variedad de juegos y modificar los equipos de juegos (consolas de juegos) y establecer un Cyber en el sector de Managua. Gracias a los préstamos de Afodenic lograra comprar videos juegos y consolas nuevas, ofreciéndoles a los clientes mejor atención y servicio  así como captar más clientes y obtener mejores ingresos
texts.en:
Oscar is 22 years old and lives in the Villa Venezuela district of Managua, the capital of Nicaragua. He is single and doesn't have any children. His future plans for a family are to establish a solid home and offer a secure asset base. Oscar has a small video game business, with one year of experience renting all types of video games. He started the business with his own savings but his goal is to increase the variety of games, modify the video game consoles and establish a cyber-cafe in his district of Managua. Thanks to the loan from Afodenic he will be able to buy more video games and new game consoles, offering his customers better service and in such a way growing his client base and increasing his income.

Translated from Spanish by Sally Bolton, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase video games and offer maintenance and repair

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en:
Georgina A. is forty-six years old. She is married the mother of three children, all of whom are in school.

Georgina produces and supplies her product to food vendors, who use it to prepare their meals. She even treks to the villages to purchase the finished goods when demand is very high. She wants to use the loan to buy more palm nuts, and gallon containers to store the oil, so she can increase her efficiency and produce in larger quantities. 

Georgina belongs to a community trust group called "Nyame Nhyira," which means "God's Blessing," and her picture was taking during their group meeting. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more bags of palm nuts and an electric milling machine to increase her efficiency

loans.name: Rita Maria

texts.es: La Sra. Rita tiene 40 años de edad, habita en el  barrio Laureles Norte, madre soltera, tiene dos hijas ya independiente, sus planes para la familia es apoyarla y terminar de construir su vivienda para un patrimonio sólido. Desea comprar materiales de construcción para embaldosar su casa ya que es de tierra así como repellar las paredes, para dar una mejor presentación a sus clientes ya que su negocio lo tiene en su casa de habitación Doña Rita se desempeña vendiendo ropa en su pequeño negocio desde hace un año, iniciándolo con fondo propios, sus metas para su negocio es incrementar el volumen de venta  y ampliarlo. Con este  prestamos es su tercer solicitud locuaz  lograra comprar nuevos productos como. Zapatos, ropa para dama, caballero y niños, juguetes y artículos escolares, comercializándolos por mayores cantidades y obteniendo mayores utilidades para lograr sus metas.
texts.en:
Rita is 40 years old and lives in the Laureles Norte district. She is a single mother with two grown daughters. Her plans are to support her family and finish constructing her house so she has a secure asset. She wishes to buy construction materials to tile the earthen floor of her house and plaster the walls. This will create a better impression for her customers, as she runs her business from home. Rita started a small business selling clothes one year ago with her own funds. Her business goals are to increase her volume of sales and broaden her selection of merchandise. With this loan, her third loan request, she will be able to buy new merchandise such as shoes, clothes for men, women and children, toys and school supplies, securing better prices by buying in bulk. In such a way she will be able to increase her profits and achieve her goals.

Translated from Spanish by Sally Bolton, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a variety of clothes for children and adults

loans.name: Adolfo

texts.es: Adolfo es padre soltero, vive con su único hijo que estudia y es su fuerza de seguir trabajando. El se dedica a brindar servicio de mecánica y reparación de motos y motocarros, este trabajo lo viene realizando desde hace ya 10 años atrás, y le va muy bien, ya que su taller se encuentra ubicado en un buen lugar. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que sus clientes siempre se queden satisfechos de su buena labor, además, le proporciona buenas ganancias que le permiten solventar sus gastos en el hogar y los estudios de su hijo. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, por lo que se encuentra comprometido en ser puntual y responsable. Con el dinero que solicita quiere mandar a ampliar su taller de mecánica, y así poder recibir más vehículo para reparación.
texts.en:
Adolfo is a single father and lives with his only child, who is currently studying. Adolfo strongly desires to continue working. Adolfo works as an auto-mechanic, repairing motorbikes and motocarros (small three-wheeled vehicles often used for deliveries). He has worked as a mechanic for ten years and his business is very successful as his workshop is very well located. What he enjoys most about his work is that his customers are always satisfied with his repairs, and that it offers a good income which allows him to cover his living expenses and the cost of his son's studies. This is his first loan with MFP, and he is committed to repaying the loan punctually and responsibly. He will use the loan to expand his workshop, which will allow him to receive more vehicles for repair.

Translated from Spanish by Sally Bolton, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To expand his auto-repair workshop

loans.name: Rosa Elena

texts.es:
La Sra. Rosa tiene 40 años de edad, habita en el barrio Laureles Norte en la capital de Managua, estado civil casada, tiene tres hijos de 2, 7 y 12 años de edad todos estudian en la primaria, los planes para su familia es ofrecerle un mejor porvenir a sus hijos y un patrimonio para el futuro.
Doña Rosa se desempeña en su pequeño negocio de venta de comida casera, desde hace diez años de experiencia en la atención al cliente, es mejorar su negocio y ampliarlo e incrementar el volumen de venta mediante nuevas variaciones de comidas. Con esta solicitud del préstamo  lograra invertir en nuevos producto y herramientas de trabajos como: granos básicas para preparar los alimentos y perecederos, asador, nuevas mesas y sillas para brindarle al cliente una buena atención a si como captar nuevos clientes para obtener mejores ingresos con las ventas.
texts.en:
Rosa is 40 years old and lives in the Laureles Norte section of the capital, Managua. She is married and has three children in grade school, ages 2, 7 and 12. She hopes to offer her family, her children, a bright future and to leave them an inheritance. Rosa has a small business selling homemade food. She has ten years experience in customer service, and would like to improve her business, expanding it and increasing sales by offering new types of food. In order to increase her income and sales, Rosa plans to invest this loan in new products and appliances, such as staples and perishable items for food preparation, a grill, and new tables and chairs to provide for and attract new customers.

Translated from Spanish by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a grill, a plastic dining table and chairs

loans.name: Cacilda

texts.es: Cacilda  tiene 47 años, es viuda y vive con sus 3 hijos que son solteros e independientes y además la apoyan mucho. La actividad diaria que tiene esta madre trabajadora es la venta D. abarrotes, labor que lo viene realizando desD. hace un año en su casa. Lo que le gusta D. su trabajo es estar en contacto directo con sus clientes y vecinos, y con una gran disposición para atenderlos con alegría, para que así regresen en otra oportunidad. Esta actividad le está dando muchas satisfacciones personales y económicas, y debido a que se encuentra ubicada en un buen lugar y zona muy transitada, tiene buena venta diariamente. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, y se ha comprometido a ser puntual en sus cuotas. Con el dinero que solicita ampliará y ambientará mejor su negocio, para que se vea más atractivo, así será más cómodo para ella y para sus clientes.
texts.en:
Cacilda is 47 years old, a widow who lives with her 3 single and independent children who also proviD. her with a good deal of support. This hard-working mother is involved in the daily sale of groceries, an enterprise she has been carrying out for over a year from her home. What she likes most about her work is to be in direct contact with her customers and neighbors, and she attends to them with enthusiasm to ensure they return as other needs arise. This work gives her much economic and personal satisfaction, and due to being in a good location and in a zone that is well-traveled, she has strong daily sales. This is her first loan with MFP, and she is committed to being punctual in making the payments. With the money requested, she will expand her business so that it is more attractive and comfortable, thus better serving her and her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Lisette Artiga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expand and improve store

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen tiene 51 años de edad, es madre de 5 hijos que ya son independientes, y vive junto a su esposo quien la ayuda mucho. Ella se dedica a la venta ambulatoria de habas tostadas, maní salado y dulce, y palomitas, esta labor la viene realizando desde hace 4 años, y lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que se mantiene activa, además, conoce a muchas personas que degustan de sus productos y se convierten en sus clientes. Este negocio le da buenas ganancias para poder solventar los gastos en su hogar, y hasta el momento le está yendo bien. Es la primera vez que solicita un crédito con MFP, por lo que se ha comprometido a ser puntual en sus cuotas. Con el dinero que solicita mandará a construir un kiosco rodante para vender con mayor comodidad, sin preocupación por las lluvias.
texts.en:
Carmen is a 51-year-old mother of 5 independent children, and she lives with her husband who helps her a lot. As a traveling salesperson, she sells toasted beans, sweet and salted peanuts, and popcorn. She began her business 4 years ago, and likes that it keeps her active and that she has gotten to know many people who enjoy her products and have become customers. This business gives her a good profit that she uses to pay household expenses, and up to now it has been doing well. This is the first time she has requested a loan with MFP, and she is committed to being punctual in making the payments. With the funds requested, she will have a rolling cart built to be able to sell with greater efficiency, including during the rainy season.

Translated from Spanish by Lisette Artiga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of a rolling kiosk for her business

loans.name: Diana

texts.es: Diana tiene 23 años, es madre de una preciosa niña y vive junto a su conviviente quien la apoya mucho. Ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotes y productos de primera necesidad desde hace 2 años, en un espacio acondicionado en su casa, gracias a este negocio esta sacando adelante a su hija. Le es rentable porque cuenta con una fiel clientela que siempre consumen sus productos. Adicionalmente, su pareja también tiene un negocio propio, por lo que ambos aportan para el sostenimiento de su hogar. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, y se ha comprometido a ser puntual y responsable con su banco comunal y con sus cuotas de pago. Con el dinero que ha solicitado comprará más productos, además ampliará el espacio de su negocio para  dar una mejor atención a sus clientes y tener mejor surtida su tienda.
texts.en:
Diana is a 23-year-old mother of a precious little girl and she lives with her partner who supports her a lot. For the last two years she has been selling groceries and convenience items in a space at her house. Thanks to this business, she is forging ahead economically for the benefit of her daughter. It is profitable because she can count on loyal customers who always buy her products. Additionally, her partner also has a business of his own at which they both work to help support their home. This is her first loan with MFP, and she committed to being punctual and responsible in making the payments to the bank. With the funds requested she will buy more products, and also will expand her business space to provide better service to her customers and to have a greater assortment of goods in her store.

Translated from Spanish by Lisette Artiga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase store inventory

loans.name: Enrique

texts.es: Enrique tiene 27 años de edad, vive con su conviviente quien le dio una hermosa bebe, la misma que le inspira a seguir adelante. El se dedica a brindar servicio de transportes a pasajeros, a razón de ser propietario de un motocarro, esta labor la viene realizando desde hace ya 4 años, y lo que le gusta de su trabajo es dar un buen trato a sus pasajeros y sobre todo la confianza necesaria para que viajen seguros y así puedan buscarlo en otra oportunidad para pedirle su servicio. Su negocio le es rentable, ya que es él mismo maneja y administra su herramienta de trabajo, le va muy bien. Es su primer préstamo con MFP, prometiendo pagar puntual sus cuotas. Con el dinero que solicita va a remodelar a su motocarro, para lo cual debe de comprar los repuestos necesarios.
texts.en:
Enrique is 27 years old and lives with his common-law wife, who has given him a beautiful daughter, who inspires him to want to get ahead. Being the owner of a motorized buggy, for the past four years he has provided transportation services to passengers. What Enrique likes about his job is treating his passengers well, that they are confident of their safety and will look for another opportunity to request his services. His business is profitable and because he does his own driving and repairs he does very well. This is Enrique’s first loan with MFP and he has promised to make his payments on time. With the money from this loan he is going to refurbish his buggy and he needs to purchase the necessary parts.

Translated from Spanish by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Refurbishing his motorized buggy

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es: La Sra. Silvia tiene 55 años de edad, habita en el  barrio Laureles Norte, en la capital de Managua madre soltera, tiene cuatros hijos todos mayores por gracias de Dios logro sacar a delante a sus hijos y poner su propio negocio en su casa de habitacion, sus planes para su familia es brindarle un patrimonio sólido.La Sra. P. posee su pequeño negocio de casa de huésped, también vende cosmético al detalle y  al crédito desde hace diez años alquila un cuarto  para obtener otros ingresos y ayudarse económicamente. Sus objetivos en el ámbito laboral es ampliar y comprar nuevas líneas de productos. Gracias a los préstamos de Afodenic lograra comprar productos como: perfumes, pinturas de labios, esmaltes, zapatos y prenda de plata, generándole mayores utilidades y ofreciéndole a los clientes mejores y variados productos.
texts.en:
Silvia is 55 years old and lives in the Laureles Norte neighborhood of the capital, Managua. She is a single mother with four grown children. Thanks be to God, she has been able to help her children to prosper and has started her own business, a guest house. Silvia hopes to leave her family something worth inheriting. In addition to the guest house, she also sells cosmetics retail and on credit. For the past ten years she has rented a room to bring in more income and to help herself financially. Her goals are to expand and buy new product lines. Thanks to loans from Afodenic she has been able to buy products such as perfume, lipstick, nail polish, shoes and silver jewelry, generating higher profits and offering her clients better and a greater variety of products.

Translated from Spanish by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cosmetics, perfume and silver jewelry

loans.name: Karina

texts.es: Karina tiene 31 años, es madre de 3 hijos y vive con su pareja, quien le ayuda en todo. Ella se dedica a la venta de comida por las noches (arroz chaufa, chanfainita - plato a base de pulmón de cordero -, entre otras comidas criollas), este trabajo lo viene realizando desde hace 2 años atrás y lo que le gusta es preparar bien su comida para que sus clientes se sientan satisfechos de su buena sazón, también le agrada entablar conversación con todos sus comensales, mientras están en su puesto. Este negocio le está siendo rentable, debido a que para Karina, es una labor fácil de hacer y muy práctica, ya que le encanta cocinar. Le va bien en este trabajo, y no ha tenido dificultades hasta el momento. Este es su primer crédito con MFP. Y con el dinero que solicita quiere acondicionar un espacio más cómodo fuera de su casa para su negocio, ya que actualmente vende dentro de su casa.
texts.en:
Karina is a 31-year-old mother of three who lives with her partner who helps her extensively. Her business is selling food at night (fried rice, chanfainita - a dish of lamb's lung, among other criolla dishes). She has been running this business for two years. She enjoys preparing her food so her clients come away satisfied with her good cooking. She also enjoys conversing with her customers while they are at her stand. This business has been profitable because for Karina it is easy and practical work, since she loves to cook. She is doing well with the business and has had no problems to date. This is her first loan with MFP. With the requested funds she will build a more convenient space outside of her house for the business because she currently sells the food from inside her home.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Carreón, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a space for her business

loans.name: Lucía

texts.es: Lucía tiene 37 años, es madre de un hijo y vive junto a su esposo quien la apoya en todo. Ella tiene un pequeño taller de carpintería, con el cual brinda servicios diversos que tengan que ver con el trabajo en madera, en este negocio ya tiene 4 años, y lo que le gusta es dar un buen trato a sus clientes y conversar con ellos, además le es rentable, porque es la única persona en su zona que cuenta con este taller y le va muy bien. Es su primer préstamo con  MFP. Y con el dinero solicitado ampliará su taller, sobre todo quiere comprar más herramientas e instrumentos de carpintería.
texts.en:
Lucía is 37 years old, has one son, and lives with her husband, who supports her in everything. She has a small carpenter's workshop where she has been offering various woodworking services for four years. She enjoys providing good customer service and conversing with her clients. The business is profitable because it is the only one of its kind in the district, so she is doing well. This is her first loan with MFP. With the requested funds she will expand her workshop and buy more tools and carpentry equipment.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Carreón, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To expand the workshop and buy tools

loans.name: Mary

texts.es: Mary tiene 36 años de edad, vive junto a su conviviente y sus 4 hijos que estudian y la apoyan mucho. Desde muy temprana edad apoyaba a sus padres con la crianza de pollos, y ahora esta actividad la realiza personalmente desde hace un año, y le va muy bien. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es criar bien a sus pollos, y que estos estén con un peso exacto para su venta. Esta actividad le es muy rentable, ya que cada 28 días sus pollos ya están listos para la venta. Este es su 7mo préstamo con MFP, y es una persona responsable en sus pagos. Con el dinero que solicita mandará a construir un galpón más grande, y comprará más pollos bebes.
texts.en:
Mary is 36 years old and lives with her partner and four children who help her out quite a bit. Since she was very young she helped her parents to raise chickens. This has now been her personal business for the past year and it is going well. She enjoys raising her chickens well so they are at the optimum weight for sale. This business has been profitable since her chickens are ready for sale every 28 days. This is her seventh loan with MFP and she is responsible about making payments. With the requested funds she will have a bigger chicken hutch built and will buy more chicks.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Carreón, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a bigger chicken hutch

loans.name: Leticia Veronica

texts.es: La Sra. Leticia tiene 28 años de edad, habita en el  barrio La Primavera, en la capital de Managua,  casada su esposo es conductor de transporte urbano, tiene dos lindos hijos de 2 y 10 años de edad, sus planes para su familia construir su vivienda, dejándole un patrimonio seguro y sólido a sus hijos. Doña Leticia posee su pequeño negocio de variedades desde hace seis años, iniciándolo con préstamos, sus objetivos para su negocio a corto plazo es ampliarlo y aumentar el volumen de venta con nuevos productos, también invertir en una unidad de taxi. Con la solicitud del préstamo lograra comprar nuevos productos como: ropa para dama, caballero y niños, articulo de hogar, artículos escolares y juguetes para comercializarlo a nuevos mercados, generándole mayores utilidades.
texts.en:
Señora Leticia is 28 years old, married, and lives in the Primavera neighborhood of the capital city of Managua. Her husband is a conductor on urban transit. She has two handsome sons, ages two and ten. Their plans for the family are to build their house and leave a solid and secure inheritance for their sons. Doña Leticia's business is a small variety store which she started six years ago with the help of loans. Her business objectives in the short term are to enlarge the business and increase the volume of sales with new products, and also to invest in a taxi. With the help of this loan she will be able to buy new products such as: clothing for women, men and children, household articles, school supplies and toys. This will allow her to expand her business into new markets and generate increased profits.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Comprar ropa variada para niños, adultos y articulos escolares

loans.name: Miriam

texts.es: Miriam tiene 31 años de edad, vive con su esposo y sus tres hijos que la aman mucho. Ella se dedica a la pintura, en sociedad con su esposo quien es maestro de arte. Esta actividad la realiza desde hace 10 años atrás, juntos pintan paisajes con detalles regionales y venden sus cuadros. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es ver su arte realizado, ya que es su inspiración diaria y ver la satisfacción de quienes le compran. Es su 4to préstamo con MFP, demostrando ser una persona responsable en sus pagos. Con el dinero que solicita quiere poner su taller de pintura, y para eso necesita construir un local adecuado.
texts.en:
Miriam is 31 and lives with her husband and their three children, whom she loves very much. She earns her living as a painter, and is in business with her husband, who is an art teacher. They’ve been working together for the past 10 years painting regional landscapes, which they sell. What she likes about her work is seeing her art realized which, along with enjoying the satisfaction of her customers, gives her daily inspiration. This will be Miriam’s fourth loan with MFP and she has proven herself responsible in making her payments. She would like to open a painting studio, so she plans to use her loan to build out a suitable space.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construct suitable space for her painting studio

loans.name: Niza

texts.es: Niza tiene 23 años, es madre de un hijo y vive con su conviviente quien la apoya en todo. Hace 2 años se dedica a la venta de comida regional de forma ambulante, y lo que le gusta de su trabajo es dar muy buena atención a sus clientes. Además, le es rentable porque se encuentra ubicada en un lugar muy transitado y sobre todo, cuenta con una clientela selecta y fiel que degustan de su buena sazón. Lo único difícil para ella es no contar con un local propio. Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP, y ha demostrado responsabilidad en su crédito anterior. Con el dinero solicitado mandará a construir un kiosco, para vender sus platos de comida con mayor comodidad.
texts.en:
Niza is 23 years old, has one son, and lives with her partner, who supports her in everything. For two years she has been a street vendor selling regional foods. What she enjoys most about her job is giving very good service to her customers. Her business is lucrative, since she works in a high-traffic area and can depend on loyal customers who enjoy her delicious food. The difficult thing is that she does not have a storefront.

This is Niza's second loan from Kiva's partner MFP, and she has been very responsible in repaying her first. With this loan, she will build a stand to offer her customers a more comfortable place to enjoy her plates of food.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a kiosk for her business

loans.name: Nolita

texts.es: Nolita tiene 30 años, es madre de 3 hijos, vive con su esposo, quien la ayuda en su negocio. La compra y venta de madera, es la actividad diaria que tiene la señora Nolita, quien viene laborando en esto hace un año atrás, y le va muy bien. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que es una actividad tranquila y descansada, ya que ella solo trabaja por horas, además, le es rentable porque cuenta con clientes fieles que solo esperan que le llega su madera para luego comprarla. Es la primera vez que solicita un préstamo con MFP. Y con el dinero requerido comprará herramientas para talar y extraer madera, y también mandará a construir un local adecuado para almacenar su madera.
texts.en:
Nolita is 30-years-old and the mother of 3 children. She lives with her husband, who helps her with her business. She earns her livelihood by buying and selling lumber, which she has done for a year, and it is going well. What she likes about her work is that it is peaceful and restful, since she works alone for hours at a time. It is also profitable since she has loyal customers who just wait for their wood to be delivered so they can buy it. This is the first loan Nolita has requested through MFP. She plans to use the money to purchase tools for cutting and clearing lumber, and to construct storage space for the wood.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tools to build storage space for her lumber

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es: Patricia tiene 22 años, es madre de 2 niños pequeños, vive con su conviviente quien le da su apoyo en lo posible. Ella se dedica a vender ambulatoriamente gallinas y queso, su mejor punto de venta son los paraderos de los carros de las agencias de viajes. Esta actividad la viene realizando desde hace un año y lo que le gusta es conocer muchos lugares y sobre todo, a muchas personas que se sienten satisfechas de comprar sus quesos y sus animales. Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP, y en el ciclo pasado ha sido puntual en sus pagos. Con el dinero que solicita mandará a construir un kiosco para poner sus productos en exposición y lo compren con mayor confianza.
texts.en:
Patricia is a 22-year-old mother of two small children who lives with her partner who is very supportive. She is a traveling salesperson, selling chickens and cheeses, making her best sales at the stops for tourist buses. She has been doing this business for one year and she enjoys visiting new places and, more importantly, meeting the people who are satisfied with their cheese and animal purchases. This is her second MFP loan and she was punctual with the payments of her last loan. With the requested funds she will have a display kiosk built for her products to raise client confidence.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Carreón, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a kiosk for her business

loans.name: Pochita

texts.es: Pochita tiene 32 años de edad, vive con sus cuatro hijos y su conviviente quienes la ayudan mucho. Ella se dedica  al vender comida ambulatoriamente por los diferentes lugares de su zona, esto lo viene haciendo desde hace ya 2 años atrás, ganándose la confianza de todos sus clientes, quienes degustan de su buena sazón. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es dar a sus comensales lo mejor para que se sientan satisfechos, también le gusta preparar gran variedad de platos. Su negocio le es rentable, ya que su comida se vende como pan caliente. Este es su 7mo préstamo con MFP, y ha demostrado ser una persona puntual y responsable. Con el dinero solicitado quiere mandar a construir un kiosco para vender su comida con mayor comodidad.
texts.en:
Pochita is 32 years old and lives with her four children and her partner, who all help her quite a bit. For the past two years she has worked selling food by traveling to different locales in her area. She has built a satisfied clientele who enjoy her good cooking. She enjoys providing the best for her customers' satisfaction and preparing a great variety of dishes. Her business is profitable as her food sells like hotcakes. This is her seventh MFP loan and she has proven to be punctual and responsible. With the requested funds she will have a kiosk built to sell her food with greater ease.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Carreón, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a kiosk for her business

loans.name: Reyna

texts.es: Reyna tiene 25 años de edad, es madre de 2 hijos en edad escolar, y vive con su conviviente que es mecánico y la apoya  mucho. Ella se dedica a la venta de chorizos en un puesto del mercado, desde hace un año atrás, y lo que le gusta de su trabajo es dar una magnifica atención a sus clientes para que regresen a comprarle y la recomienden, además, le es rentable porque se encuentra en un punto estratégico del mercado por donde pasa mucha gente y casi no tiene competencia del mismo producto, estas ganancias permiten que poco a poco mejore su nivel económico. Esta es la primera vez que solicita un crédito con MFP. Y utilizará el dinero para la construcción de un kiosco para vender con mayor comodidad sus chorizos.
texts.en:
Reyna is a 25-year-old mother of two school-aged children living with her partner who is a mechanic and very supportive. For the past year she has worked selling chorizos (sausages) at a market. She enjoys providing excellent customer service so her clients will return as well as recommend her to others. The business is profitable as she is strategically located within the market with a lot of foot traffic and few competitors of the same product. The profits have allowed her to slowly improve her economic status. This is the first time she has applied for an MFP loan. She will use the money to build a kiosk to better sell her chorizos.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Carreón, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a kiosk for her business

loans.name: Irma Del Socorro

texts.es: La Sra. Irma tiene 28 años de edad, habita en el  barrio Villa Reconciliación de la capital de Managua, casada, tiene tres preciosos hijos de 8, 10 y 12 años de edad todo estudiantes, los planes para su familia es ofrecerle un porvenir mejor. La Sra. Velásquez tiene su pequeño negocio una tienda de ropa desde hace siete años de experiencia en ventas, sus metas es incrementar su ventas, generándoles mayores ganancias, lo inicio con fondos propios con esta solicitud del préstamo va a comprar ropa variada para niños y adultos, y comprar ropa escolares ya que viene el ingreso a clases y se vende bastante la ropa escolar y así obtener un ingreso económico para su hogar
texts.en:
Mrs. Irma is 28 years old and lives in the Villa Reconcilación neighborhood of Managua, the capital. She is married and has three precious children, 8, 10 and 12 years old who are students. She plans to offer her family a better future. Mrs. Velásquez has had her small business, a clothing store, for seven years and has experience in sales. Her goals are to increase sales and generate larger profits. She began with her own capital. With this loan application she is going to buy varied clothing for children and adults. She is also going to buy school clothing since classes start soon and school clothing sells well. This way she will have an income for her home.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Haynes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase varied child and adult clothing

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa tiene 33 años de edad, es madre soltera, vive con su pequeño hijo quien estudia y la quiere mucho. Ella  se dedica desde hace 3 años a la venta de productos de belleza como: perfumes, talcos, cremas en sus distintas variedades, etc., ya  que es  una mujer muy activa y con deseos de superación. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es buscar la forma de convencer a sus clientes para venderles sus productos, dar una muy buena atención es lo primordial, nos dice. Esta actividad le es rentable porque ella se ha ganado con este trabajo una gran gama de fieles clientes, por lo que le va muy bien hasta el momento. Este es su 3er préstamo con MFP, siendo una mujer muy responsable y cumplidora con sus cuotas de pago. Con el dinero requerido comprará una vitrina para colocar sus productos de belleza y exhibirlos con seguridad.
texts.en:
Rosa is a 33-year-old single mother who lives with her young son who studies and loves her very much. For the past three years she has worked selling beauty products such as perfumes, talcum powders, various types of creams, etc. She is very active and eager to improve her circumstances. She enjoys marketing her products to her clients and providing the best customer service, which is key, according to her. Her business is profitable because she has grown quite a gamut of faithful clients, so it is going well to date. This is her third MFP loan and she has been very responsible and reliable with her payments. With the requested funds she will buy a glass case to house her beauty products in order to display them more securely.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Carreón, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a glass case to display products

loans.name: Segundo

texts.es: Segundo tiene 38 años, es padre de un hijo pequeño y vive junto a su conviviente quien lo apoya. Su dedicación al transporte de pasajeros la tiene desde hace dos años atrás. Él es propietario de un motocarro, y lo que le gusta de su trabajo es conocer muchas personas y darles un buen trato es lo primordial, nos menciona. Su actividad le es muy rentable porque él mismo administra las ganancias de su trabajo y le va bien hasta el momento. Es su primer crédito con MFP, comprometiéndose a ser puntual en sus cuotas de pago. Con el dinero solicitado comprará repuestos para la reparación de su motocarro.
texts.en:
Segundo is 38-years old, has a young son and lives with his partner, who helps support him. He owns a motorcycle-rickshaw and has worked in transportation services for two years. What he likes about his job is getting to know different people and above all, providing his customers with good service. His work is very profitable because he manages his earnings himself. It is Segundo’s first loan with MFP, and he promises to be punctual in his repayments. With the money he has requested he will buy spare parts to repair his rickshaw.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of spare parts for motorcycle-rickshaw

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es: La señora Silvia es madre de 4 hijos que están estudiando, vive con su conviviente quien la apoya mucho. Ella es propietaria de un motocarro, el cual maneja su hijo, con el que realiza transporte público de pasajeros desde hace 4 años. Lo que le gusta de su negocio es que le es muy productivo y genera buenos ingresos. Además, como lo maneja su propio hijo, lo cuida es debido y las ganancias son solo para ellos. Lo difícil, es cuando las lluvias afectan el funcionamiento de su moto. Este es su 6to préstamo con MFP, siendo una persona puntual en sus pagos. El deseo de Silvia es comprarse otro motocarro, además de reparar su actual moto para que trabaje en buenas condiciones.
texts.en:
Silvia is a mother of 4 children who are in school and lives with her partner, who is very supportive of her. She owns a motorcycle-rickshaw driven by her son; he has worked in transportation for 4 years. What Silvia enjoys about her business is that it is very productive and earns good income. Also, since her son drives the vehicle, he takes good care of it and everything earned goes directly to the family. The work becomes more difficult during the rainy season, which can cause the rickshaw not to run properly. This is her 6th loan with MFP, as she is very punctual with her payments. Silvia wishes to buy another motorcycle-rickshaw, as well as keep the current one in good working condition.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of additional motorcycle-rickshaw

loans.name: Sofía

texts.es: Sofía tiene 27 años, es madre de 4 hijos y vive junto a su conviviente quien le da la mano en todos sus propósitos. Ella es propietaria de un motocarro, el mismo que lo maneja su conviviente quien se dedica al transporte de pasajeros desde hace 2 años atrás. Lo que le gusta de su actividad es que las ganancias le permiten solventar los gastos diarios familiares. Además, no tiene que pagar un chofer para ello, entonces eso acrecienta las ganancias para su hogar. Pero con lo que tiene que luchar a diario es con la competencia, ya que en esta zona de la selva los mototaxis abundan. Este es su 4to crédito con MFP, y en los anteriores préstamos ha demostrado ser responsable en sus cuotas. Con el dinero que solicita quiere mandar a reparar su herramienta de trabajo para que este en buenas condiciones.
texts.en:
Sofía is 27-years old, has 4 children, and lives with her partner who always gives her a hand with the ideas she has. She owns a motorcycle-rickshaw, which her partner has driven for two years. What Silvia likes about the work is that it allows her to cover daily household expenses. Also, she doesn’t have to hire a driver and this increases her income. At the same time, she has to compete against the many other motorcycle taxis that operate in the jungle region. This is Silvia’s 4th loan with MFP and she has shown herself to be responsible in repaying her prior loans. With the money she requests she will repair her taxi to keep it running in good condition.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair of motorcycle-taxi

loans.name: Yanet

texts.en:
