Yanet is a member of the Ayllu (which means “family” in Quechua) Village Bank. She is 30 years old and is married with two children. Yanet has a small store in her home, where she sells sweets in the morning. In the afternoon, she works in a sewing workshop making clothing. She works from 8 a.m. to 7 p.m. seven days a week. In the summer, Yanet leaves the city of Ayacucho to live and work on her family’s farm in the jungle. 

Yanet is requesting a loan of 1500 soles to put a roof on her home in Ayacucho. Her goal for the future is to buy more sewing machines (she currently has two) so that she can open her own clothing workshop.

loans.use: Build a roof

loans.name: Lourdes Zenobia

texts.en:
Lourdes is a member of the Ayllu (Family) Village Bank. She is 32 years old and is a single mother of two children. Lourdes owns a car, which she uses as an inter-provincial taxi between Ayacucho and Ocros, in the jungle. She hires a driver to drive the car, and she collects payments from passengers. She makes three to four trips per week.

Lourdes is requesting a loan of 1800 soles (US $600) to buy new tires and a new battery for her car. She usually uses her FINCA loans for automobile maintenance. 

Lourdes’s goal for the future is to buy another car with her FINCA savings and loans.

loans.use: Buy new tires and battery for taxi

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en:
Miriam is a member of the Ayllu (Family) Village Bank. She is 23 years old and lives with her common-law husband and their one young daughter, who is almost two years old. Miriam works at a beauty salon owned by her in-laws on Asamblea Avenue, one of Ayacucho’s main pedestrian streets. She, her husband and her husband’s two siblings work at the spa, offering a range of services from haircuts to dye jobs and perms. The spa is very popular; even Miriam’s loan officer is a client. 

Miriam is requesting a loan of 1050 soles to open a snack stand in the spa. She will use the loan to buy sweets and drinks to sell. 

Miriam’s goal for the future is to buy a plot of land to build a house on.

loans.use: Buy sweets and drinks

loans.name: Amelia Milagros

texts.en:
Amelia is a member of the Ayllu (Family) Village Bank. She is 26 years old and is married without any children. Amelia has a dry goods store on Independencia Avenue, one of Ayacucho’s main streets. She works alone seven days a week from 6am-12pm or 2pm, and from 4pm-9pm. She has been running the store for the past two years, and will soon start a second job working in an office as an administrator.  

Amelia is requesting a loan of 900 soles to start selling clothing in her store. She will buy the clothing in Lima, which is about 8 hours from Ayacucho. Her goal for the future is to have a country house of her own.

loans.use: Buy clothing

loans.name: Karina Ysabel

texts.en:
Karina is a member of the Las Golondrinas (The Swallows) Village Bank. She is 29 years old and lives with her common-law husband and their two young children. Karina has a store, where she sells car parts and accessories. The store is located in a rented space in an area with many mechanics’ shops; mechanics are her main customers. Karina works at the shop by herself seven days a week. She has been running her store for the past three years; prior to that she sold clothing. Her husband works in construction.

Karina is requesting a loan of 1200 to buy more car parts, like shock absorbers and timing belts. Her goal for the future is to open her own auto repair shop next door to her store.

loans.use: Buy shock absorbers and timing belts

loans.name: Remy Angelica

texts.en:
Remy is a member of the Desarrollo (Development” Village Bank. She is 25 years old and lives with her common-law husband and their two young children. Remy sells bread from a tricycle cart outside of a local bus terminal. She buys the bread from bakers, and resells it each afternoon when the buses come in. She works by herself, and has worked in this business for so long she cannot remember how many years it has been. Her husband works as a driver. 

Remy is requesting a loan of 600 soles to buy more bread. She would like to switch businesses and open a store some day.

loans.use: Buy bread for resale

loans.name: Gloria Teodora

texts.en:
Gloria is a member of the Desarrollo (Development) Village Bank. She is 40 years old and has four children. Her common-law husband is currently working in Spain, and sends her money each month for their family. 

Gloria used to sell prepared meals in the city of Ayacucho, but after food prices rose dramatically she decided it wasn’t a very good way to earn a living. Now, Gloria works on her guinea pig farm (guinea pigs are considered a delicacy in Peru). The farm used to belong to Gloria’s mother, who left it to her. Gloria now has her own home on the farm, where she is raising about 150 guinea pigs. She wants to breed even more guinea pigs to expand her business.

Gloria is requesting a loan of 800 soles to buy guinea pigs. Each guinea pig costs 9 or 10 soles, so Gloria should be able to buy 80-90 guinea pigs with the loan. Her goal for the future is to open a store of her own.

loans.use: Buy guinea pigs

loans.name: Mayra Luz

texts.es: La Sra. Mayra tiene 54 años de edad, vive en un barrio de la capital de Managua llamado Villa Venezuela, casada, tiene tres hijos de 20, 28 y 29 años de edad, los cuáles dos ya se independizaron y otra estudia. Los planes para su familia es ofrecerle un patrimonio y mejor .Doña Luz tiene su tienda donde vende ropas, zapatos, cosméticos y otros. Desde hace cuatro años con la experiencia necesaria en la atención al cliente, iniciándolo con fondos propios y pocas cantidades de productos. Ahora sus objetivos a corto plazos es aumentar de volúmenes de ventas lo cual incrementara las ganancias. Gracias a los préstamos de Afodenic lograra comprar nuevos productos como: perfumes, ropas para dama, caballero y niño, artículos del hogar y escolares para ofertar a sus clientes la variedad de sus productos
texts.en:
Mayra is 54 years old, married, and lives in the Villa Venezuela neighborhood of Managua. She has three children, ages 20, 28, and 29. Two of her children are no longer financially dependent on her, while one is a student. Her dream is to create a better life for her family.

Mayra has a shop where she sells clothing, shoes, cosmetics, and other items. Having experience in customer service, she began her business four years ago with her own money and few products. Her short term goal is to increase sales volume and thereby increase her earnings.

Thanks to loans from Kiva's partner AFODENIC, she will be able to offer her customers a greater variety of products, including perfume, school supplies, household items, and clothing for men, women, and children.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase clothing, perfume, and school supplies

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a member of the Inti (“Sun” in Quechua) Village Bank. She is 37 years old and is married with two children. Elizabeth is a stylist, and is planning to open a beauty salon in Ayacucho. She is originally from Ayacucho, but was living and working in Lima until recently, when she decided to move home and open a new salon. She is partnering with her sister in this business venture. Her sister is a masseuse, so the two plan to open a full-service salon. 

Elizabeth is requesting a loan of 1600 soles, which she will use to prepare and decorate the space in which she plans to open the new salon. 

Elizabeth has been a member of the Inti Village Bank for eight years now. She says she loves coming to meetings, since her mother, her sister, and her sisters-in-law are all members of the same bank and meetings are a nice space to share and be with family and friends. 

Elizabeth’s goal for the future is to open a full-service spa in Ayacucho.

loans.use: Prepare space to open beauty salon

loans.name: Obelisco Group

texts.en:
The Obelisco Village Bank is maD. up of mostly women, and all of the members are from Quinua, a town located about an hour from the city of Ayacucho. 

Faustina, Nelva and Juana are three members of the Obelisco Village Bank. 

Faustina is 36 years old and is married with four children. She has a store in a rented space, where she sells handicrafts like ceramic dishes and figures, alabaster sculptures (which are traditional of the Ayacucho region) and “retablos” (small, brightly painted scenes of traditional Ayacuchan life maD. from clay). Faustina runs the business with her family, who are all artisans. The family has been in this business for about ten years. They make some of their own crafts, and buy the rest from other local artisans. Faustina is requesting a loan of 300 soles to buy more handbags and key chains. Her goal for the future is to open her own restaurant. 

Nelva is 62 years old and married with four children. She owns a general store in Quinua, where she sells basic cooking ingredients like flour, sugar and oil as well as drinks, fruits and vegetables. She has had her business for eight years, and works with her daughter. They open the store from 5am to 10pm each day. Nelva is requesting a loan of 1200 soles to buy more rice, sugar and oil for her store. 

Juana is 41 years old and is married with six children. Like Faustina, she sells handicrafts in Quinua. Most of the work she sells is maD. from alabaster and clay. She makes some of it herself, and buys the rest from other local artisans. Juana has had this business for some time now, though she does not remember how many years it has been. She works at her store from 11am to 6pm, seven days a week. She is requesting a loan of 1200 soles to buy more handicrafts and more materials to do her own work. Juana says that FINCA has been a big help in paying for her children’s education. Most of her children are now adults with professional degrees, while others are currently enrolled in a local university.

loans.use: Buy rice, sugar, oil, handicrafts

loans.name: Fatima Del Rosario

texts.es: La Sr. Fátima tiene 31 años de edad, vive en Villa Reconciliación un barrio de la capital de Managua, casada su esposo es albañil, tiene dos lindos hijos de 7 y 10 años de edad lo tiene estudiando en un colegio de la capital, los planes para su pequeña familia es mejorar su nivel de vida y poseer un patrimonio en donde sus hijos puedan vivir seguros. Doña R. tiene su pequeño negocio de venta de ropa desde hace catorce años con diferentes dificultades económica a logrado mantenerlo, también de  llegar a ubicar locales por todo el sector de Managua con productos variados y de calidad. Gracias a los préstamos de Afodenic lograra comprar nuevo y variados productos como: Zapatos, ropa para dama, caballero y niño, perfumería, cosméticos y prendas de oro y platas, incrementando el volumen de ventas y generando mayores utilidades.
texts.en:
Fátima is 31 years old and lives in Villa Reconciliación, a neighborhood of the capital Managua. She is married to a builder and they have two beautiful children ages 7 and 10, who both study at a school in the capital. She hopes her small family can better their way of life and become wealthy enough so that her children can live secure of a bright future. Mrs. R. has had a small business selling clothes for 14 years. Through different economic difficulties, she has been able to maintain the business. She has also been able to establish local business throughout all of the area of Managua with various products of different quality. Thanks to the loans from AFODENIC, she will be able to buy new varieties of products such as shoes, women’s clothing, men’s clothing, children's clothing, perfume, cosmetics, garments of gold and silver. She will also been able to increase her volume of sales and generate better business.

Translated from Spanish by Julie Lutz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Comprar ropa,zapatos y cosmeticos

loans.name: Guadalupe Alejandra

texts.en:
Guadalupe is a member of the Inti (“Sun” in Quechua) Village Bank. She is a long-time member of FINCA Peru, and has been working with the institution since it began, 18 years ago. Guadalupe is involved in a variety of different businesses. She lives in the town of Quinua, about an hour from the city of Ayacucho. She has a food stand in Quinua, where she cooks and sells a variety of different traditional Peruvian dishes. She starts working at 6am each day, and works through the afternoon. FINCA Peru’s founder Aquiles Lanao, affectionately nicknamed Wiracocha (“Sun God” in Quechua), always visits her stand when he travels to Quinua, Guadalupe says. 

Guadalupe also has a business bringing truckloads of food, clothing, and other merchandise to small towns in the Peruvian jungle to sell. She makes a trip every two weeks or so. 

Guadalupe is requesting a loan of 1000 soles to buy sacks of rice and drinks for her food stand. She is proud to be a member of FINCA Peru, and even helped put together several other village banks in her town. She says that her work with FINCA has taught her to be more responsible, more hard-working, and has improved her relationship with her children. 

Guadalupe’s goal for the future is to take out larger loans so that she can buy more merchandise to take to the jungle to sell.

loans.use: Buy sacks of rice and drinks for food stand

loans.name: Hector

texts.en:
Hector is a member of the Cielo (Sky) Village Bank. He is 30 years old and lives with his partner and their two children. Hector works as a taxi driver, and transports passengers within the city of Ayacucho as well as to other nearby villages. He has been working as a taxi driver for eight years. Hector also conducts guided tours of local tourist attractions like the Wari ruins and the town of Quinoa; he gives his tours in Spanish and in Quechua. 

Hector was held up by highway robbers last August while returning from a town outside of Ayacucho. The robbers took the papers to his car as well as some of his car parts. He currently has some outstanding debt as a result of the cost of replacing these parts. 

Hector is requesting a loan of 750 soles to buy a new battery for his car. His dream for the future is to repay his outstanding debt and to build his own home.

loans.use: Buy a new car battery

loans.name: Yesica Lorena

texts.en:
Yesica is a member of the Cielo (“Sky”) Village Bank (Loan Group). She is 31 years old and has two children, who are three and four years old. Yesica sells Zara and Ripley brand clothing to individuals on special order. She has been in this line of work for the past three years. She travels to Lima (about eight hours by bus) at the end of each month to buy the clothing in one of the city’s plazas, then brings the clothing to Ayacucho to distribute to her clients.

L Yesica needs a loan of 600 soles to buy more women’s and children’s clothing for the holiday season. She sells a lot of clothing at the end of the year, when many people receive their end-of-the-year bonuses and buy Christmas presents. Her goal for the future is to open her own clothing shop in Ayacucho.

loans.use: To buy women's and children's clothing

loans.name: Edwing Antonio

texts.es: El Sr. Edwing tiene 36 años de edad, habita en el   barrio Villa Reconciliación en la capital de Managua, estado civil casado su esposa es docente de primaria, tiene dos hijos de 17 y 19 años de edad, Sus planes para con la familia es asegurarle un mejor provenir. Don Edwing tiene su pequeño negocio de trasporte selecto el cual genera sus ingresos desde hace tres años de ofrecerle a su clientela un viaje cómodo y seguro, sus metas que tiene a corto plazo es aumentar sus ingresos mediante la compra de nueva unidad de transporte. Con la solicitud del préstamo de Afodenic lograra hacer mantenimiento  a la unidad de taxi como: cambio de motor, cambio de tijeras y pintura, adquiriendo mejor presentación y capacidad de trabajo para dar un buen servicio a los clientes, como ganar más dinero.
texts.en:
Edwing is 36 years old and lives in the Villa Reconciliación neighborhood of Managua. He is in a civil union and his wife is a primary school teacher. He has two children, ages 17 and 19. He wants to provide a better future for his family.

For three years, Edwing has earned his living from a small taxi business, and he is proud to offer his clients safe and comfortable transportation. His short-term goal is to increase his earnings by purchasing a new taxi.

With this loan from Kiva's partner AFODENIC, he will perform maintenance on and make improvements to his taxi, including repainting, changing the motor, and buying a new jack. His taxi with therefore look and perform better and he will be able to provide better service to his customers and earn greater income.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase parts to maintain taxi

loans.name: Santa Catalina

texts.en:
Catalina is a member of the Señor de Luren Village Bank (Loan Group), which is named for the patron saint of Ica. She is 33 years old and is the single mother of two children. Catalina used to sell dry goods, but switched to clothing about five months ago. She buys clothing in Lima (the capital), and sometimes also buys shoes in Tacna (a highly-commerce city on the border with Chile). She sells her wares by special order to individuals. She travels two to three times per month, depending on how many orders she receives. The business has been doing quite well so far, she says.

Catalina is requesting a loan of 600 soles to buy more clothing in Lima. Her goal for the future is to build her own house and to open her own store.

loans.use: To buy more clothing in Lima to resell

loans.name: Luzmila

texts.en:
Luzmila is a member of the Señor D. Luren Village Bank (Loan Group), which is named for the patron saint of the city of Ica. She is 63 years old and widowed with eight children. Most of her children are now adults; her youngest son is 20 years old. Luzmila sells muyuchi ice cream in Ayacucho’s Plaza D. Armas on weekends and holidays. “Muyuchi” means “two turns” in Quechua (a local language). It is a traditional treat in the Ayacucho region of Peru and is maD. with fresh milk, shredded coconut, sesame, sugar and vanilla extract. Luzmila hand-churns her ice cream in a metal pot, which sits in a wooden washtub filled with ice. Spinning the pot in the ice water causes the liquid to splash up onto the sides of the pot and freeze up. Luzmila sells each small plastic cupful of ice cream for one sol (US 30 cents). On a good weekend, she earns 200 to 300 soles (US $65 to $100). Luzmila has been churning her own ice cream for 30 years. Her great-grandparents started making muyuchi ice cream years ago, and she has continued the family tradition.

Luzmila is requesting a loan of 2100 soles to buy sugar, shredded coconut and fresh milk. She will buy the milk from dairy farmers from the Alpachaca region, who deliver it to her the day before she plans to make ice cream so that she can mix it with the other ingredients and chill the mixture overnight.

Luzmila’s goal for the future is to finish paying off a plot of land she is buying, on which she hopes eventually to build a house someday.

loans.use: To buy more ingredients to make ice cream

loans.name: Gabriel Cirilo

texts.en:
Cirilo is a member of the Señor de Luren Village Bank, which is named after the patron saint of the city of Ica. Cirilo is 42 years old and is separated with five children. He has two businesses: he works as a taxi driver and also has his own carpentry workshop. He is mostly driving the taxi now, since wood has become more expensive recently and there is less demand for his skills as a carpenter. He has been driving his taxi for seven years, and has had the carpentry workshop for fifteen years.  

Cirilo is requesting a loan of 1050 soles to fix up his car. He plans to put in new upholstery and buy new tires. His goal for the future is to buy a motorcycle taxi next year so that his 15-year-old son can drive it.

loans.use: New tires and upholstery for taxi

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma has been a member of the Legion Village Bank for more than three years. She is 26 years old and lives with her common-law husband and their two children. She and her husband run two Chinese restaurants in the city of Ayacucho. Both are centrally located; one is on Manco Capac Avenue, while the other is near the Nery Market. She and her husband work as cooks and employ two people to help serve the customers. Norma has been in the restaurant business for seven years. 

Norma is requesting a loan of 2100 soles to buy more ingredients like rice, eggs, oil and condiments. She will travel to Lima’s Chinatown to buy the condiments. 

Norma’s dream for the future is to build her own house (she currently lives in a rental property).

loans.use: Buy rice, oil, eggs and Chinese condiments

loans.name: Mariela Elizabeth

texts.es: La Sra. Mariela tiene 23 años de edad, vive en el barrio Memorial Sandino en la capital de Managua, su esposo trabaja como vendedor, tiene una hija de 3 años de edad. Los planes para su pequeña familia es tener un patrimonio seguro. Doña Mariela se desempeña como Asistente de administrativa en una empresa privada de aseguradora y posee su micro empresa de transporte, el cual tiene dos años de experiencia laboral y en el sector trasporte tres años. Lo inicio con ayuda de su padre sus objetivos para su negocio es incrementar la flota de furgones obteniendo mayores utilidades. Gracias a los préstamos de Afodenic lograra comprar materiales de construcción como: cementos, hierros, bloques, ladrillos y zinc ampliando su vivienda y los sectores de la cocina, los cuartos ofreciéndole a su familia mayores comodidades y protección.
texts.en:
Mariela is 23-years old and lives in the Memorial Sandino neighborhood in the capital of Managua. Her husband works as a vendor and they have a 3-year old daughter. She hopes to build secure assets for their small family. Mariela has worked as an administrative assistant in a private insurance office for two years and has also had her own business in transportation services for 3 years. She started her business with help from her father, with the objective of increasing her fleet of vans for better utility. Thanks to loans from Afodenic, she will be able to buy construction materials such as cement, iron, blocks, bricks, and tin roofing to expand the kitchen and bedrooms of her house, offering her family a more comfortable and secure home.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials to finish her home

loans.name: Rosa Argentina

texts.es: La Sra Rosa tiene 38 años de edad, habita en el   barrio Healeah en la capital de Managua madre soltera, tiene dos lindos hijos de 7 y 12 años de edad lo cuales ha logrado salir adelante por sus hijos y gracias a Dios tiene una profesión, los planes para su familia es terminar de construir su casa para ofrecerle un patrimonio a sus hijos sólido y seguro. Doña Rosa se  desempeña como asistente de venta en una empresa tiene seis meses de trabajar y anteriormente trabajaba de contadora, sus metas en el ámbito económico es poder ganar mejor para realizar  todos sus objetivos,  esta es la tercera solicitud préstamos en  Afodenic, lo cual desea  comprar materiales de construcción como: cemento, hierro, bloques, ladrillos y zinc dándole una vivienda cómoda y segura a su familia.
texts.en:
Rosa is 38-years old and lives in the Healeah neighborhood of the capital, Managua. She is a single mother of two beautiful children, ages 7 and 12. For the sake of her children she works to get ahead and fortunately has a good job. What she wants now for her family is to finish building her house, which will be a tangible, secure asset for her children. Rosa has worked as a sales assistant for 6 months and previously worked as an accountant. Her financial goals are to be able to earn a better income, allowing her to achieve all her objectives. This is her 3rd loan request at Afodenic, with which she hopes to buy cement, iron, blocks, bricks, and tin roofing to complete a comfortable, safe home for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials to finish building house

loans.name: Jeny

texts.en:
Jeny is a member of the Universo (Universe) Village Bank. Jeny is 28 years old and is married with one son. She sells batteries, CDs, DVDs and other music-related materials, among other things. Jeny has a small store in her mother’s house, and employs two people to distribute her products, which she buys in the city of Lima.  Jeny needs a loan of 800 soles to buy wholesale CDs. Jeny dreams of expanding her business and of starting another business. 

 Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow

Jeny es socia del Banco Comunal Universo. 
Jeny es casada, tiene 28 años y 1 hijo, Yeny se dedica a la distribución de CD, DVD, Discos y todo material discográfico, pilas, entre otros productos, Jeny tiene un almacén en la casa de su mama, cuenta con 2 personas quienes se encargan del reparto de los productos, sus productos los adquiere de la ciudad de Lima. 
Jeny necesita un préstamo de 800 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de CD por mayor. 
Jeny sueña con ampliar su negocio, implementar otro negocio mas.

loans.use: Buy wholesale CDs

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is a member of the Universo (Universe) Village Bank.  Alicia is 36 years old and is married with two children. Alicia sells a variety of shoes at different regional fairs, to which she travels five times per week. She buys her products in Lima.  Alicia needs a loan of 800 soles to buy men’s shoes.  Alicia dreams of improving her business, of having more merchandise, and of opening her own store in a stable location.
 
 Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow

Alicia es socia del Banco Comunal Universo. 
Alicia es casada, tiene 36 años y 2 hijos, Alicia vende calzados variados en las diferentes ferias de la región a donde viaja 5 veces por semana, sus productos los adquiere en la ciudad de Lima. 
Alicia necesita un préstamo de 800 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de calzados de varón. 
Alicia sueña con mejorar su negocio, tener mas mercadería y tener un local propio y estable.

loans.use: Buy men's shoes

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en:
Catalina is a member of the Universo (Universe) Village Bank.  Catalina is 45 years old and is married with two children. Catalina sells prepared meals in the Nery Garcia Zarate Market. Catalina sells breakfast with the help of her children. She also makes weavings, like hallway rugs, which she sells in the city’s markets.  Catalina needs a loan of 1000 soles, which she will use to buy rice and sugar.  Catalina dreams that her children will grow up to be working professionals, of improving her two businesses, and of building her own home.
 
 Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow

Catalina es socia del Banco Comunal  Universo. 
Catalina es casada, tiene 45 años y 2 hijos, Catalina vende comida en un puesto del mercado Nery García Zarate, Catalina vende desayuno y cuenta con la ayuda de sus hijos. Además Catalina realiza artesanía en telar como pasadizos, y lo vende en los mercados de la ciudad. 
Catalina necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar. 
Catalina sueña con que sus hijos sean profesionales, mejorar sus negocios y construir su casa.

loans.use: Buy rice and sugar

loans.name: Eulogia

texts.en:
Eulogia is a member of the Señor D. los Milagros (Our Father of Miracles) Village Bank. Eulogia is 49 years old and married with eight children. Eulogia travels to different regional fairs, where she sells vegetables, grains, and flour. She buys other grains at the markets, which she then grinds into flour and resells in the Ayacuchan jungle, where she goes to buy her fruit.  Eulogia needs a loan of 1000 soles to buy grains. Eulogia dreams of building her own home, of improving her business, and that her children will graduate from college with professional degrees. 

 Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow

Eulogia es socia del Banco Comunal Señor D. los Milagros. 
Eulogia es casada, tiene 49 años y 8 hijos, Eulogia viaja a las diferentes ferias D. la región en donD. vendía verduras, cereales, harinas y D. las ferias compra cereales que luego procesa en harina y lo venD. en la selva ayacuchana D. donD. trae frutas. 
Eulogia necesita un préstamo D. 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. cereales. 
Eulogia sueña con construir su casa, mejorar su negocio y que sus hijos sean profesionales.

loans.use: Buy grains to make flour

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is a member of the Señor de los Milagros (Our Father of Miracles) Village Bank. She is 34 years old and lives with her common-law husband and their six children. Maria runs a restaurant in her home, where she works every day with the help of her daughters. On weekends, she prepares traditional Ayacuchan dishes like mondongo (tripe soup) and puca picante (potatoes and pork served in a special beet-peanut sauce). Maria needs a loan of 1800 soles to buy vegetables and decorate her restaurant.  Maria’s dreams are to save more to outfit her business and for her children to graduate with professional degrees. 

 Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow

Maria es socia del Banco Comunal Señor de los Milagros. 
Maria es conviviente, tiene 34 años y 6 hijos, Maria tiene un restaurante en su casa ubicado en una avenida, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda de sus hijas, además los días sábados y domingos prepara comida típica como mondongo y puca picante. 
Maria necesita un préstamo de 1800 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de verduras y para ambientar su restaurante. 
Los sueños de Maria son ahorrar mas para implementar mas su negocio y que sus hijos sean profesionales.

loans.use: Buy vegetables and decorate restaurant

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es:
La Sra. María, tiene 54 años de edad, habita en el  barrio Batahola, en la capital de Managua,  casada su esposo es comerciante, tiene dos lindos hijos de 26 y 18 años de edad ambos los tiene estudiando en la universidad, los planes que tiene para su familia es que sus hijos tenga un patrimonio y porvenir mejor doña Maria tiene un pequeño negocio miscelánea desde hace diez años de experiencia en  las
Ventas como atención al cliente en general, iniciando con la venta de productos básico y en pocas cantidades con capital propio, sus objetivos
En el ámbito económico es ofrecer a sus clientes diversificación de productos aumentando  el volumen de venta.
Gracias a los préstamos de Afodenic logrará comprar mayores cantidades de productos como: granos básicos, perfumes, cosméticos, productos enlatados, productos de higiene personal y de hogar, generándole mayores utilidades.
texts.en:
Maria is 54-years old and lives in the Batahola neighborhood of the capital of Managua. Her husband is a merchant and they have 2 beautiful children, ages 18 and 26, who study in the university. Maria wants her children to have property and a better future. She has owned a small general store for 10 years. She began by selling basic products in small quantities with a little of her own money, with the financial objective of increasing sales by offering her customers a variety of products. Thanks to the loans from Afodenic she will be able to buy greater quantities of products such as staple grains, perfumes and cosmetics, canned food, personal hygiene products, and household items, generating higher income.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of grains and various products to stock general store

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita D. sells vegetables and other dry goods in Agusan Del Sur. She is a widow and operates her store, alone, to earn the income she needs for the food that she eats. Because all of her four children were already married, she often times feels old and alone. She wants to help her children raise their kids by helping to support the children financial needs.  By operating a small store and joining the CEVI credit program, she believes she could help build a better future for her family.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more vegetables and goods to sell. She is also considering expanding her business and converting it into a mini-grocery store. In this way she could sell more goods and earn a bigger income. 

Because she is an active member of CEVI credit program, she receives credit assistance, trainings and insurance coverage which CEVI offers to all its clients.

loans.use: To purchase more vegetables and other dry goods.

loans.name: Central B1-Madina Group

texts.en:
N. Madina 29 is married with 4 children. Her husband is a mattress vendor in the city. Previously, she worked as a waitress, then 1 year ago, after saving some capital, she began selling Irish potatoes and matooke to customers in the Kikubwamutwe market. Every week she purchases an average of 10 sacks of Irish potatoes and 3 bags of matooke at the Owino market. A sack of potatoes goes for about Ush 55,000 from which she earns an average of Ush 15,000 as profit. Madina usually sells 1 bag of potatoes in 2 days.  

The loan will help Madina increase her stock of Irish potatoes and matooke. She has earned the loyalty of her customers by ensuring quality products and customer courtesy. However, Madina’s dream is to sell second hand clothes in the Owino market. She also aspires to support her husband in building a modern residence for their family and also to send their children to good schools.

loans.use: Purchasing more sacks of Irish potatoes and matooke.

loans.name: Daynor

texts.es:
Daynor  vive en la calle “Ana Barba “  de la zona de Achachicala en la ciudad de La Paz.
 
Vive junto a su esposa y su pequeño bebe, en una habitación la cual esta en alquiler.

Se dedica transporte urbano como chofer asalariado de taxi en una ruta central de la ciudad.

El crédito lo destinara en la adquisición de materiales y asi realizar algunas mejoras en su habitación ya que por temporada de lluvias se encuentran algunas pequeñas filtraciones en el techo. 
 
Es el primer  crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el crédito.
texts.en:
Daynor lives in Ana Barba Street, in the Achachicala zone of the city of La Paz. He lives with his wife and small baby in a rented residence. He works in the urban transport sector as a salaried taxi driver in a central part of the city. The loan will be used to buy building materials in order to make some improvements to his home, as there are some small leaks in the roof during the rainy season. This is Daynor's first loan with Impro. The assessment conducted by Impro classified him as a good candidate for a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Sally Bolton, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase building materials

loans.name: Martiza Lizet

texts.es:
La microempresaria Maritza Lizet Sáenz B. tiene 36 años de edad, es casada con 4 hijos, todos estudian en nivel primario y secundario. Desde hace más de 3 años esta señora se dedica a la venta de perfumes, cremas, colonias y otros productos de belleza que son utilizados por el sexo femenino.

Al igual que otras mujeres que se dedican a este tipo de actividad, Maritza ofrece sus productos con facilidades de pago a fin de hacer dicho productos mas accesible a su sector consumidor (en este caso las mujeres), las utilidades que genera este negocio es bastante atractivo, sin embargo por las facilidades de pago que ofrecen deben contar con un capital propio para poder enfrentar los pagos ya que también reciben estos productos al crédito pero con plazos relativamente cortos.

Por tal razón necesita que le financien para comprar los siguientes productos:

3 cremas humectantes a US$ 15 dólares cada una, 5 agua de colonia a US$ 05 dólares cada una, 5 mascarillas de proteína a US$ 04 dólares cada una, 3 perfumes Blams a US$ 20 dólares cada uno, 3 perfumes new blue a US$ 25 dólares cada uno y 3 perfumes Courd a US$ 25 dólares cada uno.
texts.en:
The micro-businesswoman Maritza Lizet Sáenz B. is 36 years old and married with four children. Her children are all studying in primary or secondary school. Maritza has worked for the past three years selling perfumes, creams, colognes and other beauty products for women. Similarly to other women who work in this field, Maritza offers her products for sale with a payment plan in order to make them more accessible to her customers. The income from this type of business is quite attractive, however because of the payment plan on offer the business owner requires their own capital to be able to make upfront payments. The business owner also receives the products on credit, but with a relatively short timeframe for repayment. For this reason Maritza is seeking a loan in order to purchase the following products: 3 moisturising creams costing US$15 each; 5 eau de cologne at US$5 each; 5 protein face masks at US$4 each; 3 Blams perfumes at US$20 each; 3 New Blue perfumes at US$25 each and 3 Courd perfumes at US$25 each.

Translated from Spanish by Sally Bolton, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise including perfumes and moisturising cream

loans.name: Elieser Jose

texts.es:
El microempresario Elieser José J. F. tiene 34 años de edad, es casado con 2 hijos menores de edad, tiene un tramo en el mercado municipal de esta ciudad de Bluefields desde hace mas de 10 años, el cual trabaja en conjunto con su papa Byron F. y quien aparece en la foto del negocio.

En este negocio se ofertan principalmente maíz, maní, cebada, trigo, arroz y otros productos que no es común encontrar en otros negocios del mercado municipal, además que sus principales clientes son pobladores de las comunidades que viajan a esta ciudad a comprar estos productos. Sin embargo para poder cumplir con sus clientes necesita comprar estos productos en grandes cantidades las cuales las hace viajando a la capital y para lo cual requiere obtener un financiamiento para la obtención de los siguientes productos:


5 Quintales de arroz nacional el cual compra a US$ 42 cada quintal, 5 quintales de frijoles el cual compra a US$ 45 cada quintal, 5 quintales de maíz blanco el cual compra a US$ 14 cada quintal, 5 quintales de maíz amarillo el cual compra a US$ 18 cada quintal, 3 quintales de maní el cual compra a US$ 75 cada quintal, 3 quintales de cebada en grano el cual compra a US$ 45 cada quintal y 3 quintales de trigo el cual compra a US$ 15 cada quintal.
texts.en:
The micro-businessman Elieser José J. F. is 34 years old, married and has two small children. He has operated a stall in the municipal market of the city of Bluefields for more than 10 years. He works in the stall together with his father Byron F., who is pictured in the photo above. They sell mainly corn, peanuts, barley, wheat, rice and other products not commonly sold by the other market stalls. Additionally their main clients are people from other communities who travel to this city specifically to buy these products. Nevertheless in order to satisfy their clients they need to buy these products in large quantities, and they need to travel to the capital to do this. For this reason Elieser is seeking a loan to buy the following products: 5 quintales (a weight measure equivalent to 46kg) of domestic rice at US$42 per quintal; 5 quintales of beans at US$45 per quintal; 5 quintales of white corn at US$14 per quintal; 5 quintales of yellow corn at US$18 per quintal; 3 quintales of peanuts at US$75 per quintal; 3 quintales of barley grain at US$45 per quintal; and 3 quintales of wheat at US$15 per quintal.

Translated from Spanish by Sally Bolton, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase food staples

loans.name: Glaris Elita

texts.es:
La microempresaria Glaris Elita W. B. tiene 58 años de edad es casada con dos hijos mayores de edad y desde hace mas de 20 años se dedica a la venta de verduras en el mercado municipal de esta ciudad de Bluefields.

Es una de las pocas mujeres de la etnia creole que inicio este negocio desde hace muchos años, ya que esta actividad solamente la realizaban mujeres de otros departamentos del país y algunas de esta ciudad de la etnia mestiza.

La señora Glaris es bastante conocida en esta ciudad y por tal razón es bien visitada en su negocio lo que le permite vender sus productos. Pero al igual que otras necesita que le financien para comprar los siguientes productos:

3 Quintales de repollo los que compra a US$ 75 dólares cada quintal, 3 quintales de cebolla las que compra a US$ 40 dólares cada quintal, 3 quintales de yuca las que compra a US$ 15 dólares cada quintal, 3 quintales de quequisque  los que compra a US$ 40 dólares cada quintal y 2 quintales de papa las que compra a US$ 45 dólares cada quintal.
texts.en:
The micro-businesswoman Glaris Elita W. B. is 58 years old, married and has two grown children. She has worked selling vegetables in the municipal market of the city of Bluefields for more than 20 years. She is one of only a few creole women who have worked in this business for many years. In the past only women in other parts of the country, and some mixed-race women in Bluefields, were involved in this activity. Glaris is quite well known in this city and for this reason she receives a lot of visitors to her stall to whom she can sell her products. She is seeking a loan to purchase the following products: 3 quintals (a weight measure equivalent to 46kg) of cabbage at US$75 per unit; 3 quintals of onion at US$40 per unit; 3 quintals of cassava at US$15 per unit; 3 quintals of taro at US$40 per unit; and 2 quintals of potatoes at US$45 per unit.

Translated from Spanish by Sally Bolton, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase vegetables

loans.name: Dawod

texts.en:
Dawod, the son of M. A., lives in Kabul, Afghanistan and is married with three children. He works selling towels and cosmetics which is why he needs the loan for his business, in order to develop it and to better help his family.

Dawod is requesting an individual loan of 50,000 AFN ($1,075) for term of 18 months to enlarge and progress his business, and to buy new towels and cosmetics for his shop.

He is very grateful for this opportunity and thanks all lenders of Kiva and AFSG that want to help with the poor people of Afghanistan.

loans.use: To enlarge his business and shop and to buy new towels and cosmetics

loans.name: Abdul Sabor

texts.en:
A. Sabor is the son of A. S.. He is single and lives in Kabul, Afghanistan, near the Afghan Hotel. He has a business of selling assorted towels, and thus needs a loan to develop his business since he is quite a beginner at it. 

A. Sabor is requesting an individual loan of 50,000 AFN ($1,075) for a term of 18 months because he wants to expand his business and to buy more clothes to complete the stock for his shop and to start working hard.

He is very grateful for these small loans available in Afghanistan and especially wants to thank Kiva and all lenders around the world.

loans.use: To expand his business and to buy the necessary stock for it

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a mill to grind maize and other grains in three villages

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
Mrs. Marie B. is a widow with five children.  When her husband passed away  three years ago, Marie started  a small business  by  selling shoes so that  she can make  some  profit  and take care of her children. Now the demand has grown up and her needs as well.  Marie would like to enlarge her business buy buying more shoes. Unfortunately she is limited financially and that why she is requesting a loan of 500 dollars. With the loan, she will be able to sell more shoes, make profit and pay back her loan  within 18 months.
Thank you so much for supporting her.

loans.use: Selling Women's, Men's  and Children's  Shoes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy Charcoal to sell

loans.name: Abigaelle

texts.en:
Mrs.Abigaëlle  K. is married and the mother of two children. She has had a hairdressing salon since 2004 and has been doing well. At present  she faces a large demand and on top of that, she also has 6 young girls as apprentices. This makes her salon  too small to accommodate the clients and the apprentices. Because of that, Abigaelle would like to enlarge and improve her salon to meet the basic standard for a hair salon and also to make it more attractive.She thinks that by doing so, she will be able to attract more clients. For these reasons Abigaelle has decided to request a loan of 500 dollars to be repaid in 17 months. 
Thank you for supporting her, her apprentices and her business.

loans.use: To improve her  Beauty Salon

loans.name: Ange

texts.en:
After graduating from business school a year ago, Mrs. P. Ange was still jobless. In order to meet her basic expenses such as rent and food, she has decided to pursue her mother's path by opening a small business to sell cakes.  In the local language, the cakes are called “bodocoin.” She sells these cakes in a school with 500 students. 

She earns a decent income from her business, but she remains limited financially to meet the high demand of her clients. Therefore she is requesting a loan of 500 dollars to expand her business and enable her to sell more “ bodocoin”, as well as orange and pineapple juice to her clients  By doing so, she will be able to make a profit and pay back for her loan within 18 months. She appreciates the support of those who are helping her fulfill her business dream.

loans.use: to make and sell more cakes

loans.name: Angel

texts.es:
El señor Angel R. tiene 53 años, es casado tiene tres hijos adultos, es mecánico desde niño, comenzó ayudando a su padre, da  trabajo  a dos personas en su taller e indirectamente a otras familias a su alrededor.
Hoy tiene su propio taller y también gracias a ello ha podido educar a sus hijos y ha podido poner a su esposa una despensa en su propio domicilio. Es una persona que ha progresado mucho en la vida y agradece a la Fundación Paraguaya por el apoyo que le han brindado.
Su deseo es seguir progresando.
texts.en:
Angel R. is 53 years old, and is married with three adult children. He has worked as a mechanic since he was a child, when he started helping his father. He employs two people in his workshop, and indirectly supports other families in his neighbourhood. He owns his own workshop and thanks to this he has been able to educate his children and set his wife up with a store that she operates out of their own home. Angel has achieved a lot in his life and is thankful for the support offered by Fundación Paraguaya. He hopes to continue to build a better life for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Sally Bolton, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase saws, sandpaper, oil, files and other material for his workshop

loans.name: Ponciano

texts.es:
El señor Ponciano tiene 61 años, esta casado y tiene cinco hijos, varios nietos, que son su razón de vivir. Hoy tiene su propio negocio y gracias a ello ha podido educar a todos sus hijos que hasta hoy en día van a la universidad.
El negocio es familiar, todos ayudan en la atención de los clientes cuando no están estudiando, hace 16 años que recibe el apoyo de la Fundación Paraguaya y esta muy agradecido por ello.
Su deseo es seguir progresando y que sus hijos puedan lograr tener una educación superior a la que El no alcanzó.
texts.en:
Ponciano is 61 years old and married with five children and several grandchildren, whom are his reason for living. Thanks to having his own business, he has been able to educate all of his children, some of whom are still attending university today. His business is a family business. When they are not studying, everyone helps with customers. It has been 16 years since he received help from the Paraguayan Foundation and he is very grateful. He hopes to continue growing and hopes that his children can achieve a higher level of education than he was able to.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sugar, milk, pasta, rice, bread, dairy products, meat, etc. for his store

loans.name: Rita

texts.es:
La  señora Rita tiene 59 años, es separada sin hijos , hace 25 años  que trabaja en esta actividad, es una persona muy emprendedora , sueña con tener  algún día casa propia  y ampliar su taller y así convertirse en fuente de trabajos para madres solteras ya que este es el sector menos apoyado por la sociedad.
Su deseo es seguir progresando.
texts.en:
Rita is 59 years old, is separated from her husband and doesn't have any children. She has worked in this field for the past 25 years. She is a very hard-worker and dreams of one day owning her own home and expanding her workshop so she can offer employment to single mothers, the segment of the workforce least supported by society. Her goal is to continue to build a better life for herself.

Translated from Spanish by Sally Bolton, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fabric, thread, zippers, buttons etc. for her workshop

loans.name: Teodolina

texts.es:
La señor Teodolina A.  tiene 48 años , tiene dos  hijos, mayores  no está casada ,  vive con sus hijos .  Hoy tiene su propio salón de masajes en su casa y también realiza esta trabajo a domicilio.
Hace mas de 20 años que se dedica a esta actividad y con su trabajo sacó adelante a sus hijos. Es una persona que ha progresado mucho en la vida y agradece a la Fundación Paraguaya por el apoyo que le ha brindado ya que hace mas de ocho años que trabaja con esta Institución.
Su deseo es seguir progresando y que sus hijos puedan lograr tener una educación superior.
texts.en:
Teodolina A. is 48 years old, is not married and lives with her two grown children. She operates her own therapeutic massage salon from her home, and also offers this service in the homes of her customers. She has worked in this field for more than 20 years, which has allowed her to support her children. She has achieved a lot in her life and is thankful for the support offered by Fundación Paraguaya. She was worked with this institution for more than eight years. She wishes to continue to build a better life for her family, and hopes her children can achieve a higher education.

Translated from Spanish by Sally Bolton, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase therapeutic massage products such as creams, oils, clothes and shoes for his business

loans.name: Esteban

texts.es:
El Sr. Esteban tiene 43 años y esta casado con la Señora Emilce Espinola y tiene dos hijos menores de edad.
El Sr. Esteban se dedica a la venta de mercerías y artículos para el hogar hace 10 años en varias ciudades como San Antonio, Guarambare, Ñemby, Limpio y otras ciudades aledañas a San Lorenzo. Las ventas y las cobranzas lo realizan el y su Sra. en forma semanal.
Anteriormente trabajaba con empleados que lo estafaron por ese motivo lo realiza de manera familiar y gracias a esto van creciendo comercialmente y lograron terminar la construcción de su vivienda.
Este crédito invertirá en la compra de sabanas y toallas.
texts.en:
Esteban is 43 years old, is married to Emilce Espinola and has two young children. Esteban has worked for the past 10 years selling haberdashery and homewares in a variety of cities surrounding San Lorenzo including San Antonio, Guarambare, Ñemby, Limpio and others. He and his wife make sales and collect payments on a weekly basis. Previously they had employees who swindled money from them, and for this reason they now operate as a family business. Thanks to this they have been able to grow their business and complete the construction of their home. This loan will be used to buy sheets and towels.

Translated from Spanish by Sally Bolton, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase sheets and towels

loans.name: Clemente

texts.es:
El señor Clemente A. es muy trabajador tiene 64 años trabaja los fines de semana con su esposa con quien esta casado hace mas de 30 años , tienen varios hijos mayores de edad casados y varios nietos .
Hoy tiene su propio negocio y gracias a ello ha podido sacar adelante a sus hijos, darle educación superior.
Su deseo es seguir progresando y agradece a la Fundación el apoyo que le ha brindado hasta ahora.
texts.en:
Clemente A. is a very hard-worker. He is 64 years old and works on the weekends with his wife, who he has been married to for more than 30 years. They have a number of adult children and grandchildren. He currently owns his own business and thanks to this he has been able to support his family and offer his children a higher education. His wish is to continue to build a better life for his family, and is grateful for the support offered by Fundación Paraguaya to date.

Translated from Spanish by Sally Bolton, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase rolls, film, cameras, products for his jewellery store, watch batteries, nets and other items

loans.name: Alfonso

texts.es:
El señor Alfonso tiene 38 años esta casado con la señora Maria de G., tienen tres hijos menores, vive en casa propia y hace 10 años que se dedica a esta actividad.
Con su trabajo logro progresar mucho ya que tiene una hermosa casa, una camioneta y una moto. Gracias a su trabajo hoy día da empleo a 5 personas quienes le ayudan en la venta y cobranza de sus más de 600  tarjetas de clientes.
Su idea es seguir creciendo para que sus hijos logren una educación superior.
texts.en:
Señor Alfonso is 38 years old. He is married to Maria de G.. They have three young children and live in their own home. They have been dedicated to this activity for 10 years. With his work he has progressed a lot and now has a beautiful house, a small truck and a motorcycle. Thanks to his work he now employs 5 people who help him with sales and the collection of their more than 600 client accounts. He wants to continue growing so that their children can have a higher education.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise such as sheets, towels, comforters, bedspreads, curtains, jeans, t-shirts, household utensils and other things.

loans.name: Pascuala

texts.es:
La señora Pascuala, esta casada con el Señor Juan Morel, tienen tres hijos, ya mayores de edad ,hace diez años que se dedica a la venta de ropas en el mercado de San Lorenzo.
Desea que sus hijos sigan estudiando y que tengan una profesión , sueñas con tener un  local de venta de calzado
texts.en:
Mrs. Pascuala V. is married to Mr. Juan Morel and they have three grown children. For the last ten years she has been selling clothes in the San Lorenzo market. Her wish is that her children will be able to continue studying and have a profession. She dreams of having a place to sell footwear.

Translated from Spanish by Lisette Artiga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of athletic shoes, shirts, and tee shirts.

loans.name: Tomas

texts.es:
El señor Tomas  es tornero, comenzó de ayudante en una fabrica de menajes de aluminio, Tomas tiene dos hijos,  está casado con la señora Manuela Figueredo . Hoy tiene su propio taller en su casa, fabrica los menajes de aluminio como cacerolas , sartén , compañeras ,etc.
 Dando trabajo ocho personas, es una persona que ha progresado mucho en la vida y agradece a la Fundación Paraguaya por el apoyo que le ha brindado.
Su deseo es seguir progresando y que sus hijos puedan lograr tener una educación superior a la que el alcanzo.
texts.en:
Señor Tomas is a lathe operator. He began as an assistant in a factory for aluminum household utensils. Tomas has 2 children. He is married to Señora Manuela Figueredo. Today he has his own workshop in his house. He manufactures aluminum utensils such as caseroles, frying pans, double boilers, etc. He employs eight people. He is a person that has progressed a lot in life and thanks the Paraguayan Foundation for the support that it has offered him. His wish is to continue progressing so that his children can have the higher education that he strives for.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To enlarge his workshop: purchase bricks and cement, contract bricklayers.

loans.name: Filomena

texts.es:
La señora Filomena M., tiene 36 años, esta casada con Blasido Lopez, tienen 4 niños menores, todos dependientes de ellos. Ellos tienen este negocio en un barrio  de  la ciudad de Ypané, que es donde viven.
Ellos proveen de alimentos, materiales de limpieza, productos básicos de la canasta familiar a sus vecinos. Ellos se levantan muy temprano para ir al Mercado de Abasto, lugar donde compran todo lo necesario para surtir la despensa, a su llegada ya están esperando los vecinos ansiosos para comprar los productos, ya que es el único almacén cercano de la zona. Con este negocio salen adelante ella y sus hijos, todos estudian, y tienen buena atención, el sueño de la señora Filomena es tener una máquina para cortar carne, de esta manera  va a expandir su negocio, además de esto generar puestos de trabajo en la zona. Ella espera ansiosa el crédito.
texts.en:
Señora Filomena M. is 36 years old. She is married to Blasido Lopez. They have 4 small children, all dependant on them. They have thier business in a neighborhood of the city of Ypané, where they live. They provide food, cleaning supplies and basic household products to their neighbors. They rise very early to go to the Market of Abasto, where they buy all that is needed to supply their pantry. On their arrival the eager neighbors are already waiting to buy the products, since theirs is the only local store in the area. With this business she and her children do well. They all study, and receive good attention. The dream of Señora Filomena is to have a machine to cut meat. In this manner she is going to expand her business, as well as generate jobs in the area. She anxiously awaits the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy flour, sugar, rice, noodles, milk, meat, eggs, yerba (herbal tea), bread etc.

loans.name: Lucina

texts.es:
La señora Lucina A. tiene 42 años, vive con sus dos hijos, quienes le ayudan en el negocio familiar, que es la venta de ropas usadas, este negocio es vital para la familia, ya que es su sustento diario. 
Ellos comenzaron el negocio aproximadamente hace 10 años, ella es madre y padre para sus hijos.
Los dos estudian gracias a su trabajo. Ella necesita de este crédito para seguir creciendo en capital económico y social, ya que indirectamente también ayuda a otras familias, pues da trabajo a otras señoras de la zona. En el futuro desea construir su propio salón, y así ampliar sus sueños.
texts.en:
Señora Lucina A. is 42 years old. She lives with her two children, who help her in the family business, which is the sale of used clothes. This business is vital for the family, since it provides their daily living. They began the business approximately 10 years ago. She is both mother and father for her children. The two children study thanks to her work. She needs this loan to continue growing in social and economic capital, since she also helps other families indirectly by giving work to other ladies of the area. In the future she wants to build her own salon, and thus expand her dreams.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy used clothing such as T-shirts, shirts, bermuda shorts, shorts, etc.

loans.name: Rolando

texts.es: El señor Rolando Verón es un joven de 20 años, es muy trabajador, trabaja desde los 15 años vendiendo cosas de primera necesidad para sus vecinos y luego amplio el negocio con mucho esfuerzo. Por eso necesita del crédito de la Fundación paraguaya para seguir creciendo y en un futuro tener su propio local, para estabilizarse. De este negocio depende la familia de el ya que su padre falleció y es el sustento de su madre y hermanos, el también va a la Universidad, pues es un joven visionario y sabe que el estudio es importante para el crecimiento de una persona en todos los ámbitos, esto lo ayudara a progresar mas en la vida, ya que tiene las ganas, solo falta el capital económico.
texts.en:
Mr. Rolando Verón is 20 years old, he is very hardworking and has worked since he was 15 selling essential goods to his neighbors and expanding his business with great effort. He needs credit from the Fundación Paraguaya to continue growing and to have his own store in the future to be stable. His family depends on this business because his father passed away and he supports his mother and brothers. He also goes to the university because he is a visionary young man and knows that studying is important to grow as a person in all areas; this will help him progress further in life because he has the desire, he only lacks the capital.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying blenders, irons, coffee makers, color TV, blender, hair dryer, toaster etc

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La Señora María tiene 50 años, tiene 2 hijos mayores, ella empezó vendiendo empanadas en la calle y luego de  mucho esfuerzo y con la ayuda de sus hijos logro montar una pequeña despensa .Ella le provee de alimentos, productos de limpieza a todos sus vecinos del barrio donde vive.
Es un verdadero sacrificio para ella porque se tiene que levantar en la madrugada para realizar sus compras en el mercado de San Lorenzo. En el futuro espera tener un negocio más amplio, para poder contratar gente, y así ayudar a su comunidad, y lo más importante darle estabilidad a su familia.
texts.en:
Ms. Maria is 50 years old and has 2 grown-up children. She started out by selling empanadas (stuffed pastry) on the street. Then after much effort and with the help of her children, she managed to set up a small general store. She provides food and cleaning products for the local residents.

This business is truly a sacrifice for her because she has to get up very early in the morning to buy products at the San Lorenzo market. In the future, she hopes to expand her business so that she can hire staff, thus helping out her community and more importantly, giving her family financial stability.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase flour, rice, sugar, noodles, milk, meat, eggs, herbs, bread, etc.

loans.name: Un's Group

texts.en:
This small loan group has been established by three borrowers, all residents of Battambang Province. The group leader, Mrs. Un S., is 35 years old and is a vegetable seller, as well as selling a little dessert from her home. She currentL. earns about $2 each day and started running her businesses more than two years ago. She is married with eight children, five of whom are single, and the other three are married. To help a little more with the famiL.'s expenses, one of her sons is employed as a construction worker, while her husband is a motorcycle taxi driver.

Un S. hopes to expand her business, but she is lacking the capital to do so; thus, she would like to appL. for a loan to build her side-workshop and then buy more vegetables for sale.

The other two borrowers:

Chan C., 52 years old, makes a living selling fritters. She asks for a loan to buy more ingredients to make the fritters for sale.

Bun L. is 57 years old. She is a dessert seller who is applying for a loan to enlarge her business.

loans.use: To decorate her workshop and buy more vegetables for sale

loans.name: Mahbuba

texts.en:
Mrs. Mahbuba A. was born in 1968 in the B.Gafurov region of Tajikistan. She was brought up in a multiple child family, and now she is the loving mother of three children, and a happy grandmother. She is proud of having a big family.

Mrs. A. works in Khujand in the local bazaar where she trades in assorted menswear. She brings her assortment from Istaravshan, and she has repeat customers. She has good taste, she is very polite and is an experienced businesswoman.

Mahbuba has been an active client since 2002 and she considers herself as a serious client. Mahbuba applies to Kiva with a request for a business development loan of 2000 STJ that she wants to use for the purpose of increasing her menswear assortment. Mrs. A. thanks Kiva for its precisious help and assistance in small-scale business development.

loans.use: To increase assortment of menswear

loans.name: Ly's Group

texts.en:
These three group members live in Battambang Province and are requesting this small loan.  Group leader, Mrs. Ly S. is 40 years old and a widow. She makes a living traveling from village to village selling soft drinks. She sells to her  neighbors, students, and passer-bys. Ly earns about $3 a day and has been in this business since 2005. She is a generous women that is responsible of five children who are single and attend school. One of her younger brothers lives with her and is employed as a fisherman. This helps with meeting the family's expenses. Ly needs to expand her business and is asking for a loan to buy more supplies of soft drinks to sell.

Res M. is 45 years old. She sells fish in the local market. Res requests a loan to buy more supplies of fish to sell for a profit.

Sman S. is 55 years old and a widow. She is a grocery seller who is applying for a loan to begin a new business, growing corn.

loans.use: To buy more supplies of soft drink for sale

loans.name: Baz Mohammad

texts.en:
Baz M. lives in Afghanistan. He is married with three children and he has a general store. He has been involved in this business for more than 5 years. He wants to make his business larger, and he needs more money for his business to become strong and to help support his family.

He has requested an individual loan of 50000 Afghani for the term of 16 months, to expand and progress his business and to buy the necessary materials to complete his stock for his shop.

He is very happy about this process of small loans in Afghanistan, and he wants to thank Kiva and AFSG in Afghanistan.

loans.use: He wants to expand and progress his business to buy the necessary materials to complete his stock for his shop

loans.name: Mam's Group

texts.en:
This small loan group is composed of four borrowers and the group leader, Mrs. Mam S., 45, is a local doctor. She is widowed with four children, three of whom are married and live away from home. One daughter, Miss Mam Samnang, lives in the family home; she sells groceries out of their house.

S. and her daughter work hard every day with the business. In order to grow the business and increase their grocery inventory so as to increase their income, S. would like to request a loan for her daughter's business.

The other three borrowers:

Phan N. is 56 years old and is a traditional music player. He provides his service for wedding parties and other ceremonies. N. requests a loan to buy a used motorcycle to ride.

Hang T., aged 49, provides a Khmer music service. He needs to ask for a loan to purchase a second-hand motorcycle to make his family transportation easier .

Phat L., 42 years old, earns a living by selling groceries. She is applying for a loan to purchase additional groceries for sale.

The borrowers live in Slorkram Commune in Siem Reap Province.

loans.use: To purchase grocery inventory for sale

loans.name: Ajmal

texts.en:
Ajmal lives in distract 10, in Kabul, Afghanistan. He is 32 years old, single and has a small internet cafe. He would like to make a loan to increase the size of his business which he uses to support his family.

He has requested an individual loan of 50000 afghan for a term of 12 months. He wants to expand his business and install new high speed internet connections in his shop. He also wants to buy two or three new computers and other building materials that he needs for his shop.

He is very happy with this new loan process available in Afghanistan. Now, every entrepreneur has it available to improve their businesses. He wants to thank lenders from all around the world.

loans.use: To buy computers and high speed internet connections

loans.name: Mom's Group

texts.en:
This is a small group of five members live in Siem Reap Province. Mrs. M. was selected to be the group leader. Mrs. Mom M., age 40, sells fish and vegetables which she transports to customers' homes. She uses a bicycle for her business. Her husband, Mr. Chea Sieng, is a bricklayer who earns around $2.33 a day. They have three children, all of whom are married and live away from home. Her business is going well, with an income of $2 per day. To increase her profits, M. would like to request a loan to purchase a motorcycle to use for her business and family. Mrs. M. is joined with four other members in this group loan; 
Phon N., 30, is widowed. She is a local fish seller who is requesting a loan to build a bathroom.
Nhoem S. aged 28, is a construction worker. He is applying for a loan to purchase chickens and ducks that he will raise.
Piv R., 39, is also a construction worker. He asks for a loan to repair his old house. (R.'s wife appears in the picture because he was not available)
San V., 53 years old, is a widow. She earns a living by selling vegetables. She requests this loan to buy a second-hand motorcycle to transport her vegetables to sell.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle

loans.name: Sengleang

texts.en: Mrs. Sengleang B., a 37-year-old widow residing with her daughter, who is a student, her mother, and one sister on an island of the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, has been a silk weaver for 15 years, a skill she learned from a relative. She sells her finished products to a middleman who resells them at the market in Phnom Penh, Cambodia’s capital.  Sengleang is now requesting a loan of $250 in order to purchase more silk material for her weaving business.

loans.use: To buy silk material for weaving.

loans.name: Sreymao

texts.en:
Sreymao P., 22 and single, resides with her mother, who is a silk weaver, a sister who has full time employment, and a brother on an island of the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Sreymao has been a silk weaver for seven years, selling her finished products to the middleman who then resells them at a market in Phnom Penh. She is now requesting a loan of $800 to purchase silk materials for weaving and a motorbike for her sister to commute to work.

loans.use: To purchase silk material for weaving and a motorbike for her sister to drive to work.

loans.name: Sinoeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Sinoeun L. and her husband, Mr. Senghorn Ton, both 49, who live along National Road Number One about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 1979 and have three children: two sons and one daughter. Two are married and live outside the family home while the third assists his parents in farming.

Sinoeun and her husband, who also farm, have been selling vegetable pickles for ten years. She is now requesting a loan of $500 to purchase a trailer to transport vegetables for sale.

loans.use: To purchase a trailer to carry vegetables for sale.

loans.name: Gakuweebwamunno Lending Group

texts.en:
Christine N. is the chairperson of Gakuweebwa Munno women’s group in Lugazi. She has over 10 years business experience in selling new clothes for men, women and children at daily markets locally termed as “mubuulo.” Using her loans from Pearl Microfinance, Christine is able to boost her clothing business by buying more clothes by the bale, hence providing her customers with variety, as she comes to Kampala twice a week for shopping.

She is married with four children and stays with her children since her husband stays and works in Kenya. This means that she cares for her children and dependants, and only considers their father as the head of the family. She believes that without borrowing, waiting for funds from her husband would have made her life hard.

loans.use: Increased stock for her clothing selling business.

loans.name: Som

texts.en:
Mr. Som S., 57, and his wife, Mrs. Touch Prem, 59, who live in a small village across the Mekong River about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 1971 and have five children: one son and four daughters. Two of their children are married and live outside the family home, while another two are garment factory workers, and the youngest attends school.

Som has been a farmer since he was a child, having learned the occupation from his parents, and he currently grows rice. His wife (shown in the photo), a scarf weaver since she was a child, learned the craft from her neighbor. Som is requesting a loan of $700 to purchase a motorized hand tiller for use on his farm.

loans.use: To purchase motorized hand tiller for use on his farm.

loans.name: Han

texts.en: Han P., 36, is a local farmer and a resident of Pursat Province where she has been growing rice and vegetable crops which she can grow twice per year, for a profit, since 1996. She now cares for four children; all of them are teenagers and students, while her husband is a fisherman and also works with her in the farming business. Before, she used to hire a buffalo from a neighbor for her farming activities. Now she hopes to have her own buffalo by requesting a loan to buy two buffaloes to help her with her farming and provide an extra asset. (She and her husband appear in the picture.)

loans.use: to buy two buffaloes to help her with her farming

loans.name: Siv

texts.en: Siv T., age 43, lives in Pursat Province. He is a local policeman and is currently earning a salary of $60 a month. His wife, Long Dina, aged 36, makes a living sewing clothes as a local tailor. She has a lot of customers and they recognize the good service she provides.  She has been earning approximately $2 per day, since 1998. The couple has no children. Siv hopes to launch a new business to provide additional income for the family’s needs. He would like to request a loan to buy fermenting equipment to produce wine for sale and purchase piglets to raise. This profits generated by this loan will improve their family’s living conditions. (siv T. was not available, so his wife is pictured instead)

loans.use: to purchase equipment to ferment wine for sale and purchase piglets to raise.

loans.name: Nhep

texts.en: Nhep S. is 52 years old and lives in Pursat Province. He earns a living by repairing motorcycles and bicycles. He is also a rice farmer, a business he started in 1990. His wife is a rice farmer as well and raises poultry at home for a profit. She is a good mother of three children, all of whom are single and help her with the farming work. Mr. S. is requesting a loan of $1200 to purchase motorcycle parts, like wheels etc.and a new investment, a motorcycle washing machine. S. appears in the picture of his workshop.

loans.use: to purchase motorcycle parts and a motorcycle washing machine

loans.name: Samnang

texts.en:
Mrs. Samnang S. and her husband, Mr. Si Nob, both 38, who live along National Road Number One about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 2000 and have three children: one son who attends school and two young daughters.

Samnang has been selling vegetables for three years, buying them from Kean Svay for resale at Chbar Ampov market in Phnom Penh. Her husband is a military policeman. Samnang is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase vegetables for resale.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Vuthy

texts.en: Mr. Vuthy K., 29, and his wife, Mrs. Sopheap Yong, 26, who live along National Road Number One about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 2005 and have one young son. They have been growing rice and green beans for ten years, a skill they learned from their parents, and in the future Vuthy wants to become a motor repairer. He is now requesting a loan of $700 to use for growing more rice and green beans.

loans.use: To grow more rice and green beans.

loans.name: Koem

texts.en: Koem S. is 58 years old a resident of Pursat Province where he has owned a plot of land since 1979. He grows rice crops, which he plants twice a year. He is a good father of seven children: four are single and three are married and live away from home. He is married to Horm Sen, age 57 who also is a rice farmer and raises pigs from their home. To help meet the hard physical labor of his farming work, four of his children are working with him.  Rice growing is Koems main source of earning income to sustain his family’s living conditions. S. is applying for a $700 loans to buy two water buffalo to use for plowing the fields..

loans.use: to buy two water buffalo

loans.name: Sambat

texts.en:
Mrs. Sambat V., 53, and her husband, Mr. Set Sam, 61, residents of an island on the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 1979 and have five children: two sons and three daughters. Two of their children are married and live outside the family home; two others are weavers, while the youngest daughter attends school.
	
Sambat has been a silk weaver since 1980, a skill learned from her neighbor. She sells her finished products to the middleman in the village, who then resells them at the market in Phnom Penh. Her husband has been a teacher since 1979.   

Sambat is now requesting a loan of $500 to purchase more silk materials for her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk material for weaving.

loans.name: Samnang

texts.en:
A 48-year-old widow, Mrs. Samnang T. has four daughters, two married, one a silk weaver, and the fourth a student. The family lives on an island of the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Samnang has been a silk weaver since 1984, a skill she learned from her neighbor. She sells her finished products to the middleman in the village, who then resells them in Phnom Penh. Samnang is now requesting a loan for $500 to purchase more silk material for weaving.

loans.use: To purchase silk material for weaving.

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Mrs. Sok Khroch, 55, is a widow with eight children:  three sons and five daughters. Five are married and live outside the family home; one son is a silk weaver and the other son is a monk. The family lives in a small village across the Mekong River about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Sok has been a silk weaver for 20 years, a skill learned from her neighbor. She sells her finished products to the middle man in the village, who then resells them in Phnom Penh. Sok is now requesting a loan of $400 to purchase more silk material for her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for weaving.

loans.name: Aun

texts.en:
Mrs. Aun P., 34, and her husband, Mr. Chrin  Em, 31, residents of an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 1993 and have two children: one son and one daughter, both attending school.

Aun has been a silk weaver since she was 16 years old, a skill learned from her mother. She sells her finished products to the middleman in the village, who then resells them in Phnom Penh. 

Previously a goldsmith, her husband has been driving a tuk tuk (motor taxi) in Phnom Penh for one year, and Aun is now requesting a loan of $200 to purchase a replacement trailer for his business.

loans.use: To purchase a new trailer for her husband’s motor taxi  business.

loans.name: Morl

texts.en: Morl S. is 28 years old and a resident of Pursat Province where she lives with her husband and their young child. Her child is a minor and attends school. She is married to Yem Phary who is 33 years old. The couple are local farmers and make a living by growing rice. They currently earn a revenue of approximately $4 a day, and they are both widely known for their business experience.
