He is very happy that this small loan process is available in Afghanistan. This helps small business people in Afghanistan. He wants to thank all lenders.
________________________________________________________________________

loans.use: To buy new tables and chairs for his restaurent

loans.name: Huriniso

texts.ru: Хуринисо женщина в возрасте 54 лет , замужем имеет 5 детей. Все дети семейные,сама Хуриниссо всю свою жизнь занимается откормом скота,а её муж продаёт на рынках Чайруха.На сегодняшний день у неё 15 баранов и 10 коз.Она решила взять кредит на увеличение количества скота.
texts.en:
Huriniso is 54 years old, married and has 5 children. All of her children have married now while Huriniso has spent her entire life raising cattle which her husband sells at the Chairuho markets. Currently she owns 15 rams and 10 goats. Huriniso would like to take out this loan to purchase more animals for her herd.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: cattle

loans.name: Alisher

texts.ru:
Алишер  ему 31 год ,женат имеет троих детей , проживает в Гафуровском районе , посёлке Хамробод.
он работает в колхозе,а в выходные дни занимается уходом за скотом.Когда его нет за скотом присматривает его жена.Сейчас у него одна корова и 10 баранов.Он хочет получив кредит закупить пару баранов.В их районе жизнь продвигается благодаря купле продаже скота. Алишер благодарен что есть такая возможность взяв кредит , увеличить свой скот.
texts.en:
Alisher is 31 years old, married and has three children. He lives in the Gafur region, in the Hamrobod village. Alisher works at the farming co-op and on weekends raises his own livestock. While he is at work during the week his wife takes care of the animals. Currently they own one cow and 10 rams. Alisher would like to take out this loan to purchase two more rams. In his region of Tajikistan most money is made by buying and selling cattle and Alisher is grateful to have this opportunity to take out a loan in order to increase his own herd.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: cattle

loans.name: Rorng

texts.en:
Mrs. Rorng H. is a villager in Svay Meas village in Kampong Cham province. She is a farmer who cultivates both rice and vegetables. She cultivates vegetables on a 2-hectare field. In this plantation, she now faces a problem because she does not have enough money to hire laborers to work on the field. In order to deal with this problem, Mrs. Rorng H. decided to ask for a loan to hire them for this purpose.

Mrs. Rorng H. is 26 years old and the mother of two children, one of whom is attending the local school, while the youngest one is too young to work or study because that child is at the age of two years old. Her husband, Mr. Thoung Thuy, is a pig breeder. Her husband is also presented with her in the picture.

loans.use: To hire laborers to work on the field.

loans.name: Esangul

texts.ru: Эсангул женщина в возрасте 53 лет, имеет 6 детей.Она домохозяйка, занимается откормом скота.В основном Эсангул занимается отдоем молока.Весь посёлок Хамробод покупает у неё хорошее ,жирное домашнее молоко, а также и кефир.Эсангул хочет в кредит купить ещё пару коров,чтоб увеличить производство молока и молочных продуктов.
texts.en:
Esangul is 53 years old and has six children. She is a housewife who also raises livestock, mostly for milk production. The entire village of Hamrobod buys fresh, rich cow milk as well as kefir/buttermilk from her. Esangul would like to buy two more cows for her herd so that she can increase the production of milk and soured milk products.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: cattle

loans.name: Vann's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Vann S. is a group leader of six, who are all living in Batheary village in Kampong Cham province. She is a farmer who cultivates rice on a 1 hectare field. In her plantation, she now faces a small problem because she does not have enough rice seeds to cultivate. In order to deal with this problem, Mrs. Vann S. decided to ask for a loan to buy more rice seeds for this purpose.

Her husband, Mr. Min Moeng, helps her in the plantation. Mrs. Vann S. is 54 years old and the mother of four children, two of whom help their parents on the plantation, while the remaining two attend the local school.

All the members in this group loan are end-of-term loans so they are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. These allow them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy more rice seeds for cultivation.

loans.name: So

texts.en: So H. is 60 years old and a widow. She currently lives in Siem Reap Province where she earns a living by raising pigs in a pigpen behind her house, raising them for their offspring and for slaughter. She has been running her business for more than three years and is currently earning approximately $3 each day. She has four children, three of whom are single and other one is married; they also work with her in pig raising. To help meet a little more of the family's needs, one of her daughters is employed as a cleaner for a company. H. is applying for a loan as capital to add to her savings to purchase more piglets to raise.

loans.use: To purchase piglets to raise

loans.name: Samorn

texts.en: Mr. Samorn K. lives in Chour Teal village in Kandal province. He is a farmer who owns a small piece of land and cultivates rice to earn a living. With this land, he now faces an obstacle. He does not have an  animal to plow the field. In order to solve this problem, Mr. K. decided to ask for a loan to hire a laborer with two oxen to plow the field. He would use the rest of the loan to buy fertilizer to strengthen the field and make his crop more productive. His wife, Mrs. Prak Yit, is a vegetable seller at the local market. Mr. Samorn K. has eight children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the other two help their parents with the businesses. The remaining four attend the local school. His wife is presented with him.

loans.use: to hire a laborer with two oxen to plow a rice field

loans.name: Rustam

texts.ru: Рустамчон парень в возрасте 29 лет , женат имеет 3 детей.Сам торгует на рынке Чайруха,козьим пухом.У него сейчас имеется одна корова и 10 коз.По мимо торговли он откормив скот продаёт его на рынках.Для увеличения мелкорогатого скота он решил взять кредит.
texts.en:
Rustam is 29 years old, married and has three children. He currently owns a cow and 10 goats. He sells goat down (cashmere fiber) as well as goats at the Chairuh market. Rustam would like to take out this loan to increase the number of goats in his herd.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: cattle

loans.name: Mrs. Mai Sman Village Bank Group

texts.en: The village bank loan group consists of thirty-two people who live in the village of Phum Saeprammuoy, in Kampong Cham province. Each of the members will use the loan for a different purpose. Mrs. Mai S. is the village bank loan group president who has been selected by the members. She is a farmer who owns a small plot of land and cultivates rice to earn for living. Her husband, Mr. S. Some, is a laborer who earns a small income. Together, they support the family. Mrs. Mai S. is 57 years old and the mother of two children who are all employed. Although Mrs. Mai S.’s family members work hard, they still do not earn enough income to support the family. In order to improve their living conditions, Mrs. Mai S. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow and start a breeding business. She hopes to increase her income after she sells the calves.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding.

loans.name: Em

texts.en:
Em S., 47, lives in Kompong Tom Province where she earns her living growing mushrooms on her own farmland. She takes 3 months to grow the mushrooms and then she sells them when they are mature, earning on average US$ 3 a day. She has been growing them for over two years now, so she has a lot of experience.

Em S. is married and has ten children; nine are single and one is married. Two of her sons are employed in Phnom Penh City: one is a driver and one is working for a restaurant. Her husband works with her in the mushroom-growing business. In view of the success of her business and wishing to enlarge it, Em S. is applying for a loan to purchase materials to prepare for growing mushrooms.

loans.use: to purchase materials for growing mushrooms

loans.name: Msasani Group

texts.en:
Millan J. is single. She owns a salon. She has been in this business since 2007 and works daily from 8am until 9pm.She is able to earn a monthly profit of about US$ 122.

This will be Millan’s second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the first loan to buy a dryer. She has paid the loan back successfully. She now hopes for a new loan to buy hair treatment products and display other items for sale in the salon such as bags and shoes.

Millan will share this loan with subgroup A of the Msasani group. The subgroup has 6 members; they run shops, sell clothes, food, and have salons. These members hold each other accountable in paying back their loans. In the picture, Millan is the 1st on the right wearing green.

loans.use: To buy salon equipment and start selling handbags and shoes

loans.name: Ernestina

texts.en: Ernestina A. is 26 years old. She is single but a mother with one kid. Currently, the kid is in school. She has been sewing for three years now. She is a specialist in female wears. Her skills and designs are of class. She sews various kinds of styles that give her customers a new look, like kids' school uniforms, church attire, kaba and slit, wedding dresses and funeral clothes etc. She wants to use the loan to buy increased supplies of sewing materials like linen, threads, thimbles, etc. to increase her output and efficiency. Through her dedication and hard work Ernestina has three apprentices to whom she is giving quality training for their future dependency. She hopes to increase her savings to provide her child with quality education. She is a member of the community group called ‘Sompa’ meaning Good servant Trust Group. She was so happy when she was visited at her business site and she was offered  free business advice on management.

loans.use: Ernestina wants to buy increased supplies of sewing material like linen, threads, thimbles, etc. to increase her output and efficiency.

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en:
Dorothy O. is 30 years old. She is a single woman with no kids. She lives with her family at Babiani in the Western region of Ghana.

For the past four years all Dorothy has been doing is baking bread. She says though it was difficult in the beginning she now sees changes in her business growth. She says she gives the best value for money by making sure that her food quality meets her customers' expectations. Her customers book their order in advance and before they come it is ready. She also retails to individuals for their morning breakfast.

She says the price of commodities is increasing which is making it difficult to buy more raw materials from the market. The daily demand for bread is high. She says she bakes at most 500 loaves of bread in day. Dorothy needs the loan to buy more bags of flour, sugar, margarine, milk and firewood. She is in a community group called Ebenezer trust group. We visited her when she was busily serving her customers.

loans.use: She wants the loan to buy baking materials like bags of flour, sugar, margarine, yeast and firewood.

loans.name: Muazzam

texts.ru: Муаззам заёмщица Микроинвест уже 3 год.Когда она начинала свою кредитную историю в Микроинвест у неё товарооборот составлял всего на 1500 долларов, а на сегодняшний день у неё три торговых точек.По реализации ей помогают её сыновья. У неё очень большой ассортимент женской обуви.Для завоза зимнего ассортимента она хочет получить 2500 сомони.Она от всей души поздравляет всех работников KIVA  и желает ей процветания и долгого сотрудничества.
texts.en:
Muazzam has been a borrower from MicroInvest for the past three years. When she began her business relationship with MicroInvest, her inventory turnover was 1500 dollars, and today she has three retail outlets. Her sons help her with sales. She carries a very wide assortment of women's shoes, and would like to obtain $725 to bring in her winter collection. She warmly greets all those who labor with Kiva and from the bottom of her heart wishes the organization prosperity and an enduring collaboration.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Footwear

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha B. is twenty eight years old. She is single with no children. She owns and operates a beauty and Rasta hairdo salon in her neighborhood. 
Martha is a very skillful and talented hair dresser who adds a lot of beauty to the hair of her many customers and that is her secret. Martha uses weavons and meshes to plait her clients' hair to add beauty to them. She has been doing this for four years now.  
She believes in efficiency and effectiveness of service and therefore she wants to use the loan to buy larger quantities of hair products like weavons, mesh, threads etc. to avoid shortage and poor servicing. 
She is in a community group called By His Grace. Training was organized for her so that when your help is given, she would be able to use it to achieve her business goal of increased efficiency and profitability.
Her picture was taken when she was busily plaiting her customer’s hair.

loans.use: To buy larger quantities of hair products like weavons, thread, needle etc.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce D. is twenty six years old. She is single and seriously looking for her better half. She owns and operates a Rasta hairdo salon in her neighborhood. Rasta hairdo is what most people called it which is plaiting your hair to look like thread. 
Joyce is a very skillful and talented hair dresser who adds a lot of beauty to the hair of her many customers and that is her secret. Joyce uses the weavons and meshes to plait her client’s hair to add beauty to them. For two years now this is what Joyce has been doing to take care of herself.  
She believes in efficiency and effectiveness of service, therefore she wants to use the loan to buy larger quantities of hair products like weavons, mesh, threads etc. to avoid shortage and poor servicing. As a result of this she has two beautiful young ladies as her apprentices, who she is training for their future career. 
She is in a community group called ‘Adehye’ meaning Royals. 
Training was organized for her so that when your help is lent she would be able use it to achieve her business goal to increase efficiency and profitability.
Her picture was taken when she was busily plaiting her customers' hair.

loans.use: To buy larger quantities of hair products like weavons, mesh, thread and needle etc.

loans.name: Chhun

texts.en:
Chhun K. is 29 years old and is a resident of Kompong Tom Province, where she owns a pigpen to raise pigs, as well as growing rice for daily income. With the businesses, she can earn around US$ 3 per day, and she has been doing this since 2005.

Chhun K. is married to Mr. Hong Voeun, 35, who makes a living catching fish for sale and also is a local palm climber. With the palm climbing, he can tap palm juice from palm trees, boiling it to make palm sugar or turning it into palm wine for sale. He is currently earning an average of US$ 3 a day to help feed his family. The couple has two children; both of them are still under their care.

K. and Voeun are facing difficulties with their living conditions; their house is not so good and small for them, thus they have decided to ask for a loan to purchase wood to repair their old house and some material to use for climbing palm trees.

loans.use: to purchase wood to repair their old house

loans.name: Umoja Charambe Group

texts.en:
Mlokozi M., 36, is married with three children ages 9, 5, and 1. He sells second-hand clothes. He started this business in 2000 and works daily from 8:30 am until 6 pm. He is able to earn a monthly profit of around US$ 80.

This will be Mlokozi’s seventh’s loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to increase the stock of his second-hand clothes business and has repaid the loans successfully. He now hopes for a seventh loan to buy more stock for the same business.

Mlokozi will share this loan with his loan group, Umoja Charambe, which totals 15 members. The members of the group hold each other accountable in paying back their loans. In the picture, Mlokozi is standing 1st from the left.

loans.use: To increase his stock of used clothes for re-sale

loans.name: Zubaida Khursheed Ahmad Group

texts.en:
Zubaida baji is a 53-year-old married lady. Her husband's name is K. A. and he is a daily wage laborer. She is the mother of four kids: three sons and one daughter. Her eldest son is a fruit seller selling seasonal fruit. Another is a daily wage laborer. Her youngest son is reading 6th standard. Her daughter is also reading 6th standard.

Zubaida baji is a seamstress. She has been sewing clothes for the past 4 years. She uses her income to pay the school fees of her children. She is applying for a loan to buy seasonal fruit to expand her eldest son’s fruit-selling business.

Zubaida baji is the group leader for some more women from her locality. Nasreen baji wants a loan to pay the installments on her auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Shamim baji wants a loan to buy utensils and flour to re-sell. Shamshad baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. Fozia baji wants a loan to buy medicines for her pharmacy.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy seasonal fruit for re-sale

loans.name: Akua

texts.en:
Akua A., a 33-year-old young woman, is married, blessed with four children, and is a very hard-working trader. She enjoys selling and cosmetics sales have been her major source of livelihood for the past eighteen years. She says the selling of cosmetics is lucrative and her experience in the market has enabled her to gain many loyal customers. 
Her shop is located at a strategic place in the market; fortunately she is the first contact on entering the community market where she sells. 
Akua believes that with the loan, she would be more resourced to purchase more stock of cosmetics like pomade, hair cream, lipsticks and jewelery to increase her inventory and her income for that matter. Akua also sees it as a need to add other things that her customers ask for frequently such as vegetables like onions and peppers.  
She is a member of a group called Adehye Trust Group. 
Her picture was taken when she was busily serving a customer in the market place of Babiani where she sells.

loans.use: To buy more stock of cosmetic products and vegetables.

loans.name: Kate

texts.en: Kate T. is a 32 year old wife and mother of one child who is attending school. She has been a food vendor for the last five years. She prepares and sells kenkey, a local dish prepared from milled maize and eaten with all kinds of sauces and soups . It is a delicacy many Ghanaians enjoy everyday, as a breakfast, lunch or dinner. She also sells rice with stew. Kate sells her prepared food at the main market center in Babiani. Her business is doing well and she wants to expand her operations to serve more customers. With the loan, she would like to purchase more maize, grains, vegetables, rice and assorted meats, for her operation. Kate hopes this loan will help increase her income and improve her family's well being. She would be very grateful for that assistance. The photo was taking when she was shopping for her next day business supplies.

loans.use: To buy bags of dried maize, grains, rice, vegetables, assorted meat, etc

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace M. started her fish sales thirty-five years ago in Babiani, the western region where she lives. Grace prepares and serves her customers with very tasty and good quality dried fish and has many customers who buy from her stand in the market. She is now 60 years old and married with twelve children. Unfortunately, two have passed away but currently she is sending two of them to school.

Grace wants to use the loan to buy an increased inventory of assorted fish so as to make increased sales and income to support her children’s education and her business growth. She belongs to the community group called "God is Good" Trust Group. She was very happy when we interacted with her during a visit to her at her business site. She exclaimed that the loan would enable her to earn more so as to cater for her kids in school.

loans.use: to expand her inventory of smoked fish

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia A., 47, is married and has three children. The children are still in school. She owns and operates a grocery shop and sells items like sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, cooking spices, table salt, skimmed powdered milk, and biscuits, etc. at the community market in her neighborhood. With the loan, she wants to purchase more crates of assorted drinks, bags of sugar, cartons of vegetable oil, boxes of biscuits, etc. to increase her inventory.

Cecilia hopes to improve her savings to support her children who are in school. Cecilia A. belongs to a community group called Ebenezer Trust group. Cecilia says your support would boost her business, increasing the number of customers she serves a day.

loans.use: To buy more cartons of assorted drinks, bags of sugar, etc.

loans.name: Doussouba

texts.fr:
Madame  Doussouba D. est âgée de 34 ans et vit dans une famille monogame avec son mari et ses 2 enfants au quartier pelengana Nord de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Malgré les études de secretariat, elle mènait parallèlement des activités génératrices de revenus. Son apprentissage s’est effectué auprès de sa mère  une grande commerçante très connue au niveau de la ville de Segou. Ainsi elle a su concilier ses activités scolaires et ses activités commerciales(des habits, des articles divers).
Depuis 4 ans que ses études viennent de prendre fin, elle ne mène que cette activité d’achat et de vente d’habits notamment les bazins. Elle est sollicitée lors des cérémonies de mariages, de baptêmes et les grandes fêtes de l’année.
Dans le souci de satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante elle fait recours à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso. Elle est son 1er prêt individuel pour un montant de 375 000 FCFA.
Elle compte utiliser ce prêt pour acheter, 2 pièces de bazins riches .Elle s’approvisionne auprès de commerçants à partir du Burkina Faso, de la république du  Sénégal et de  Bamako (capitale de la république du Mali). Madame Doussouba D. vend au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Avec ce prêt elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 100 000 FCFA qui servira à prendre certaines charges familiales et faire face à certains évènements sociaux.
texts.en:
Mrs.Doussouba D. is 34 years old and lives in a monogamistic family with her husband and two children in the Pelengana district of North Segou (the fourth administrative region in the Republic of Mali). Although she studied to be a secretary, she was also active in businesses that earned income.She was taught by her mother, who was a well known business woman in the city of Segou. She was, therefore, well educated in both school and business activities (sales of suits and assorted articles). These studies ended four years ago and since then she has specialized only in buying and selling suits, notably made of bazins (damask cloth). She is solicited for weddings, baptisms and popular holidays during the year. In order to satisfy her ever increasing clientele, she has joined the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance bank. This is her first individual loan request for the amount of 375,000 FCFA. She plans to use the loan to buy 2 pieces of high quality bazins cloth.She will purchase the material from suppliers in Burkina Faso in the Republic of Senegal and in Bamako, capital of the Republic of Mali. Mrs.Doussouba D. sells for cash or credit and her clientele are both men and women. With this loan the hopes to earn an income of 100,000 FCFA, which would be used to meet family expenses and to prepare for certain social events.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase high quality bazin (damask cloth)

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca A. A. started selling fish thirty years ago in Babiani, the western region where she lives. Rebecca also prepares and serves her customers with very tasty and good quality dried fish and has many customers who buy from her stand in the market. She is now 45 years old and married with six children.

Rebecca could not earn enough money to pay for all of the children to go to school, so only two of them are in junior high school. She wants to use this loan to buy increased stocks of assorted fish to make increased sales and added income to pay for her children’s education and support her business' growth.

Rebecca belongs to the community group called ‘Okyeso Nyame’ Trust Group. She was very happy when we interacted with her during our visit to her at her business site. She explained that the loan would enable her to earn more and cater for her kids in school.

loans.use: to buy more stock of smoked fish

loans.name: Shamim M. Hanif Group

texts.en:
Shamim baji is a 43-year-old married lady and resides in a city called Borewala, Pakistan. She owns a two-room brick house and has lived in it with her family for the past 25 years. Her husband's name is M. H. and he is a driver, driving a rented auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle).

Shamim baji is the mother of four sons. Her eldest son has a flour-selling business. Another is a daily wage laborer. The others are getting education from a school which located near their house. Shamim baji has a knitting business with 6 years' experience making clothes. She does this work to pay the school fees of her younger sons. She successfully repaid her first two loans from Asasah (a micro-finance institute in Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle) for her husband so that he will able to get all the profit from his hard work.

Shamim baji is the group leader for some more women from her locality. Sabran baji wants a loan to buy cooking oil to re-sell. Rashidan baji wants a loan to buy vehicle spare parts to re-sell. Amna baji wants a loan to buy raw materials (cooking oil, spices, and flour) for her Punjabi food (Samosas and Pakodas) making business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle)

loans.name: Koniba

texts.fr:
Madame  Koniba  D. est âgée de 30 ans, elle vit avec son mari et ses 4 enfants  dans une famille monogame au quartier Darsalam de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Très tôt elle abandonna l’école en classe de 6ème pour s’occuper de sa mère handicapée. Elle mena les activités génératrices de revenus vente d’emballage au marche (pour assurer la quittance journalière) ensuite ce fut la vente de gâteaux. Après toutes ces aventures commerciales elle décida de se spécialiser dans la vente de pâte d’arachide depuis 6 ans. Elle jouit d’une grande réputation et  ses principaux clients sont les enseignants qui lui font la commande chaque mois et les Maliens résidants à l’extérieur surtout en France où elle reçoit fréquemment des commandes.
Pour faire sa pâte d’arachide, elle procède au triage  de graine après le décorticage, puis elle procède au grillage pour  ensuite les faire moudre au moulin. Après cette phase elle met la pâte dans des seaux de 5kgs, 10kgs et 20 kgs.
Dans l’optique d’agrandir son fonds de commerce pour faire face à sa demande clientèle de plus en plus grandissante  qu’elle fait recours à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso  avec qui elle est à son 1er prêt.
Elle compte acheter,  8 sacs d’arachides auprès des producteurs d’arachide de la zone de Kita (capitale de l’arachide du Mali). 
Madame  Koniba  D. vend au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée principalement de salariés.
 Elle compte réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel 50 000FCFA, qui lui permettra d’aider son mari dans la prise en charge des dépenses familiales. Son rêve est de construire une maison
texts.en:
Mrs. Koniba D., 30, lives with her husband and 4 children in a monogamous family in the Darsalam neighborhood of Ségou (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali.) She left off her studies very early on, when she was in 7th grade, to take care of her handicapped mother. She began working to earn income: selling packaging materials in the market (to cover daily expenses), and later on selling cakes. After these commercial ventures, she decided 6 years ago to specialize in selling peanut butter. She has a great reputation and her principal customers are teachers who place an order with her every month and Malians living outside their country, especially in France, who frequently send her orders. To make her peanut butter, she sorts through the shelled peanuts then roasts the peanuts before grinding them in a mill. After this is done, she puts the peanut butter in buckets containing 5 kg, 10 kg, or 20 kg. Looking to expand her working capital so as to keep up with ever-growing customer demand, she became a member of Soro Yiriwaso, a micro-finance institution with whom she is presently requesting her first loan. She intends to purchase 8 sacks of peanuts directly from the producers in the Kita area (the peanut capital of Mali). Mrs. Koniba D. sells on both a cash and a credit basis to a clientele composed principally of salaried employees. With this loan, she expects to make a monthly profit of 50,000 F CFA which will permit her to help her husband out with family expenses. Her dream is to be able to build a house.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of bags of peanuts

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary Y. has been selling vegetables in the local market of Babiani in the Western Region of Ghana, where she lives with her family. She is a 22-year-old woman and still single. She is a busy petty trader who sells tomatoes and other foodstuffs such as beans, onions, peppers, carrots, green pepper and salad leaves on the top of a table in the market.

Mary does not have sufficient working capital to run the business which retards her business progress. With the loan, she wants to inject more working capital into the business to purchase increased stocks to revive the business. She believes the loan will enable her to purchase good quality merchandise to upgrade her inventory. She would be grateful for that assistance. She is pleading for your assistance.

loans.use: To purchase increased stocks of palm oil, tinned tomatoes, yams, onions, beans, maize, dried fish, etc.

loans.name: Mariatou

texts.fr:
Madame  Mariatou D.  est âgée de 38 ans, elle vit avec son mari et ses 4 enfants au quartier Bougouni lafiabougou de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
N’ayant pas été à  l’école  à cause de la pauvreté jumelée à l’analphabétisme de ses parents, elle débuta très tôt les activités génératrices de revenus auprès de sa mère quand elle ne savait même pas compter l’argent. Après cette phase d’initiation riche d’enseignement et d’expérience, elle commença la vente des condiments alimentaires au marché de Ségou depuis 20 ans et jouit d’une très grande  notoriété Ces marchandises soigneusement emballées sont disposées sur une étagère.
Dans le souci d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaire qu’elle fait recours à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant trois ans. Après  3 prêts solidaires (prêt de groupe) et 1 prêt individuel tous correctement bien remboursés, elle est à son 2ème prêt individuel.
Elle compte utiliser ce prêt pour acheter, 2 cartons de cubes magies ; 1 carton de concentrées de tomates et 2 sacs de sels. Elle s’approvisionne en ces matières premières auprès de grossistes  à Bamako (capitale du Mali).
Madame Mariatou D.  vend au comptant ou à crédit à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes et de quelques hommes. 
Elle envisage de réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 45 000 FCFA qui servira à subvenir à es propres besoins et investir le reste dans les affaires. Son vœu le plus ardent est de construire une maison.
texts.en:
Mrs. Mariatou D., 38, lives with her husband and their four children in the Bougouni Lafiabougou neighborhood of Ségou (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

Never having attended school due to poverty as well as her own parents' illiteracy, she began to earn her living early on, working together with her mother, at an age where she didn't yet know how to count money. After this initiation, a phase rich in learning and experience, she began to sell various condiments in the Ségou market 20 years ago and enjoys an excellent reputation. Merchandise that has been carefully packaged is displayed on her shelves.

Wishing to increase her turnover, she came to the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso 3 years ago. After receiving a share in three group loans and then one individual loan, all correctly reimbursed, she is on her second individual loan.

She intends to use this loan to buy 2 cartons of Maggi cubes, 1 case of tomato concentrate, and 2 sacks of salt. She buys her stock of these staples from the wholesalers in Bamako (capital of Mali).

Mrs. Mariatou D. sells both for cash or on credit to a clientele composed essentially of women and a few men. She expects to make a monthly profit of 45,000 F CFA which will allow her to support herself and to reinvest in her business. Her greatest desire is to be able to build a house.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of condiments for re-sale

loans.name: Niamé

texts.fr:
Madame Niamé D. est âgée de 37 ans, divorcée et mère de 2  enfants elle vit chez son oncle dans une famille polygame au quartier Pelengana Sud de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
 Pour des raisons sociales elle abandonne l’école en classe de 9 ème pour se consacrer aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment le commerce. Après en avoir tenté plusieurs  elle opte pour  la fabrication d’encens et la vente d’articles de parfumeries. Cette activité elle l’exerce depuis 12 ans et jouit d’une grande réputation qui aujourd’hui   dépasse le seul cadre de Ségou car elle a  des clients venants des 4 coins du Mali et même de l’extérieur  en France et aux Etats Unis etc.
La fabrication de l’encens qui relève plus de  dextérité et d’un savoir faire n’est pas une entreprise facile. Pour faire de l’encens elle utilise du sarakatané, qu’elle dilue dans des eaux de colognes (au nombre de 11) ensuite elle met l’encens préparé pendant 15 jours dans des bouteilles portant des étiquettes à son effigie.
Dans le dessein de renforcer et de diversifier son activité qu’elle fait recours à l’institution de microfianace Soro Yiriwaso avec qui  elle est à son 1er prêt.
Elle compte l’utiliser pour acheter 2kgs de magnonkisséni horon, 5kgs de sarakatané ou djékalani et 7 bouteilles d’eaux de colognes. Elle s’approvisionne en matière première  à Ségou auprès des commerçants de la place. Niamé D. vend au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes qui sont du Mali et de l’extérieur.
Avec ce prêt elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 100 000FCFA  qui lui servira de se prendre en charge surtout qu’elle est célibataire et subvenir aux charges de ses 2 enfants. Son ambition est d’ouvrir une boutique de parfumerie.
texts.en:
Mrs. Niamé D., 37, is the divorced mother of 2 children and lives in her uncle's household, in a polygamous family in the Pelengana Sud district of Ségou (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). For familial reasons, she left school early on to undertake income-generating activities, notably commerce. After having tried selling this and that, she finally decided to produce incense and sell perfumes and such. She has been in this business for 12 years now and has a very good reputation--and not only in Ségou. She has customers from all over Mali and even from France and the United States, etc. Making incense calls for knowledge and dexterity and is no easy undertaking. To make incense she uses "sarakatané", which she dilutes in various colognes (up to 11), then she puts the prepared incense in bottles bearing labels with her likeness for 15 days. Wishing to expand and diversify her business, she turned to the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso, with whom she is presently requesting her first loan. She intends to buy 7 kg of incense ingredients and 7 bottles of cologne. She buys her raw materials in Ségou from local merchants. Niamé D. sells on a cash or credit basis to a clientele composed of men and women, in Mali or overseas. With this loan, she expects to make a monthly profit of 100,000 F CFA which will permit her to support herself, especially in view of the fact that she is single, and to support her two children. Her ambition is to open a perfume shop.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of perfumes and cologne for re-sale

loans.name: Nusrat Almas M. Irshad Group

texts.en:
Nusrat Almas baji is a 39-year-old married lady. Her husband is M. I. and he has a food production and selling business. He has 20 years' experience in this business. She lives in a city called Borewala, Pakistan. She is the mother of four kids: two sons and two daughters. All of her children are getting an education from a school which is located near their house.

Nusrat baji helps her husband prepare Punjabi food for sale. She is a very responsible lady. She provides Punjabi food on time to his hotel. Now Mr. I. has decided to start driving an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle) since Nusrat baji is able to handle his food business very well. She is applying for a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle) for her husband to use.

Nusrat baji is the group leader for some more women from her locality. Zahida Parveen baji wants a loan to buy bicycles to re-sell. Salma baji wants a loan to buy clothes to re-sell. Manzooran baji wants a loan to buy utensils to re-sell. Khursheed begum baji wants a loan to buy beams for her shuttering business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle)

loans.name: Salma Sohail Khalid Group

texts.en:
Salma baji is a 42-year-old married lady. She is married to a person whose name is S. K.. He has a construction supplies business. She lives with her family in a city called Borewala, Pakistan. She is the mother of two children: one son and one daughter. Her daughter reads in 7th standard and her son reads in 5th standard.

Salma baji stays at home and spends her time sewing clothes. This activity rewards her in the form of money. She invests her money in a revolving committee and plans to renovate her house when it is her turn to get the amount. She is applying for a loan to buy more construction supplies (sand, cement) to expand her husband’s construction supplies business.

Salma baji is the group leader for some more women from her locality. Naseem Akhtar baji wants a loan to buy utensils to re-sell. Kalsoom Akhtar baji wants a loan to buy to buy a buffalo for her milk-selling business. Sakina baji wants a loan to buy wood to re-sell. Rukhsana baji wants a loan to buy materials (beads, cloth, and colored thread) for her decorative embroidery business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy construction supplies

loans.name: Bilquis M. Ashraf Group

texts.en:
Bilquis baji is a 38-year-old married lady and resides in a city called Borewala, Pakistan. She has lived in this city for the past 20 years. She married to a person whose name is M. A.. He has a utensil-selling business with an experience of 15 years in this business.

Bilquis baji is the mother of four sons. None of her children goes to school. Bilquis baji helps her husband sell utensils in the community and her husband sells utensils to the other parts of Borewala. She is applying for a loan to expand her husband’s business by buying more utensils.

Bilquis baji is the group leader for some more women from her locality. Nusrat baji wants a loan to buy a sewing machine for sewing clothes. Razia baji wants a loan to buy a handset for her PCO (Public call office: people come to make phone calls and pay a set rate per minute). Lubna baji wants a loan to buy goats for her animal-selling business. Farida Khanum baji wants a loan to buy eggs for her egg-selling business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy utensils to re-sell

loans.name: Babacar

texts.fr: Cet homme agé d'une cinquantaine d' années est marié et pére de plusieurs enfants .Son principal activité est la vente de paille d 'arachide  et d'aliment de betail.Avec la fin de d'hivernage la paille d 'arachide  pricipal aliment des chevaux se vend a bon maerché .c'est le moment de renouveller les stocks en vu de preparer de saison seche période de forte demande en paille d' arachide.Aissi le pret sollicité servira à renforcer ses capacités de stockage.
texts.en:
This gentleman, who is around 50, is married and the father of several children. His primary business is selling peanut straw and other livestock fodder. With the end of the rainy season, peanut straw, the principal fodder for horses, goes for a low price. This is the moment to stock up in order to prepare for the dry season, when peanut straw is in great demand. So the requested loan will be used to expand his capacity for warehousing.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Kalsoom Abdul Rasheed Group

texts.en:
Kalsoom baji is a 48-year-old married lady and resides in a city called Borewala, Pakistan. She has lived in this city with her family for the past 19 years. Her husband's name is A. R. and he is a milkman with an experience of 7 years. Kalsoom baji is the mother of five children: three daughters and two sons. Her sons are drivers and drive an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Her eldest daughter works in a cotton factory. The others are getting an education in a school which is located near their house.

Kalsoom baji is involved in a sewing business. She sews clothes, but she makes embroidered dresses also. She gets orders from her neighborhood and charges US$ 2 per dress stitched. She does this work to improve the living standard of her family. She is applying for a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle) for her elder son because he presently drives a rented auto-rickshaw and doesn't take home the whole amount of his earnings.

She is a group leader for some more women. Razia baji wants a loan to buy wood to re-sell. Salma baji wants a loan to buy materials (beads, colored thread) for her decorative embroidery business. Nasreen baji wants a loan to buy goats for her animal-selling business. Saleema baji also wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle).

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle)

loans.name: Abida Parveen Abdul Razaq Group

texts.en:
Abida Parveen baji is a 35-year-old married lady and resides in a city called Borewala, Pakistan. She owns a two-room brick house and has lived in it with her family for the past 5 years. She is an uneducated lady but she doesn’t hesitate to mention the reason, namely, that her father had few financial resources. Her husband's name is A. R. and he is a driver and drives an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). She is the mother of five children: three sons and two daughters.

Abida Parveen baji's son makes bodies of vehicles called auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). The other children are enrolled in a local school in her neighborhood. Abida Parveen baji has a sewing business. She sews clothes for her neighbors, charging US$ 2 per dress. She uses her income to pay her children’s school fees. She is applying for a loan to repair the auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle) of her husband.

She is the group leader for some more women from her locality. Sugran baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Rubina baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. Nasreen Akhtar baji wants a loan to buy land on contract to grow vegetables to sell. Shamim baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To repair an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle)

loans.name: Margaret Shu

texts.en:
Born on 24th June 1967, Margaret is married to John Shu  and they have four children; she lives in Ngomgham, within the urban township of Bamenda, Cameroon.  With this loan, Margaret plans to invest in her provisions store.  More specifically, she will add off-licence to the provisions store, purchase two phones for her callbox (telephone booth) business, firewood and raw foodstuffs.  
 
This is Margaret's fifth loan; she has been a member of GHAPE since September 21st, 2004. She has a great deal of experience in her provisions store business; added to that, she will be selling wholesale as well as retailing.  Over the years, her customers have increased on a regular basis. She also feels that she has an excellent site for her business. 

Last year Margaret was emotionally disturbed when her house was scattered by the council, and she had to carry her family to beg a house and sleep inside. Finally, Margaret was seriously attacked by thieves and carried everything in her provision store from which she struggled to recover.

She plans to repay the loan in 24 months and the first installment of repayment shall be made on the fourth month from the date of disbursement.

The profit from this loan will be used to pay her children's school fees.  She will also invest much of her profit back into her business.  The rest will be used to clothe her children well, provide medical assistance for her family, and feed her family.  
 
The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: Purchase of corn, beans, groundnuts, oil, and firewood, call centre

loans.name: Shamim Akhtar Habib Hussain Saqib Group

texts.en:
Shamim Akhtar baji is a 53-year-old married lady. She is married to a man whose name is H. H. S.. He runs a medical store in the community. He completed his education up to 10th standard. Shamim baji lives in a city called Borewala, Pakistan. She is the mother of one son whose age is 8 and who is in kindergarten.

Shamim baji stays at home and sews clothes, taking orders from her neighbors. She shares a part of her income with her husband because inflation is increasing rapidly and it’s difficult for a single person to bear the expenses of the family. She is applying for a loan to buy medicines for her husband’s medical store.

She is the group leader for some more woman from her locality. Zareena baji wants a loan to buy milk to re-sell. Jinda baji wants a loan to buy mason's tools. Zulaikha baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. Maqbool baji wants a loan to buy goats for her animal-selling business. Irshad baji wants a loan to buy clothes for her clothes-selling business. This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy medicines for medical store

loans.name: Xiomara Isabel

texts.es:
La Señora Xiomara Isabel B. Díaz tiene la edad de 46 años, su estado civil es casada, Doña Xiomara tiene 2 hijos de los cuales sus edades son las siguientes su hijo de 16 años de edad cursa recientemente el 4 año de secundaria u su hijo menor de 9 años cursa el 4 grado de primaria, su compañero de vida labora contador de la empresa de Enacal, sus propósitos son de obtener los ingresos necesarios de su inversión por lo que la situación en la que nos encontramos es muy difícil y el único medio de ayuda  que presentamos actualmente en el país son las micro financieras y las organizaciones en el exterior que nos tienden la mano sus deseos son de tratar de salir adelante cada día para mejorar su situación económica y sus sueños son de engrandecer su negocio para asegurar el prometedor fututo de estudios de sus hijos.


La actividad económica es la de mercadería en general en la que expande los productos como: topa interior, bisuterías, zapatos y sandalias, la ubicación de su negocio es de forma ambulante, el tiempo que tiene de poseer su negocio es de 3 años, sus inicios se dan por cuenta propia por lo que tenia que luchar por sus propósitos y es así como empieza este negocio con pocos productos y empezó a distribuir su producto por lo que no tuvo resultado ya que mucha gente no le pago la mercadería por lo que mas tarde decide invertir solo en ropa y empieza a dividir a su mejores clientes para realizar la distribución de sus productos y es así como obtiene su negocio, el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo por lo que tiene que efectuar la compra de oro laminado en Managua y ropa de varón y también están los diferentes lugares de León  donde le venden de forma favorable para sus productos y agradece a Fundación y las organizaciones amigas para que se pueda realizar el financiamiento.
texts.en:
Xiomara Isabel B. D. is 46 years old and married. Xiomara has two children, of the following ages: Her 16 year old son recently finished his fourth year of high school; her younger son, nine years old, finished fourth grade. Her husband is an accountant for the Enacal business. Her goal is to secure the necessary income for her investment (in her business) because the situation that we find ourselves in is very difficult, and the only form of help that now presents itself in this country are the microfinance institutions and the outside organizations that hold out their hands to us. Xiomara wants to try to advance each day so that she can improve her economic situation. Her dream is to grow her business to ensure her children will be able to continue their studies. Xiomara's business is a general store in which are sold products such as: clothing, costume jewelry, shoes, and sandals. Her business is mobile. She has had her business for three years, which began with her own idea that she had to fight for. Because of this she began this business with few products and began to distribute her product but it didn't have (good) results. Not enough people (customers) paid for (bought) the merchandise, so later she decided to invest only in clothes and began to cater to her better customers to distribute her products. This loan is for operating expenses because she has to buy gold-plated (items) in Managua and men's clothing is in different places in Leon where they are sold in a favorable way. Xiomara is grateful to the Foundation and its partner organizations that are helping her get this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Olivia Engkvist, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating expenses

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Rubina Naheed Imtiaz Bashir Group

texts.en:
Rubina Naheed baji is a 38-year-old married lady. She is married to a man whose name is I. B., and he runs a medical store in the community. He completed his education up to 10th Standard. She is the mother of four kids: three sons and one daughter. All of her children are getting an education in a school located near their house. Since her children started going to school, Rubina baji became a seamstress, because she wants to share the financial burden with her husband. She is applying for a loan to buy medicines to increase the profit of her husband’s medicine-selling business.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more women of her locality. Sugran baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. Nasreen baji and Nabila B. baji each want a loan to buy a buffalo for their milk-selling business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy medicines for re-sale

loans.name: Safia Mahmood Akhtar Group

texts.en:
Safia M. baji is a 37-year-old married lady. She is married to a man whose name is M. A.. He has a laundry business. People come to him to wash their clothes. He provides another facility to iron their clothes as well. Safia baji is the mother of eight children: seven daughters and one son. Her son and her first three daughters are getting an education in a local school near their house. Safia baji helps her husband by washing clothes. She is applying for a loan to buy another washing machine to increase the profit from her husband’s laundry business.

Safia M. baji is the group leader for some more women from her locality. Razia begum baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. Ishrat Parveen baji wants a loan to buy thread to re-sell. Arshad baji wants a loan to buy land on contract to grow vegetables to sell. Shazia Rafiq baji wants a loan to repair her family's auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle).

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy another washing machine for their laundry business

loans.name: Isabel Marisela

texts.es:
La empresaria de Nombre Isabel Marisela Hernández M. tiene la edad de 58 años, su estado civil es casada, Doña Isabel tiene 4 hijos de los cuales el mayor de 39 años de edad trabaja por cuenta propia su otro hijo de 34 años trabaja por cuenta propia y el de 34 años por cuenta propia su otro hijo de 14 años cursa recientemente el 4 año de bachillerato, su compañero de vida no labora, sus propósitos son de mejorar su negocio para lograr obtener ingresos para su familia ya que es lo mas importante para ella, sus deseos son de obtener su negocio de una forma mas estable para que pueda prosperar en este negocio sus deseos son de expandir su mercadería porque al obtener mas productos tendrá mas oportunidad de conseguir mas clientes.

La actividad económica a la que se dedica es una pulpería en la que vende los productos como: pan, golosinas, jabón y sopas su negocio esta ubicado en el costado norte del seguro 3 cuadras arriba, el tiempo que tiene de poseer este negocio es de 15 años, ella inicia este negocio con 25 bolsas de refrescos naturales por lo que decide invertir mas en este negocio por medio de la Fundación León 2000 ya que ellos fueron el medio para salir adelante y sus comienzos fueron difíciles por lo en la misma cuadra tenían competencia por lo que se le haría muy difícil  de subsistir y decide ingresar mas productos a su como productos básicos, el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo por lo que la compra las realiza en León ya que aquí le resulta mas favorable la compra  de estos productos.
texts.en:
The businesswoman by the name of Isabel Marisela Hernandez M. is 58 years old. She is married. Isabel has four children of whom the oldest is 39 years old working for himself. Her other son is 34 years old working for himself, and (another) is 34 years old working for himself. Her other son, 14 years old, recently finished his fourth year of baccalaureate work. Her husband doesn't work. Her goal is to improve her business to earn better income for her family which is the most important thing for her. She wants to make her business more stable so she can prosper in it. She also wants to expand her merchandise because in obtaining more products she will have more opportunity to get more customers. Isabel's business is a store that sells products such as: bread, candy, soap and soup packets. Her business is located on the north side of the health clinic, three blocks up. She has had this business for 15 years. She started it with 25 bags of natural drinks, and she decided to invest more in this business through Kiva partner Fundacion Leon 2000 because they offer the way to progress. The beginning was difficult because in her own block there was competition so it was very difficult for her to subsist. She decided to bring in more products, like basic products. The loan is for operating expenses because she will buy her products in Leon because there (conditions) are more favorable for buying these products.

Translated from Spanish by Olivia Engkvist, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating expenses

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen es socia del Banco Comunal Inti que quiere decir Sol en quechua.
Carmen es conviviente, tiene 27 años y 1 hijos, Carmen junto a su esposo tienen un taller de planchado y pintura en un local alquilado. Además Carmen vende repuestos en el mismo lugar, sus productos los adquiere en la ciudad de Lima.
Carmen necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de pernos, puertas, faros.
Carmen sueña con tener muchos sucursales, casa propia.

loans.use: Para la compra de pernos, puertas, faros.

loans.name: Isabel Josefina

texts.es:
Isabel es socia del Banco Comunal Inti que quiere decir Sol en quechua.
Isabel es casada, tiene 43 años y 2 hijos, Isabel vende medicina natural por catálogos, también cosméticos por catalogo, sus productos los ofrece a amigos, familiares, sus ventas son al crédito. Además Isabel es profesora del nivel primario.
Isabel necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de medicina natural.
Los sueños de Isabel son tener una tienda de medicina natural y cosméticos.
texts.en:
Isabel is a partner of Inti Communal Banc ("Inti" means "sun" in Quechua, a language spoken before the Spanish conquest. Quechua survived only throughout the Andes, but recently Peru has begun to revive the language.). Isabel is forty-three years old and married. She has two children. Isabel sells cosmetics and natural medicine by catalog. She sells her products to friends and acquaintances, on credit. In addition to selling cosmetics and natural medicine, Isabel also teaches primary school. Isabel needs a loan of S/. 1,000 ($325) in order to purchase natural medicines. Isabel dreams of having a cosmetics and natural medicine store.

Translated from Spanish by Hannah Lily, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing natural medicines.

loans.name: Maria Jesus

texts.es:
Maria es socia del Banco Comunal Inti que quiere decir Sol en quechua.
Maria es conviviente, tiene 31 años y 2 hijos, Maria se dedica a la crianza de ganado vacuno, el ganado lo adquiere en las diferentes ferias de la región de donde lo transporta en carros alquilados, algunos los vende en la feria dominical y los demás los engorda en los terrenos de su suegra. Además tiene un mototaxi que maneja un chofer y hace 2 meses compro un carro con el cual realiza transporte a la ciudad de Huancavelica.
Maria necesita un préstamo de 1200, dinero que será invertido en la compra del seguro del carro.
Maria sueña con comprar mas carros e incrementar sus negocios.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the Inti community bank, the name for which comes from the Quechuan word for "sun". She is 31 years old and has 2 children. She raises livestock for a living. She buys the animals from different markets in the region and moves them in rented "carts". She sells some at Sunday markets and fattens the rest on land owned by her mother-in-law. Maria also owns a mototaxi. Two months ago, she bought a cart so that she could haul goods to the city of Huancavelica. Maria needs a loan of 1,200 Peruvian Nuevos Soles, money that she will invest in buying insurance for the "carro". Maria hopes to buy more carts and grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy insurance for transport business.

loans.name: Rosas

texts.es:
Rosas es socia del Banco Comunal Inti que quiere decir Sol en quechua.
Rosas es conviviente, tiene 25 años y 1 hijo, Rosas vende ropa a pedidos, sus productos los ofrece a amigos, familiares, conocidos, sus productos los adquiere en la ciudad de Lima a donde viaja semanalmente. 
Rosas necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de ropa variada.
Los sueños de Rosas son salir adelante, incrementar su capital y que su hijo sea profesional.
texts.en:
Rosas is a member of the Inti community bank, a name that comes from the Quechuan word for "sun". Rosas, 25, is partnered and has 1 son. She operates a clothing business, selling her products to friends, family, and acquaintances. She goes to Lima weekly to buy merchandise. Rosas needs a 1200-soles loan, money that she will invest in buying inventory. Rosas hopes to get ahead, grow her capital and see her son take up a professional career.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Cecilia Madeleine

texts.en:
Cecilia Madeleine M. Rodriguez is forty years old.  She lives with her husband and her two children in the city of Pucallpa, Peru.  Cecilia’s business is growing and selling plants.  Cecilia is a member of the Las Brisas communal bank and has worked with her group for two years.

Cecilia uses her loans to purchase plant food, pesticides, soil, seeds, seedlings and other plant growing materials.  She is currently requesting a Kiva loan of 2,500 Nuevo Soles to purchase more plants, chemicals and fertilizers.  She will also use the money to rent tools to help her cultivate her plants.  Cecilia appreciates the opportunity to work with more capital and appreciates your support.

loans.use: To purchase more plants, chemicals and fertilizers.

loans.name: Edith Irene

texts.en:
Edith Irene A. S. lives on Guepi Street in Pucallpa, Peru.  Pucallpa is a bustling and steamy jungle city in the Amazon River basin region in eastern Peru.  It is the regional capital of the department of Ucayali, which is characterized by the meandering Ucayali River that flows north, meeting up with the Amazon and, eventually, the Atlantic Ocean.  

Fifty years ago, Pucallpa was a tiny caserío, or hamlet, but everything changed when the only paved highway leading into the Amazon region was built and Pucallpa became the gateway to the jungle at the roads’ end.  Since the mid-20th century, the city has sprung up and engulfed the surrounding caserios.  Today, the city is a bustling, hot metropolis with immigrants from all over Peru.

Edith first started taking out loans in 2004 with the Mujeres Emprendedoras, or Women Entrepreneurs communal bank. Edith has several different types of businesses.  She sells clothing and jewelry, and also operates a small bar.  Edith is pictured above showing off some of her earrings, hair clips and bracelets.  She is requesting S/2,800 to purchase more accessories, and drinks to stock her stand.

loans.use: To purchase more accessories to sell, and drinks to stock her stand.

loans.name: Elisa Del Carmen

texts.en:
Elisa D. Carmen T. D. A. is a forty-four year old mother of three.  She lives in Pucallpa– the capital city of the Ucayali region in Peru’s Amazon River basin.  Elisa’s business is a flower shop that she runs on Salaverry Street.  She sells flowers, teddy bears, decorative adornments and statuettes.  She started this business just four months ago with her relative.  She is pictured above in front of her shop's new sign.

Elisa is a member of the Talented Women communal bank and has taken out loans through Manuela Ramos and Kiva for one year.  Elisa is currently requesting 1,200 Nuevo Soles to help fund the purchase of more flowers, gifts, and decorations to stock her shop.  Elisa will repay her loan in four monthly installments.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase more flowers, gifts, and decorations to stock her shop

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is a thrity-two year old married mother of two children.  She lives in the Callería district in the region of Ucayali in eastern Peru.  Elvira lives with her family in the city of Pucallpa, the capital of the Ucayali region and a bustling transportation hub in the area.

Elvira’s business is selling clothing and she has been supporting her business for four years with the help of loans from Manuela Ramos.  Elvira is a member of the Mujeres Emprendedoras, or “Women Entrepreneurs” communal bank.

Elvira is requesting 3,000 Nuevo Soles to fund the purchase of one large sack of clothing that she will offer for resale.  She will repay this loan within six months.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase one large sack of clothing that she will offer for resale

loans.name: Cirila

texts.en:
Cirila is a member of the Alianza ("Alliance") Village Bank. She is 53 years old and married with five children. Cirila and her husband sell car parts from their home, a business they have been in for the past eight years. Cirila also has a fresh juice stand in the Jesus Nazarenas Market, where she works in the mornings.

Cirila is requesting a loan of 1000 soles (USD$325) to buy car parts and accessories, as well as milk, sugar and crates of eggs for her juice stand. Her goal is to build a house for her daughter.

Cirila apologizes for not smiling in the photo; she says she has "a little window" when she smiles (she is missing a tooth).

loans.use: To buy car parts and accessories

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily M. Vasquez is 20 years old.  She lives in Pucallpa, Peru – a major city in the eastern jungle region of the country.  This steaming, humid city is situated on the banks of the Ucayali River, a tributary of the Amazon River.  

Emily is a member of the Las Heroinas communal bank and has been taking out small business loans for 1.5 years to support her moto-taxi and lingerie businesses.  Mototaxis are basically motorized rickshaws comprised of the front half of motorcycle attached to a two-wheeled passenger cart in back.  Emily rents moto-taxis in addition to selling lingerie.  It is common for Peruvians to pursue more than one entrepreneurial endeavour to make ends meet.

Emily is currently requesting a Kiva loan of 1,100 Nuevo Soles to purchase socks, stockings, underwear and brassiers for her lingerie business.  She will repay the loan in monthly installments.  The proceeds from Emily’s business go to support her family and her young child.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock for her lingerie business

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen is a member of the Alianza ("Alliance") Village Bank. She is 44 years old and married with five children, four of whom are still in school. Carmen and her family have a business making woven blankets in a workshop in their home. She has been in this business for the past 23 years.

Carmen is requesting a loan of 1000 soles (USD$325) to buy yarn and dye to make more blankets. One hundred kilos of yarn will cost 700 soles, and the remaining 300 soles will buy six units of dye.

Her goal for the future is to build a larger home. She owns the small adobe house she currently lives in, but would like to build something larger and more comfortable.

loans.use: Buy yarn and dye

loans.name: Erika

texts.en:
Erika L. Sangama is a twenty-five year old mother of two.  Erika lives with her partner and her sons in the Villa Oriente district of Pucallpa.  She is a member of the communal bank Damas del Oriente or “Ladies of the Orient”.  Her bank is so named because the bank members live in an asentamiento humano (or, legalized squatter settlement) named Villa Oriente.

The asentamiento humano is located in the Ucayali region of Perú.  Asentamientos humanos are formed when immigrants from other parts of the region invaden, or literally, “invade” an abandoned section of land outside of an urban area.  These immigrants may come from other Peruvian metropolises or from villages in the sierras or the jungle, but all come with the dual purpose of finding work and owning their own home.

Erika moved to Villa Oriente three months after the neighborhood was officially formed in 2005.  Currently, Erika works selling breakfast along the side of the regional highway from 4am to 7am in the morning.  She has to get up at 3:00 am to prepare patarashka (fish wrapped in banana leaves and grilled on an open flame) and tacacho (green banana mixed with pork rinds mashed into a ball) to sell.  At nights, Erika studies to earn her high school degree.

Erika is requesting 2,500 Nuevo Soles to purchase cooking oils, plates and cups for her business.  Erika says her business allows her to buy school materials for herself and motivates her to keep studying to earn her degree.

loans.use: To purchase cooking oils, plates and cups for her business

loans.name: Ruth

texts.es:
Ruth es socia del Banco Comunal Inti que quiere decir Sol en quechua.
Ruth es conviviente, tiene 42 años y 5 hijos, Ruth tiene un puesto en el mercado Nery García en donde vende verduras al por mayor y menor, actividad que realiza todos los días desde muy temprano.
Ruth necesita un préstamo de 800 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de cebolla, camote.
Ruth sueña con que sus hijos salgan adelante y incrementar su capital, vender mas productos.
texts.en:
Ruth is a member of the Inti community bank, a name that comes from the Quechuan word for "sun". Ruth, 42, is partnered and has 5 children. She has a stall in the Nery Garcia market where she sells vegetables, both wholesale and retail, a business that she operates every day from early in the morning. Ruth needs an 800-soles loan that she use to buy onions, sweet potatoes, etc. Ruth's greatest wishes are that her children get ahead in the world and that she can grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina M. M. is 58 years old.  She lives in Pucallpa, Peru – a major city in the eastern jungle region of the country.  This steaming, humid city is situated on the banks of the Ucayali River, a tributary of the Amazon River.  

Gina is a member of the Las Dalilas communal bank and has been taking out small business loans for 1.25 years to support her bodega, or corner store.  These small businesses are very common throughout Peru and provide a convenient way for people to earn livings working from their own homes.  Bodegas are usually located in the converted front room of the home and sales are made through grated windows or doors.  Gina's husband is a farmer and together they support their four children.

Gina is currently requesting a Kiva loan of 1,000 Nuevo Soles to stock her store with vegetables, eggs, rice, beer and bottled drinks.  She will repay the loan in monthly installments.

loans.use: To stock her store with vegetables, eggs, rice, beer and bottled drinks

loans.name: Hermelinda

texts.en:
Hermelinda V. Sinarahoua is a member of the Talented Women communal bank.  She has been taking out small business loans for five years.  She uses the capital to implement her food and drink sales stand at her home in Pucallpa, Peru.

Hermelinda is forty-two years old and supports her two children.  She is requesting a Kiva loan of 2,500 Nuevo Soles to be repaid in monthly installments over the course of four months.  

Hermelinda plans to purchase rice, eggs, oil, bihao leaves and chicken with her loan.  She will uses the materials cook meals, which she sells starting at 6 p.m. every evening in front of her home.  Hermelinda will also purchase bottled refreshments to sell with her food.

loans.use: To purchase cooking materials and bottled drinks for her food sales stand

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel es socia del Banco Comunal Inti que quiere decir Sol en quechua.
Isabel es casada, tiene 50 años y 5 hijos, Isabel tiene un puesto en el mercado Magdalena en donD. venD. abarrotes, actividad que realiza todos los días.
Isabel necesita un préstamo D. 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. arroz, leche, azúcar, menestras.
Isabel sueña con que su ultima hija sea profesional, salir adelante con su negocio y descansar.
texts.en:
Isabel is a member of the Inti community bank, a name that comes from the Quechuan word for "sun". Isabel, 50, is married and has 5 children. She has a stall in the Magdalena market where she sells groceries, a business that she operates every day. Isabel needs a 1000-soles loan that she will use to buy rice, milk, sugar, "menestras" (a traditional stew), etc. Isabel's greatest wishes are that her youngest daughter take up a professional career and that she be able to grow her business and take a rest now and then.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is a member of the Alianza ("Alliance") Village Bank. She is 42 years old and is separated with one son. Gladys has several businesses: she has a pig farm, she buys and sells grains, and she also grinds some of the grain into flour to sell. She buys the grains from farmers or intermediaries, and resells them (whole or ground) in local markets. She sells some of the flour to market vendors, who use it to make wawa, a traditional kind of bread. Gladys also sells suckling pigs for 16 soles per kilo on special occasions like Christmas and New Year's.

Gladys is requesting a loan of 1,400 soles (USD$450) to buy grains and two to three pigs.

loans.use: To buy grains and pigs

loans.name: Luzbet

texts.es: Luzbet tiene 32 años, es casada y vive con sus  tres hijos. Desde muy niña se dedicó a la agricultura, ya que sus padres son agricultores y le enseñaron cómo cultivar sus terrenos, terrenos que ahora son suyos, ya que sus padres le heredaron una parcela de tierras para que pueda cultivar, y desde hace 6 años, que se casó, trabaja  junto a su esposo cultivando sus productos agrícolas, que luego de ser cosechados los vende en los mercados de su ciudad, pero lo difícil es trasladar sus productos, debido a que se tiene que pagar a los camiones para trasladar sus productos. Luzbet está en su 13avo préstamo con MFP, y siempre ha sido considerada como una clienta responsable en sus pagos y reuniones. Esta vez invertirá la cantidad que solicita en la producción de sus tierras adquiriendo semillas y abonos para sus terrenos.
texts.en:
Luzbet is thirty-two, married, and the mother of three children (all of whom live with her). Her parents were farmers, so Luzbet has been farming since she was a little girl -- her parents taught her how to work the land. Luzbet farms where she grew up because her parents left her some of their land so that she could continue farming. Since marrying six years ago, Luzbet and her husband have tended the crops together. After harvesting, she sells their products at markets in the city. It is difficult to transport their harvest though. This is Luzbet’s thirteenth loan with MFP, and she has always been a considerate, responsible client in payments and collections. This time she will invest the money she requests in acquiring seeds and fertilizer for her fields.

Translated from Spanish by Hannah Lily, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing seeds and fertilizer for her crops.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Rocío

texts.es: Rocío tiene 22 años, está casada, vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos. Se dedica a la crianza de animales menores desde hace 2 años, desde esa fecha se desvive por brindar el mejor cuidado a sus animales, sobre todo a sus cuyes, que son los más demandados en el mercado nacional e internacional, ya que hay personas que realizan pedidos para exportar la carne de cuy, la cual es bastante consumida, esto hace rentable su negocio, ya que venderlos para exportación es más rentable porque tienen un costo más elevado, pero para llegar a abastecer los pedidos tiene que tener grandes cantidades de cuyes y de buenas razas. Rocío está en su 13vo crédito con MFP, y todo este tiempo ha sido una persona muy responsable en sus pagos, ganándose así la confianza ante los demás miembros de su banco comunal y de la institución. Con el dinero que solicita comprará más cuyes de raza que mejoren su producción y ventas.
texts.en:
Rocío is twenty-two years old and married. She lives with her husband and their two children. She has been raising small animals for two years. Since the time she started, Rocío has been devoted to giving her animals the best care -- especially her guinea pigs, which are the most popular in both the national and international markets.
