Guinea pig meat is commonly eaten, and there are people who export guinea pig meat. Rocío’s business benefits from this since the meat can be sold at a higher value as an export than it can locally. However, Rocío has to have huge numbers of guinea pigs and good breeds to be able to stay in stock and meet demand. This is Rocío’s thirteenth loan with MFP. All this time she has been a very responsible person with her payments, winning the trust of every member of her communal banc and the institution. With the money she is requesting, Rocío will buy more guinea pigs of breeds that will increase her production and sales.

Translated from Spanish by Hannah Lily, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing better breeds of guinea pig.

loans.name: Vidalina

texts.es:
Vidalina es socia del Banco Comunal Inti que quiere decir Sol en quechua.
Vidalina es casada, tiene 61 años y 12 hijos D. los cuales 6 hijos viven con ella, Vidalina tiene una tienda en su casa en donD. venD. abarrotes en general, verduras, carne, gaseosas y tiene teléfono fijo. Además su esposo tiene un taller D. carpintería, que atienD. pedidos, Vidalina le ayuda en la compra y venta D. madera.
Vidalina necesita un préstamo D. 1600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. arroz, azúcar, cerveza, fideos.
Los sueños D. Vidalina son arreglar su casa, mejorar su negocio y culminar la construcción del segundo piso D. su casa.
texts.en:
Vidalina belongs to Inti Communal Banc ("Inti" means "sun" in Quechua, a language spoken before the Spanish conquest. Quechua survived only throughout the Andes, but recently Peru has begun to revive the language.). Vidalina is sixty-one years old and married. She has twelve children, six of which live with her. Vidalina has a store in her house where she has a phone and sells basic groceries, vegetables, meat, and soft drinks. In addition, her husband has a carpentry shop that gets orders. Vadalina helps him buy and sell the wood. Vadalina needs a loan of S/.16,00 ($525) to buy rice, sugar, beer, and noodles. Vadalina dreams of fixing the house, improving her business, and finishing the second floor of their house, which is currently being constructed.

Translated from Spanish by Hannah Lily, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing rice, sugar, beer, and noodles.

loans.name: Jany Isabel

texts.en:
Jany Isabel T. P. is 23 years old.  She lives in Pucallpa, Peru – a major city in the eastern jungle region of the country.  This steaming, humid city is situated on the banks of the Ucayali River, a tributary of the Amazon River.  Jany is a member of the Las Heroinas communal bank and has been taking out small business loans for 3 years to support her hammock business.  

Jany weaves and sells hammocks for a living.  Hammocks are a popular purchase of travelers leaving on riverboats headed to other port towns along the Ucayali.  Riverboats often do not have beds for passengers to sleep in, so everyone must bring along their own hammock.  Jany sells to these travelers and also to people who would like a hammock for their own home.

Jany is currently requesting a Kiva loan of 2,000 Nuevo Soles to purchase cloth, thread and other materials used in making hammocks.  She will repay the loan in monthly installments.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase cloth, thread and other materials for making hammocks to sell.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is a member of the Las Golondrinas ('The Swallows') Village Bank. Delia is 38 years old and is married with five children. She and her husband rent construction machinery such as steamrollers, pumps and industrial vibrating machines. She rents the equipment to public and private institutions, and her husband also has a workshop where he does mechanical work on heavy machinery.

Delia needs a loan of 1200 soles (USD$400) to buy gas. Delia dreams that her children will graduate with professional degrees, of owning her own workspace, and of expanding her business.

 

 

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Fellow

Delia es socia del Banco Comunal Las Golondrinas. Delia es casada, tiene 38 años y 5 hijos, Delia junto a su esposo se dedican al alquiler de maquinarias de construcción, como compactadora, vibradora, motobombas que alquila instituciones publicas y privadas, además su esposo tiene un taller mecánico de maquinaria pesada.

Delia necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de combustible.

Delia sueña con que sus hijos sean profesionales, tener un local propio y ampliar su negocio.

loans.use: To buy gas for construction equipment.

loans.name: Zelmira

texts.es: Zelmira tiene 28 años, es madre soltera, vive con sus padres y sus dos hijos  menores de edad. Hace 2 años se dedica a la crianza de animales, ganado que le ayuda a tener grandes ganancias, ya que es más rentable por el consumo de carne de cordero en los mercados. Así también tiene algunas vaquitas, las cuales producen leche y puede venderla en los mercados de la ciudad y en los alrededores donde las ventas son muy buenas, pero para ello tiene que ordeñarlas desde muy temprano para ofrecer leche fresca a los vecinos para sus desayunos. Zelmira está en su 13avo préstamo con MFP, y hasta la fecha no tuvo problemas de pago y sigue siendo una socia estrella en su banco comunal. El dinero solicitado se invertirá en la compra de ganado, los cuales tienen un costo aproximado de 300 soles cada cordero.
texts.en:
Zelmira, 28, is a single mother. She lives with her parents and her two young children. Two years ago, she started a business raising sheep, a business that has helped her increase her earnings because the market pays a premium for lamb. She also has a few cows that produce milk, another product that sells well in the markets in and around the city, but a business that requires her to start very early in the morning because she has to collect the milk and sell it to her customers while it's fresh for their morning breakfasts. This is Zelmira's 13th MFP loan and she's repaid all of her past loans. She's a star among the members of her community bank. The loan will be used to buy sheep which cost around 300 soles per head.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Grow livestock business.

loans.name: Jovita Elizabeth

texts.en:
Jovita Elizabeth R. S. is forty-one years old, married and has three children.  Her husband works as a mechanic and Jovita supports her family with her beauty salon.  Jovita has worked with the Mujeres Emprendedoras, or Women Entrepreneurs, bank for eight years.  As her business has grown Jovita has increased her loan amounts from 300 Nuevo Soles to over 2,000.

Jovita is currently requesting 2,200 Nuevo Soles to augment her hair salon business.  Jovita plans to purchase lingerie to offer to her customers while she is cutting their hair.  She will also continue to purchase hair dressing liquids and materials with her loan.  Jovita plans to repay the loan in six months.

loans.use: To purchase lingerie to offer to her customers while she is cutting their hair

loans.name: Mayra Carina

texts.es:
La elaboración de alimentos es una labor que requiere de mucho esfuerzo y dedicación siendo este el negocio al cual se dedica la señora Mayra A. desde hace 32 años en el municipio de Chichigalpa de la ciudad de Chinandega. Con tantos años de elaborar alimentos ha logrado convertirse en una excelente cocinera que prepara exquisitos platillos especialmente la fritanga nicaragüense.

Con el propósito de adquirir la materia prima para elaborar los alimentos, ella hoy en día ha acudido a Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con un crédito para continuar con la elaboración de los alimentos. Espera muy confiadamente que su crédito sea otorgado y de esta forma continuar con el  mejoramiento de su nivel de vida y a la vez continuar con el sustento de su casa de habitación.
texts.en:
Cooking food is hard work that requires a lot of dedication; this is the business in which Mayra A. has been engaged for the last 32 years in the district of Chichigalpa, city of Chinandega. Thanks to her lengthy experience, she has become an excellent cook and prepares exquisite dishes, her specialty being Nicaraguan fritanga.

She has applied for this loan from Ceprodel in order to buy ingredients so as to continue with her food business. She trusts that the loan would be granted so as to enable her to improve her living standards and to maintain her family.

Translated from Spanish by John Rynne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy ingredients

loans.name: José Dolores

texts.es:
El caballero José Dolores U. desde hace dos años decidió poner su propia pulpería con el propósito de generar ingresos que le permitieran mejorar su nivel de vida y el de su familia en el municipio de Chichigalpa. Hoy en día ha logrado invertir en la pulpería habiéndola desarrollado en para esto se ha apoyado de los créditos brindados por Ceprodel ya que los ha invertido en la compra de los productos.

La razón por la que él ha acudido a Ceprodel es para obtener un crédito con el cual comprar los productos necesarios para la pulpería. Espera muy confiadamente que su crédito sea otorgado y de esta forma contribuir al desarrollo y mejoramiento de su pulpería que tanto requiere de su apoyo.
texts.en:
The gentleman José Dolores U. has owned his own convenience store for two years, in order to generate income in order to improve his and his family's quality of life in the municipality of Chichigalpa. Today he has managed to invest in the store, having been able to develop his store with the support of the credits offered by Ceprodel, an affiliate of Kiva. He has approached Ceprodel to obtain another loan in order to buy the necessary products for his store. He is waiting confidentially for his loan to be given and thusly contribute to the development and the improvement of his store, which greatly requires your support.

Translated from Spanish by Lois Parshley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de los productos de pulpería

loans.name: Alex

texts.es: Alex tiene 30 años y vive con sus padres. Es un joven que trabaja con su propia fuente de ingresos diarios, que es unas cabinas públicas de Internet y locutorio telefónico que ha instalado en la casa de sus padres, atiende todos los días, incluyendo los domingos, para garantizarse los ingresos necesarios. Como un buen administrador de su negocio realiza una adecuada distribución de los ingresos, para poder cubrir los gastos de servicios y su mercadería básica, que son algunas golosinas y tarjetas telefónicas, así como recargas virtuales y tarjetas prepago para celulares. Es la primera vez que Alex solicita un préstamo con MFP, fue invitado a ser parte de un banco comunal por ser un joven muy trabajador y responsable. Con el dinero que solicita invertirá en la compra, al por mayor, de recargas virtuales y tarjetas prepago de celulares, así como para el mantenimiento de una de sus computadoras.
texts.en:
Alex is thirty years old and lives with his parents. He is a youth who works with his own daily source of income from the public Internet cafés and telephone booths that have been installed in his parents house. He monitors them every day, including Sundays, to guarantee his necessary income. As a good administrator of his business, he directs the adequate distribution of the profits, in order to be able to cover the service charges and the basic merchandise, including sweets and phone cards, as well as virtual refills and prepaid cell phone cards. This is the first time that Alex has requested a loan with MFP, an affiliate of Kiva. Alex was invited to be part of a communal bank because he is a responsible and very industrious youth. With the money that he is requesting, he will invest in the wholesale purchase of virtual refills and prepaid cell phone cards, as well as the maintenance of one of his computers.

Translated from Spanish by Lois Parshley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de tarjetas para celulares y el mantenimiento de una de sus computadoras

loans.name: Dorti

texts.en:
Dorti C. I. is 37 years old.  She lives in Pucallpa, Peru – a major city in the eastern jungle region of the country.  This steaming, humid city is situated on the banks of the Ucayali River, a tributary of the Amazon River.  

Dorti is a member of the Santa Rosa de Lima communal bank and has been taking out small business loans for 2 years to support her transportation business.  Dorti owns a boat that she uses to transport goods throughout the Ucayali River region.  Her customers transfer their products between port towns using Dorti's services.

Dorti is currently requesting a Kiva loan of 3,000 Nuevo Soles to purchase replacement parts for her motorboat.  She will also purchase - over the course of her loan - 40 gallons of gas and 1 gallon of motor oil.  She will repay the loan in monthly installments.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase replacement parts for her motorboat, gas and motor oil

loans.name: Cruz Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Cruz del Carmen D. originaria de Chichigalpa, se ha destacado por dedicarse a la actividad de crianza y destace de cerdos para la venta de la carne. Desde que inició esta actividad desde hace 16 años, ha logrado salir adelante proporcionando mejores condiciones en su vivienda y a la vez ha apoyado a sus dos hijos en edad escolar.

Hoy en día ha acudido a Ceprodel parar ser beneficiada con un crédito para ser utilizado en la compra de cerdos para su respectiva crianza, destace y venta de la carne. Con el crédito que le sea proporcionado se beneficiará grandemente y logrará salir adelante en su actividad económica.
texts.en:
Señora Cruz del Carmen D. originates from Chichigalpa. She has distinguished herself by being dedicated to the activity of breeding and butchering pigs in order to sell the meat. Since she began this activity sixteen years ago, she has managed to do well in in improving her living conditions, and at the same time supported her two school-aged children. Today, she has come to Ceprodel, an affiliate of Kiva, in order to be the beneficiary of a loan with which to purchase pigs for their respective breeding, butchery, and sale. With the loan that is provided, she will benefit greatly and will manage to do well in her economic activity.

Translated from Spanish by Lois Parshley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de cerdos

loans.name: Aquilina Agustina

texts.en:
Aquilina is a member of the Alianza ('Alliance') Village Bank. She is 54 years old and is married with 11 children. Some of her children are adults, while others are still in her care. Her older children work as market vendors in the city of Ayacucho.

Aquilina has a business trading cereals, clothing, and some vegetables. She buys her wares in Lima and Ayacucho, then brings them by the truckload to different jungle villages to sell. Sometimes, she buys fruit in the jungle, which she brings back to the city of Ayacucho to sell. Aquilina has been in this business for 11 years now.

Aquilina is requesting a loan of 1000 soles (USD$325) to buy more clothing to take to the jungle to sell. Her goal for the future is to build an addition to her house, since it is currently very small.

loans.use: Buy bulk clothing to sell in the Ayacuchan jungle

loans.name: Enedina

texts.en:
Enedina is a member of the Alianza ('Alliance') Village Bank. She is 48 years old and married with three children. She runs a restaurant in a rented space on Cusco Avenue in the city of Ayacucho. She serves mostly traditional Peruvian meals and offers fixed-menu lunches as well as extra dishes.

Enedina is requesting a loan of 1600 soles (USD$525) to buy rice, milk, sodas, beer, oil and meat for her restaurant. Her goal for the future is to own her own restaurant so that she doesn’t have to pay rent anymore.

loans.use: To buy rice, milk, sodas, beer, oil and meat.

loans.name: Boris

texts.es: Boris tiene 38 años, vive con su esposa y sus hijos. Es un emergente comerciante de su localidad, hace 2 años decidió arriesgar y  generar su propia fuente de ingreso con una bodega instalada en una zona céntrica y comercial de su ciudad, Boris abastece a sus clientes con productos de primera necesidad y su atención es todos los días, incluso los días domingos. Este es un negocio familiar, ya que las tareas son compartidas con su esposa, y juntos siempre están al pendiente de su bodega, la meta familiar es acrecentar la mercadería y ser una gran distribuidora de productos de primera necesidad, ellos saben que esto es un gran reto, que requieren mover mayor cantidad de capital, y en esto se esfuerzan cada día para ahorra al máximo las ganancias. Es la segunda vez que Boris solicita un préstamo con MFP, por lo que se compromete a seguir trabajando responsablemente. En esta ocasión solicita una cantidad para invertir en la compra de mercadería por ocasión de fiestas de fin de año, como cajas de leche, chocolates para taza y panteones.
texts.en:
Boris is thirty eight years old and lives with his wife and children. He is an emerging merchant of his area. Two years ago, he decided to take a risk and generate his own source of income with a grocery store installed in a commercial and central zone of his city. Boris supplies his clients with necessities, and he works every day, including Sundays. This is a family business, since the shop's tasks are shared with his wife, and together they are always devoting themselves to their work. The family goal is to increase their merchandise and to be a large distributor of necessities. They know that this is a great challenge, that requires them to move a greater quantity of capital, and they endeavor each day to save the maximum amount of profits. This is the second time that Boris is requesting a loan with MFP, an affiliate of Kiva, with which they promise to continue working responsibly. This time they are requesting a loan in order to invest in the purchasing of merchandise for the year's end festivities, like boxes of milk, and chocolates for hot chocolate and cemetery visits.

Translated from Spanish by Lois Parshley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Incremento de la mercadería de su bodega

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
Juana A. L. is 59 years old.  She is a member of the communal bank Damas del Oriente, so named for the Villa Oriente neighborhood where the bank members meet monthly.  She was born in Huánuco, a city in the Andean mountains in Perú.  She came to the jungle city of Pucallpa in 1975 with her husband and one child.  In 1979 they purchased a plot in the José Carlos Mariatil area and there she birthed and raised four more children.

Juana’s business is to sell knitwear clothing.  She will travel to Lima 20 hours by bus once or twice a month to buy clothing in bulk.  The merchandise she purchases will stock her store until she makes her next trip.  Juana currently sells out of a stall in the “Mercado #2” market.  She must pay S./ 100 ($33) in monthly rent for a space where she will offer polo t-shirts, blouses and other men’s and women’s clothing.

Juana is currently requesting a loan of 2,100 Nuevo Soles to purchase t-shirts, underwear and men's pants for her store.  She will repay the loan in monthly installments through her communal bank.

loans.use: To buy t-shirts, underwear and men's pants to stock her store

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es: Gloria tiene 44 años, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos. Ella trabaja de manera independiente desde hace 3 años de diversas formas, una de ellas fue con cabinas públicas de Internet, pero lastimosamente sufrió un robo, pero esto no fue para que se detengan sus deseos de superación, ya que está muy convencida de que solo fue una circunstancia más, y ahora se levanta porque desde hace un año comenzó a vender rajadas de leña, y le está yendo muy bien. Ahora se dedica por las tardes a la venta de leña a sus vecinos y también en ocasiones va  a las zonas rurales de su localidad para vender, ya que en estas zonas tienen mayor demanda. Gloria está trabajando de esta manera para ser un sostén más en la economía de su hogar, ya que muchas veces el sueldo de su esposo no alcanza para cubrir algunas necesidades. Es la primera vez que solicita un préstamo con MFP, por lo cual está comprometida en cumplir puntualmente en sus pagos. Gloria esta solicitando este préstamo para comprar más leña que le permitirá obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Gloria is 44 years old and lives with her husband and 3 children. She has been self-employed for the past 3 years, in a variety of jobs. She had an internet cafe but unfortunately she was robbed. However, this did not stop her from wanting to get ahead and she is convinced that it was just something to overcome. Now she is pulling herself up again and for the past year she has sold firewood, which is going well for her. In the afternoons she sells firewood to her neighbors and sometimes she travels to rural areas nearby, where there is more demand for firewood. Gloria is working in order to support her family economically--sometimes her husband's salary is not enough to cover household necessities. This is the first time she is applying for a loan with MFP and she is committed to making her payments on time. Gloria is asking for this loan to buy more firewood which will allow her to earn more.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase firewood

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en:
Beatriz is a member of the Alianza ('Alliance') Village Bank. She is 48 years old and is the single mother of four children. Beatriz runs a general store in a rental space in the city of Ayacucho. Her daughters help her run the store. Beatriz works from 6am to 10pm seven days per week, and has been in this business for 17 years.

Beatriz is requesting a loan of 1000 soles (USD$325) to buy soda, beer, milk, rice and sugar for her store. Her goal for the future is to expand her store.

loans.use: To buy soda, beer, milk, rice and sugar.

loans.name: Juana Antonia

texts.en:
Juana Antonia R. D. C. is a member of the Mujeres Emprededoras or Women Entrepreneurs communal bank in Pucallpa, Peru. Pucallpa is a major city and transportation hub of the eastern jungle region in Peru’s Amazon River basin.

Juana is sixty-six years old and she supports herself, her five children, and her retired husband. Juana sells beauty products by catalog for a living. When she first started with the Manuela Ramos micro-finance organization eight years ago, Juana sold clothing. Now Juana is requesting a loan of 3,000 Nuevo Soles to purchase cosmetics and beauty products for her stock.

Beauty products sales by catalog is a popular profession in Peru. Women sell to their neighbors, family, friends and acquaintances on credit. Women working with Kiva loans are able to purchase more stock in bulk to save themselves money and to keep their display cases in stock.

Juana plans to repay her loan in six months and will use the funds to purchase more of the perfumes pictured in the photograph. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: purchase more beauty products such as perfumes

loans.name: Kattia

texts.en:
Kattia D. Z. is a member of the Talented Women communal bank and has taken out loans to support her business over four years. She lives in the department capital, Pucallpa, in the eastern Amazon River basin region of Peru. Kattia is twenty-nine years old and single. She cooks and sells meals for a living in her own restaurant located near the regional hospital. Many of Kattia´s customers are people working or visiting families in the hospital.

Kattia is requesting a loan of 1,500 Nuevo Soles to purchase new tables, chairs, and tablecloths for her establishment. She also plans to use her Kiva Loan to buy foodstuffs with which she will prepare the meals she sells.

loans.use: to purchase new tables, chairs, and tablecloths for her establishment and foodstuffs to prepare meals

loans.name: Jans

texts.es: Jans tiene 21 años y vive con sus padres. Hace un año empezó a trabajar de manera independiente vendiendo bebidas en un local que tiene su madre, de esta manera obtiene ingresos diarios que le permiten solventar sus estudios. Se dedica a su negocio generalmente en las tardes que cuando tiene mayores entradas, por ello Jans sigue trabajando esperando un mejor  futuro cada día, ahora quiere aumentar su mercadería para que pueda acceder a mejor calidad de estudios, es decir poder comprar mejores materiales de estudio. Jans tiene grandes metas, y se ha decidido a cumplirlas, una de ellas es ser un buen profesional. Es la primera vez que solicita un préstamo con MFP, por lo que se compromete a ser muy responsable en sus pagos. Jans está solicitando este préstamo para invertir en la compra de más cajas de cerveza. Cada caja esta aproximadamente en 80 soles, dependiendo de la marca.
texts.en:
Jans is 21 years old and lives with his parents. A year ago he began working independently, selling drinks out of his mother's store. In this way he earns daily income that allows him to pay for his studies. He generally works in the afternoons because that is when more customers come in. Each day Jans continues working and hoping for a better future. He wants to increase his business in order to obtain a better quality education and to be able to purchase better school supplies. Jans has big goals and he is dedicated to achieving them--one of them is to become a good businessman. This is the first time he has applied for a loan with MFP and he is committed to being very responsible with his repayments. With this loan Jans will invest in cases of beer to resell. Each case is about 80 soles, depending on the brand.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy drinks for his business

loans.name: Henriette

texts.fr: Henriette M. est une veuve de 59 ans, mère de 04 enfants dont 02 sont des handicapés (visuel et moteur). Elle veut ce prêt pour promouvoir son activité de vente de fruits divers. Son objectif est de bien prendre en charge sa famille et d’assurer la dépense quotidienne
texts.en:
Henriette M. is a 59-year-old widow and the mother of 4 children, out of which 2 are disabled (visually and physically). With this loan, she wants to promote her business, which consists in selling various kinds of fruits. Her goal is to adequately support her family and its day-to-day expenses.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and resell fruits (bananas and papayas)

loans.name: Mery

texts.es: Mery tiene 46 años, vive con sus hijos y con su madre. Trabaja vendiendo productos de nutrición de una línea prestigiosa en su región, cada día acude a su establecimiento de ventas, al que llama “El club de la salud”,  para atender a sus vecinos, los cuales solicitan los productos que vende, este negocio le permite percibir ganancias suficiente para sostener a su familia, es por eso que atiende diariamente y por horas. Antes vendía desde su casa, pero gracias a sus ahorros logró obtener los medios necesarios parra arrendar un local. Es la primera vez que Mery solicita un préstamo con MFP, por lo que se compromete a ser puntual con sus pagos. La cantidad que solicita será invertida en la compra de más productos y de esa manera aprovechar la demanda de esta época del año.
texts.en:
Mery is 46 years old and lives with her children and her mother. She sells nutrition products from a prestigious company in her area. Everyday she goes to her business, which is called "El club de la salud" (The health club), to attend to her neighbors who buy her products. This business helps her earn enough to support her family and she serves her clients daily and by appointment. She used to sell from her home, but thanks to her savings she was able to obtain the necessary means to rent a business space. This is the first time Mery is applying for a loan with MFP and she is committed to being on time with her payments. She will invest this loan in the purchase of more products in order to take advantage of the increased demand during this time of year.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her stock

loans.name: Liliana

texts.en:
Liliana M. M. lives in Pucallpa, Peru. It is the district capital of the Ucayali department in the hot, humid jungle region of eastern Peru. Liliana is twenty-eight years old and is married to a taxi driver; together they have one small child. Liliana is a member of the Talented Women community bank and has taken out small business loans through her group for one and a half years.

Liliana is currently requesting a Kiva loan of 1,500 Nuevo Soles to help her purchase groceries and foodstuffs to implement her business. Liliana sells meals to a casino, preparing them in her home and dropping them off at the casino every evening at eight pm for sale. With her Kiva loan, Liliana will purchase rice, potatoes and onions among others. She will repay the loan in four monthly installments.

loans.use: purchase rice, potatoes and onions among other foodstuffs to prepare meals

loans.name: Lupe Consuelo

texts.en:
Lupe Consuelo Agustini S. lives in the bustling, jungle city Pucallpa, Peru. It is the regional capital of the tropical Amazonian department of Ucayali which is characterized by the meandering Ucayali River that flows north, meeting up with the Amazon and, eventually, the Atlantic Ocean. Fifty years ago, Pucallpa was a tiny caserío or hamlet; but everything changed when the only paved highway leading into the Amazon region was built and Pucallpa became the gateway to the jungle at the road's end. Since the mid-20th century, the city has sprung up and engulfed the surrounding "caserios". Today the city is a bustling, hot metropolis with immigrants from all over Peru.

Lupe is thirty-six years old and has been working with the Ucayali office of Manuela Ramos for over seven years. She has one small son whom she supports through her sweets-selling business. Lupe is requesting a loan of 2,000 Nuevo Soles to be repaid over six months. Lupe plans to use the funds to purchase sweets and cakes to re-sell to her customers. She plans to purchase "paneton", in particular; it is a popular, traditional cake that families eat especially during Christmas. The cake has a consistency similar to bread and is dotted with raisins and fruits.

Lupe´s normal line of work is the sale of bottled drinks and beer to her neighbors. She stores her products in the glass-front refrigerator pictured above. Lupe will also use her loan to continue to stock up on the drinks and beers she sells.

loans.use: to purchase sweets and cakes to re-sell and continue to stock up on drinks and beers

loans.name: Fredy

texts.es: Fredy tiene 28 años, es soltero, vive solo en casa de sus padres. Se dedica a la venta de gaseosas y licores en un local que tiene hace dos años en la ciudad de Juliaca, como es soltero aun no tiene una responsabilidad hacia una familia, pero piensa conformarla en un futuro, es por eso que quiere estabilizarse económicamente para poder brindarles lo mejor. Lo más difícil de su trabajo es el permanecer durante varias horas atendiendo su negocio sin ayuda de nadie, ya que vive solo, pero aún así Fredy es constante en su trabajo y sabe que si quiere un mejor futuro debe trabajar en su juventud, para alcanzar todas sus metas. Fredy se encuentra en su octavo préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma, siendo muy puntual en los pagos. Con el dinero solicitado comprará mayor cantidad de bebidas para aumentar la venta en su negocio.
texts.en:
Fredy is 28, single, and lives by himself in his parents’ house. He earns his living selling soft drinks and liquors from the shop in Juliaca that he has had for the past two years. He is single, so he is not yet responsible for a family. He would like to have a family in the future, though, so wants to become economically secure in order to give them the best. The hardest part about his work is that, since he lives alone, he tends his business by himself for hours at a time without help from anyone. Even so, Fredy perseveres in his work and knows that if he wants a better future, and to achieve all of his goals, he’ll have to work while he is young. This will be Fredy’s eighth loan with Microfinanzas Prisma, and he has been extremely punctual with his payments. He plans to use his loan to purchase a greater number of beverages so he can increase his sales.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase the number of products he sells

loans.name: Lupe Consuelo

texts.en:
Lupe Consuelo S. Chavez is fifty-three years old, married to a chauffeur, and has eight children. Lupe supports herself and her family by running a small pensioners' house, selling bottled drinks and snacks, and also selling prepared meals from her home.

Lupe has been taking out loans with the Manuela Ramos communal bank the “Women Entrepreneurs” since 2004. The bank is based in the city of Pucallpa, Peru in the eastern jungle region of the country. The area is characterized by hot, humid weather and the Ucayali River which meanders through the dense jungle, eventually meeting up with the Amazon River.

Lupe is currently requesting a loan of 2,500 Nuevo Soles to fund the purchase of groceries, bottled sodas and refreshments. She also plans to invest in maintenance for her pension house. Lupe will repay her loan in monthly payments over the course of six months.

loans.use: buying groceries, bottled sodas, and refreshments and investing in maintenance for her pension house

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita B. V. D. T. is seventy-three years old. She lives in downtown Pucallpa, Peru in the Amazon River basin region of the country. Margarita doesn’t have a husband but does have four children. She is also a member of the Talented Women communal bank and has taken out small business loans through her group for seven years.

Margarita uses her small business loans to pay for maintenance costs to rooms she rents out monthly to pensioners. She is pictured in the stairwell of her guesthouse, because she cannot climb the stairs well to show the rooms she plans to renovate on the third floor. Margarita is currently requesting 1,000 Nuevo Soles to make repairs to the rental units in her home. She will repay her loan in monthly installments over the course of four months.

loans.use: to make repairs to the rental units in her home

loans.name: Margarita Del Rocio

texts.en:
Margarita del Rocio E. R. lives in the city of Pucallpa in the eastern jungle region of Peru. Margarita’s husband drives a car for a living and Margarita supports her family by running two independent businesses. She is thirty-seven years old, married, and has two children. Margarita dedicates herself both to the sale of clothing and also to raising and selling poultry.

Margarita has been a member of the Mujeres Emprendedoras (the “Women Entrepreneurs”) communal bank for eight years. She first started with loans of 300 Nuevo Soles or approximately US$ 100. Now Margarita has grown her business and subsequently her loan amounts. She is requesting a loan of 2,200 Nuevo Soles to help her purchase feed and vitamins for her turkeys and chickens. Margarita plans to repay the loan over six months.

loans.use: purchase feed and vitamins for her turkeys and chickens

loans.name: María Rosly

texts.en:
Maria Rosly H. M. is forty-two years old. Her husband is a municipal worker and together they have four children. Maria has been a member of the Las Paykanas communal bank for one and a half years and has used the capital she borrows to support her motocar business.

Motocars are a popular form of transportation in Pucallpa, Peru where Maria lives. Motocars are three-wheeled passenger vehicles comprised of the front half of a motorcycle with a two-wheeled, two-seater passenger cart in the back. They are basically motorized rickshaws that are used as local taxis.

Maria uses her car to earn taxi fares, either by renting the car at a daily rate or a family member will drive the motocar to earn income for the family.

Maria is requesting a loan of 1,200 Nuevo Soles to fund the purchase of replacement parts for the maintenance of her motocars. She will repay her loan monthly over the course of four months.

loans.use: purchase of replacement parts for the maintenance of her motocars

loans.name: Marina Del Carmen

texts.en:
Marina Del Carmen P. C. is 63 years old. She lives in Pucallpa, Peru – a major city in the eastern jungle region of the country. This steaming, humid city is situated on the banks of the Ucayali River, a tributary of the Amazon River. Marina is a member of the Santa Rosa de Lima communal bank and has been taking out small business loans for 10 years to support her transportation business.

Marina owns and rents out mototaxis, or motorized rickshaws for a living. Marina will rent a car for a daily rate (normally between US$ 5 and US$ 10 dollars for a whole day); in exchange, the mototaxi driver keeps all fares that he earns while he works. The proceeds from Marina's business help her to support herself and her seven children.

Marina is currently requesting a Kiva loan of 2,000 Nuevo Soles to fund the purchase of a second mototaxi. She will repay the loan in monthly installments. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: purchase a second mototaxi to rent out

loans.name: Marinita

texts.en:
Marinita R. V. is sixty-six years old and has one daughter whom she supports. She lives in the Callería district of the city of Pucallpa, Peru. Marinita used to have a charcoal-selling business, but is now selling chickens for a living.

She is requesting a loan of 3,000 Nuevo Soles to be repaid in six months to fund the purchase of turkeys and turkey feed. Marinita plans to raise the birds and re-sell them to market vendors and direct users. Marinita also rents out a house for extra income and she sometimes uses the capital from her Kiva loans to make repairs to the space. She is pictured in the photograph above with two birds she is currently raising for sale.

loans.use: buying turkeys and turkey feed and making repairs to the rooms she rents out in her house

loans.name: Maritza

texts.en:
Maritza R. P. D. R. lives in Pucallpa, Peru – a major city in the eastern jungle region of the country. This steaming, humid city is situated on the banks of the Ucayali River, a tributary of the Amazon River. Maritza is a member of the Las Dalilas communal bank and has been taking out small business loans for 6 years to support her restaurant "La Gruta".

Maritza is currently requesting a Kiva loan of 1,500 Nuevo Soles to purchase tables and chairs for her seating area. Maritza will also use the funds to buy foodstuffs with which she will prepare her menu. She will repay the loan in monthly installments. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: purchase tables and chairs and ingredients for her cooked food dishes

loans.name: Marquita

texts.en:
Marquita Perez M. is 31 years old.  She lives in Pucallpa, Peru – a major city in the eastern jungle region of the country.  This steaming, humid city is situated on the banks of the Ucayali River, a tributary of the Amazon River.  Marquita is a member of the Las Dalilas communal bank and has been taking out small business loans for 5 years to support her tranportation business.  Marquita owns a mototaxi, or motorized rickshaw.  She rents out the vehicle for daily fares and earns money for herself and her two children.  Marquita is also married; her husband works for the regional government.

Marquita is currently requesting a Kiva loan of 1,000 Nuevo Soles to pay for maintenance on her mototaxi and to buy replacement parts.  She will repay the loan in monthly installments.

loans.use: Pagar el mantenimiento de su motocicleta y comprar piezas de recambio.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha O. Velazquez is 45 years old and is married to a body builder. All of her three children live with her even though two are adults and married. Martha and her husband own and operate a gym and a liquor store. They started Tawa Gym together nine years ago, and she says that the business has changed their lives.

Martha’s husband used to drink and smoke frequently when the family owned and operated only the liquor store. He was quite obese, Martha says, and one day he fell ill. The doctors told him that he wouldn’t live long if he didn’t change his lifestyle, eat more healthily, and exercise. And so he did and he loved working out. After a few years, Martha and her husband decided to open their own gym.  Martha began to take out small business loans with the Talented Women communal bank four years ago.  With her loans, Martha has been able to purchase different types of cardiovascular machines and dumbbells to equip the weight rooms.

Martha is now requesting 2,000 Nuevo Soles to purchase a weight machine for arm exercise. She will repay the loan in monthly installments over the course of four months.

loans.use: To purchase a weight machine

loans.name: Esther

texts.es:
Esther  es socia del Banco Comunal el Triunfo. Esther es casada, tiene  51 años y dos hijos  D. 31 y 26 años.
Tiene su negocio D. venta D. arpillería (chalecos, bolsitas, manoplas, pie D. árboles), productos  artesanales, manualidades, con este negocio lleva veinte años, trabaja en su casa con un grupo D. personas, también venD. productos D. belleza. 

DesD. que Esther  esta en Finca está vendiendo mejor, pueD. invertir en otras cosas. 
Esther necesita un préstamo D. 1000 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra D. productos D. belleza para su stock y la compra D.  materiales para la confección D. sus productos D. arpillería (hilos, lentejuelas, etc.)
Sueña con  seguir surgiendo en su negocio  y ayudar a su hija en la culminación D. su carrera.
texts.en:
Esther is a member of the Triunfo (Triumph) Village Bank. She is 51, and married with two children, who are 31 and 26. For the past twenty years she has been in business selling arpilleras (colorful stitched fabrics such as vests, little handbags, mittens, and decorative patches), products maD. by local artisans, and handicrafts. She works in her home with a group of people, and also sells beauty products. Since Esther has been with FINCA, sales have been growing, so she can invest in other things. She needs a loan of 1000 Soles, which she will invest in the purchase of beauty products for her inventory, as well as materials for making her arpilleras (thread, sequins, etc.). Esther’s dream is to continue growing her business so she can help her daughter realize her own career.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Esther needs a loan of 1000 soles, which she will invest in beauty products.

loans.name: Seidu

texts.en: Seidu M., 45, is the father of two children who are currently in school. He is a trader who has sold lace and cloth for the past 15 years. Lace material is very useful in room and office decorations and most men use the cloth to sew trousers.  For lack of adequate working capital, Seidu buys small stocks of lace materials and cloth and then sells them in the marketplace of Babiani. He believes the loan will enable him to increase his business. With the loan, he wants to purchase lace materials and cloth in bulk. He hopes to use part of his profit to provide his children with a quality education. Seidu belongs to the community called Adehye Trust group. He is grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To purchase lace and cloth in bulk

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel Vasquez P. is 40 years old, married, and has three children.  She lives in the city of Pucallpa in the eastern jungle region of Peru. Pucallpa is the regional capital of the tropical Amazonian department of Ucayali, which is characterized by the meandering Ucayali River that flows north, meeting up with Amazon and, eventually, flowing into the Atlantic Ocean. Fifty years ago, Pucallpa was a tiny caserío or hamlet; but everything changed when the only paved highway leading into the Amazon region was built and Pucallpa became the gateway to the jungle at the roads’ end.  Since the mid-20th century, the city has sprung up and engulfed the surrounding caserios.  Today the city is a bustling, hot metropolis with immigrants from all over Peru.

Maribel is a member of the Mujeres Emprendedoras (Women Entrepreneurs) bank.  She has worked with them and the Manuela Ramos microfinance organization for over four years now.  Maribel first started with loans just under $100, but she has gradually upped her loan amounts to well over $700 now.

Maribel used to sell only shoes for a living, but now as her business has grown she has started to sell clothing and food too.  She is requesting 2,200 Nuevo Soles to be repaid over the course of six months. She will use the loan to purchase chicken, rice,  t-shirts, shoes, and other clothing.

loans.use: To buy chicken, rice,  t-shirts, shoes, and other clothing

loans.name: Gifty

texts.en: Gifty A. is 35 years old, married, and the mother of two children who are in school. She has been a food vendor for a year now. She prepares and sells beans and gari with ripe plantains. She was busily frying plantains when we visited her. Korkor with beans is a delicacy meal that many Ghanaians enjoy everyday either as breakfast, lunch or dinner. Her business is doing well, and she wants to expand her operations to serve more customers. With the loan, she will buy more beans, grains, vegetables, plantains, and meat for her operation. She hopes this loan will help her increase her savings and improve her family's wellbeing. She would be very grateful for your assistance. Gifty is a member of a group called ‘By his Grace’ Trust Group. She attended SAT’s management training program so that when you lend to her she can make good use of the money.

loans.use: To buy grain, beans, gari, vegetables, plantains, and meat

loans.name: Mercy Anita

texts.en:
Mercy Anita Vasquez I. is 30 years old. She lives in Pucallpa, Peru, a major city in the eastern jungle region of the country. This steaming, humid city is situated on the banks of the Ucayali River, a tributary of the Amazon River.  Mercy is a member of the Las Dalilas communal bank and has been taking out small business loans for three years to support her pastry business. Mercy operates a corner store from her home to support herself. In December and January of this year she would like to sell large pastries know as panetones. Panetones are traditional Peruvian Christmas cakes.

Mercy is requesting a Kiva loan of 1,200 Nuevo Soles to purchase panetones. Families and friends exchange panetones, or literally "big breads" as gifts. They are extremely popular in the season leading up to Christmas and Mercy wants to capitallize on this sales opportunity. She will repay her loan in monthly installments.

loans.use: To buy panetones

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther A. is single and has no children. She is a 24-year-old trader. She has been running a clothing shop for eight months now, and sells items like brand new clothes and lace, and also deals in kidswear etc. She does not have sufficient working capital to run the business.

With the loan, she wants to inject more working capital into the business to scale up business progress. She believes the loan will enable her to purchase good quality stock to upgrade her inventory. She would be grateful for that assistance. She is part of an association called ‘God is Good’ Trust group, within the community in which she lives. This makes it easier for her identification.

loans.use: To buy more stock of lace materials, ladies shoes, and kidswear etc.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es:
La prospera comerciante  señora NELLY M. D. N.,PERTENECE Banco Comunal MUJERES SOÑADORAS ubicado en JR. Sinchi-roca  Nª 132,del distrito D. Calleria del Departamento D. Ucayali;con  52  años D. edad, tiene  05 hijos ya mayores D. edad ningunos a su cargo, su  esposo es chofer,  su sueldo  es poco para ambos ,La señora Nelly decidió  vender poco  D. refrescoscos en botellas, pero con el primer préstamo que  le hizo Manuela Ramos D.  s/.300  deciD.  poner un Bar.

LA señora M.  tiene el negocio que tanto anhelaba ;se  levanta muy temprano para  aperturar  y atender  muy alegremente a  sus clientes; por la tarD.  su •esposo  atienD. y ambos hasta las  11 D. la noche.

Aproximadamente hace  unos mese recibió  la suma D. S7.2000,comprara  20 cajas D.  cervezas ,gaseosas 10 cajas ,agua mineral 05 paquetes, vasos mesitas sillas  para renovar etc. 
NELLY,es una mujer con mucho entusiasmo, trabajadora con muchas ganas D. salir adelante junto con su esposo, está muy contenta por el gran apoyo que le brinda Manuela Ramos.
texts.en:
Nelly M. D. N. is a successful business woman and a member of the Mujeres Sonadoras Communal Bank, which is located at 132 Jr. Sinchi-roca in the Calleria district, in the region of Ucayali. She is 52 years old and has 5 grown children who are all independent. Her husband is a chauffeur, but his salary does not meet all of their needs. To help contribute, Nelly began selling bottled soft drinks. Then, with her first loan of 300 soles from Manuela Ramos she set up a bar. Today, she runs a business, just like she always dreamed of, getting up very early every day to open her bar and cheerfully attend to her patrons. In the afternoons, her husband joins her and they work together at the bar until 11pm every night. Now, Nelly would like a loan of 2000 soles so that she can buy 20 cases of beer, 10 cases of soft drinks, 5 cases of mineral water, some glasses, and sets of tables and chairs so she can refurbish the bar. Nelly is a hardworking, driven woman who, along with her husband, has a great desire to succeed in her endeavors. She is very happy and grateful for the great support she receives from Manuela Ramos.

Translated from Spanish by Sara Sultan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy beer, soda, water, glasses, and furniture for a bar

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Abena K. is 29 years old. She is married and a mother of five children. Currently, the kids are in school. She has been sewing for nine years now. She is a specialist in female wear. Her skills and designs are of class. She sews various kinds of styles that give her customers a new look, like kids' school uniforms, church attire, kaba and slit, wedding dresses, funeral clothes etc. She wants to use the loan to buy increased supplies of sewing materials like linen, thread, thimbles, etc. to increase her output and efficiency.

Through her dedication and hard work, Abena has four apprentices, to whom she is giving quality training for their future dependency. She hopes to increase her savings to provide her child with quality education. She is a member of the community group called ‘Three Stars’ Trust Group. She was so happy when she was visited at her business site and was offered free business advice on management and how to retain customers. We believe this will equip her to take good advantage of the loan.

loans.use: To buy increased supplies of sewing material like linen, thread, thimbles, etc., as well as maize.

loans.name: Lorena Haymeth

texts.en:
Lorena Haymeth L. R. lives in Pucallpa, Peru – the bustling capital of the Ucayali department in eastern Peru. The region is characterized by the meandering Ucayali River, a tributary of the Amazon. The weather is scorchingL. hot and humid almost everyday and during the wet season, the city receives daiL. thunderstorms and rain showers. Lorena lives in the city on Martin Olaya Street with her husband – a taxi driver – and her two sons. Lorena has been taking out loans through the Talented Women communal bank for four years to support a clothing sales business that she runs out of her home.

Lorena is currentL. requesting a Kiva loan of 2,000 Nuevo Soles that she will use to purchase pants, blouses and LaCoste polos which she plans to offer to her clients for sale. Lorena will repay her loan in monthL. installments over the course of four months.

loans.use: To purchase pants, blouses and LaCoste polos

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly N. C. is 37 years old. She has been living with her partner for 22 years and they have four children together aged 2, 7, 18 and 20 years old. Nelly is a member of the Talented Women communal bank and she has been taking out small business loans for seven years.

Nelly’s business is the sale of wood braces and tools to timber merchants and lumber jacks who work the rivers of the Ucayali River. Nelly sells sturdy U-shaped iron nails that the workers hammer into logs to help them lift the timber from the river. She also sells long iron bars with a hook on one end and a chisel on the other so that the workers can guide the logs as they float down the Ucayali to the Pucallpa port. She is pictured in her backyard presiding over the forging of the materials she sells.

Nelly is now requesting 1,500 Nuevo Soles to purchase additional iron working tools and rebar to make her products. She says business is good right now because merchants and lumberjacks harvest more trees in the winter. She would like to take advantage of the harvesting season and therefore needs more capital to invest in her store. Nelly will repay her loan in monthly installments over the course of four months.

loans.use: Nelly would like to purchase additional iron working tools and rebar to make her products.

loans.name: Philemon

texts.en:
Philemon is married to Mary Nefor and they are blessed with one child who is below 15 years of age. As a very hard working young man, he has come across some problems in life: his parents interrupted his educational career, lack of capital to expand his business, ill health, and the issue of theft that took away his chainsaw. These challenges made Philemon’s life disturbed until the year 2007 in which he saw GHAPE as a source of relief and became a member. In that same year, Philemon obtained his pioneer loan of 40,000frs and was able to make his repayments promptly.

Given this loan, he plans to buy timber for 50,000frs, Dunlop for 50,000frs, gum, varnish, sandpaper, etc. for 50,000frs and will buy cloth for 50,000frs. He will commence repayment from the same day of disbursement. He is convinced the business will progress because the demand for his product is high, he has had experience in the business; he has working material at any time. Those in his community will benefit from his business because he will train those who are interested, he will supply them with modern furniture, and will even increase the circulation of finance in his locality.

With the profit from the loan, he plans to buy a chainsaw so as to produce timber and create an outstanding fund so that those in his family can benefit from it when need arises. Philemon prefers to receive a loan from GHAPE because the method of repayment is comfortable and convenient.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instils a sense of family and community among its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: Buying timber, Dunlop, varnish

loans.name: Nidia Luz

texts.en:
Nidia Luz Q. S. is forty-six years old. Her husband is an electrician and together they have five children. Nidia has been a member of the Damas del Oriente, or Ladies of the Orient, bank for six years. Her bank is named after the neighborhood where most of the bank members live: Villa Oriente.

Nidia is requesting a loan of 3,000 Nuevo Soles to support her business. She sells beauty products for a living and is planning to invest in deodorants, bottles of shampoo and seven different kinds of perfume with her Kiva loan. Nidia will repay her loan in monthly installments. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: Nidia would like to purchase deodorants, bottles of shampoo and perfume with her Kiva loan to sell.

loans.name: Nilsa Roxana

texts.en:
Nilsa Roxana A. A. is 34 years old. She lives in Pucallpa, Peru – a major city in the eastern jungle region of the country. This steaming, humid city is situated on the banks of the Ucayali River, a tributary of the Amazon River. Nilsa is a member of the Las Dalilas communal bank and has been taking out small business loans for 2 years to support her bodega, or corner store. These small businesses are very common throughout Peru and provide a convenient way for people to earn livings working from their own homes. Bodegas are located in the converted front room of the home and sales are made through grated windows or doors. Nilsa is married to a taxi driver and has two children; the proceeds from her store go to support her and her family.

Nilsa is currently requesting a Kiva loan of 1,500 Nuevo Soles to stock her store. She plans to purchase large sacks of rice, school supplies and would also like to expand into offering general store goods like electrical outlets and wiring. She will repay the loan in monthly installments.

loans.use: Nilsa would like to urchase large sacks of rice, school supplies and would also like to expand into offering general store goods like electrical outlets and wiring.

loans.name: Nimia

texts.en:
Nimia J. M. is fifty-four years old and a widow. She has four children and lives in the Callería district of the Ucayali department in eastern Peru. This region is characterized by the extremely hot, humid weather of the Amazon River basin.

Nimia has worked with Manuela Ramos for eight years and first started taking out small business loans in the amount of $100 to support her food sales venture. As her business has grown, Nimia has been able to increase the amount of her loans.

Nimia is currently requesting S/1,500 (Nuevo Soles) to purchase cheeses and ingredients for the dish she prepares for sale daily: pollo relleno. Pollo relleno or stuffed chicken is a traditional Peruvian dish that Nimia cooks and sells daily to her customers. The chicken is stuffed with raisins, rice and other spices before it is cooked. Nimia will use her loan to purchase all ingredients except the chicken. Nimia additionally raises chickens in her home´s backyard. She plans to use part of her loan purchase chicks and chicken feed.

loans.use: Nimia would like to purchase cheese and the ingredients to prepare chicken relleno to sell.

loans.name: Norma Luz

texts.en:
Norma Luz M. Vasquez is forty-three years old, married and has two children. She sells clothing and accessories for a living from her home. During the holiday season, Norma is requesting additional funds to stock up on products. Norma is requesting a loan of 3,000 Nuevo Soles to fund the purchase of goods for her to resell. She plans to buy shoes, bed clothing, pants, blouses and t-shirts with the funds she receives. Norma will repay her loan over the course of four months, making monthly installment payments.

Norma is a member of the Talented Women’s communal bank of Manuela Ramos located in Pucallpa, Peru. The city is the capital of the steamy, jungle district of Callería in the Ucayali department in Peru. The only paved road leading from Lima into the jungle ends here in Pucallpa. For this reason it is a major city and main transportation hub in the region.

loans.use: Norma would like to buy shoes, bed clothing, pants, blouses and shirts to sell with the funds she receives.

loans.name: Graciana

texts.es: Graciana tiene 43 años, vive con sus hijos Jhon de 23 años y Rodrigo de 21. La venta de queso es el trabajo de Graciana, se ha dedicado a esta labor desde hace 8 años, en los cuales ha podido solventar los gastos de la casa y de sus hijos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que puede realizarlo de forma independiente y disponer de su tiempo. En un día normal Graciana empieza su jornada a las 8 de la mañana y termina a las 6 de la tarde, terminada toda la venta de quesos, es por eso que Graciana quiere incrementar su capital, pero para eso necesita nuestra ayuda. Ella se encuentra en su séptimo préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma. Con el dinero solicitado comprará mayor cantidad de queso para incrementar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Graciana is 43-years-old, and lives with her sons Jhon, 23, and Rodrigo, 21. For the past eight years she has made her living selling cheese, giving her the means to support her household and children. What she likes best about her work is that she can work independently and manage her own time. A typical working day for Graciana starts at 8 in the morning and ends at 6 in the evening, after all the cheese has been sold. Graciana needs our help to raise capital for her business. This will be her seventh loan with Micofinanzas Prisma. She plans to use her loan to buy more cheese so she can increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more cheese to sell

loans.name: Olga

texts.en:
Olga B. R. is fifty-one years old and has three children. Her husband is an electrician and Olga sells beers and other bottled drinks for a living from her home. Olga lives in the Pedro Portillo urbanization in Pucallpa, Peru – a major city in the Peru’s Amazonian River basin region.

Olga has been taking out loans with the Manuela Ramos microfinance institution for two years now. She is a member of the communal bank Mujeres Emprendedoras, or “Women Entrepreneurs”. Olga first started out with a loan of S/300 or just $100. Through the years and her ontime payments, Olga has been able to up her loan amounts to double and triple her previous loans.

Olga is currently requesting S/1,500 to fund the purchase of a new refrigerator where she will store and cool her products. She will also use the capital to purchase beers and flavored sodas to sell to her customers in the neighborhood.

loans.use: Olga would like to buy a refrigerator where she can keep her beers and sodas to sell cold.

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es: Maritza tiene 26 años, vive sola, ya que aun no tiene esposo ni tampoco hijos. Siempre se le ha dado la facilidad para la venta, su manera de convencer a las personas y su gran carisma son su principal arma para atraer a la clientela, la cual se ve complacida con los productos y el trato de Maritza. Ella se ha venido dedicando a la venta de productos naturales desde hace 6 años, en los cuales el negocio ha ido creciendo poco a poco para arrojarle buenas ganancias. Lo más difícil de su trabajo es la venta, ya que algunas personas son muy incrédulas acerca del provecho de los productos naturales, pero el poder de convencimiento de Maritza es mucho más fuerte, logrando que esta pequeña dificultad sea superada. Este es su octavo préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma, siendo muy puntual en los pagos. Con el dinero solicitado aumentará la cantidad de mercadería para incrementar sus ventas y así lograr mejores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Maritza is 26 and lives by herself, since she does not yet have a husband or children. She has always had a facility for sales. Her ability to influence people and her strong charisma are her best assets in attracting customers, who are pleased with the products and Maritza’s service. She has earned her living selling natural products for six years, during which time business has grown little by little, providing Maritza with nice profits. The hardest part of her work is making the sale, since some people are very skeptical about the advantages of natural products, but Maritza’s power of persuasion is much stronger, allowing her to overcome this small difficulty. This will be her eighth loan with Microfinanzas Prisma, and she has been very punctual with her payments. She plans to use her loan to increase her inventory so she can grow her sales and earn more income for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the number of products she sells

loans.name: Marivel

texts.es: Marivel tiene 39 años, vive con sus hijos Melani de 14 y Andi de 4 años de edad. La venta de ropa es la actividad a la que se dedica Maribel desde hace ya 8 años para poder mantener a sus pequeños hijos. Marivel comienza su jornada diaria a las 8 de la mañana para terminar a las 5 o 6 de la tarde, felizmente la venta es buena, ya que es muy carismática arrojándole buenos ingresos económicos para su bienestar y el de su familia. Pero el trabajar sola es más difícil, ya que extraña mucho a sus hijos durante esas horas del día. Marivel sabe que debe trabajar mucho para darles a sus pequeños una buena educación, es por eso que recurre a nosotros para que la ayudemos a cumplir todas sus metas trazadas. Marivel se encuentra en su primer préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma, siendo muy puntual en los pagos. Con el dinero que solicita comprara más mercadería para vender en estas temporadas de fiestas, donde hay gran demanda.
texts.en:
Marivel is 39 years old. She lives with her children, Melani, 14 and Andi, 4 years of age. For the past 8 years she has been selling clothes for a living in order to maintain her young children. Marivel begins work daily at 8 a.m. and finishes at 5-6 p.m. Fortunately sales are good as she is very charismatic and therefore she receives good economic income to create welfare for herself and her family. But to work alone is difficult as she misses her children during the day. Marivel is aware that she must work hard to provide her children with a good education and therefore she is requesting our support to reach her goals. Presently Marivel has a loan with Microfinanzas Prisma and she is very punctual with the payments. With the loan requested she will buy more merchandise to sell during the holiday season when demands are high. .

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Rosa Andrea

texts.en:
Rosa Andrea K. G. is a thirty-six year old business woman. She runs a small cornerstore and also sells clothing on the side. Rosa has four children and is married to a school teacher. She has been a member of the Talented Women communal bank for six years here in the department capital city of Pucallpa, Peru.

Rosa is requesting a loan of 3,000 Nuevo Soles to be repaid monthly to fund the purchase of products for her bodega and for her clothing sales business. She plans to stock her store with the daily necessities that her customers require (for example, rice, oil, sodas, sugar).

loans.use: Rosa would like to buy supplies for her store (rice, oil, sodas, sugar) and for her clothing sales business.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa P. D. R. is sixty-eight years old. She lives with her retired husband in the tropical Amazon River basin region in eastern Peru. Rosa supports herself and her family through her juice selling business. Rosa is also a member of the Talented Women communal bank; she has taken out loans through her group for two years, at first to help implement a groceries business and now to fund a juice and beverage sales stand.

Rosa is requesting 1,000 Nuevo Soles to purchase materials with which she will concoct her beverages and juices. She is also planning to invest in one case of eggs and one case of milk to sell in her bodega. Rosa will repay her loan in monthly installments over the course of four months.

loans.use: Rosa would like to buy supplies for her juice stand, and to buy milk and eggs to sell.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.es: Ruth tiene 47 años, vive sola, ya que es soltera. Desde hace 30 años se dedica a la venta de cuadros en el mercado Tupac Amaru, uno de los más concurridos de la ciudad de Juliaca, arrojándole buenos ingresos económicos. A Ruth le gusta su trabajo, ya que trabaja tranquila, sin complicaciones y ella misma dispone de su tiempo, empezando usualmente a las 8 de la mañana hasta las 6 o 7 de la noche siendo estas horas las de más concurrencia. Lo difícil de su labor es el frío que hace en su puesto, ya que el sol no cae por ahí, teniendo que soportarlo, pero Ruth lo supera, sabiendo que siempre existen algunos inconvenientes en el trabajo. Ella se encuentra en su octavo préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma, siendo muy puntual en los pagos. Con el dinero solicitado comprará mayor cantidad de cuadros en la ciudades de Tacna o Lima para venderlos en su puesto y así lograr mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Ruth is 47 years old and lives alone because she is single. For 30 years she has sold pictures in the Tupac Amaru market - one of the most visited markets in Juliaca city - which brings in good income. Ruth likes her work because it is calm and without complication, and she can set her own hours. She usually starts at 8 in the morning and goes until 6 or 7 at night since those are the busiest hours. The difficult part of her job is dealing with the cold temperatures in her spot since the sun does not hit it. She has to put up with it and she overcomes the difficulty knowing that jobs always have some inconveniences. This is her eighth loan through Microfinanzas Prisma and she is very punctual with her payments. With the money she is requesting, she will purchase more pictures in Tacna or Lima to sell at her place and bring in better income.

Translated from Spanish by Kelly Wester, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more pictures

loans.name: Rossana

texts.en:
Rossana V. P. lives in the bustling, jungle city Pucallpa, Peru. It is the regional capital of the tropical Amazonian department of Ucayali which is characterized by the meandering Ucayali River that flows north, meeting up with Amazon and, eventually, the Atlantic Ocean. Fifty years ago, Pucallpa was a tiny caserío or hamlet; but everything changed when the only paved highway leading into the Amazon region was built and Pucallpa became the gateway to the jungle at the roads’ end. Since the mid-20th century, the city has sprung up and engulfed the surrounding caserios. Today the city is a bustling, hot metropolis with immigrants from all over Peru.

Rossana has worked with the Ucayali branch of Manuela Ramos for over five years. She is a member of the Mujeres Emprendedoras, or Women Entrepreneurs, communal bank with several of her relatives. Rossana first took out loans of 300 Nuevo Soles – the minimum allowed by Manuela Ramos; but as she has grown her business, Rossana has borrowed larger and larger sums.

Rossana is now requesting 1,500 Nuevo Soles to support her small restaurant. She will repay her debts within six months. Rossana is planning to purchase tables, chairs, a refrigerator, tablecloths and also rice in bulk with her loan. She is pictured in the photograph above preparing a midday day meal in her kitchen.

loans.use: Rossana would like to buy tables, chairs, a refrigerator and tablecloths and also rice in bulk to resell.

loans.name: Yobana

texts.es: Yobana tiene 25 años, vive sola, ya que es soltera. Se dedica a la venta de joyería desde hace 8 años para solventar sus gastos económicos, siempre ha trabajado, desde que terminó los estudios secundarios, ya que no tuvo la oportunidad de seguir con estudios superiores, pero gracias a su gran esfuerzo logró consolidar su negocio, en el cual ahora le va muy bien. A Yobana le gusta su trabajo, ya que piensa que con él ayuda a las mujeres a mejorar su apariencia y que se sientan bien consigo mismas, así consiguió muchas amigas en este lapso, las cuales son ahora sus clientas más fieles. Lo difícil de su trabajo son los viajes a diferentes ciudades para adquirir las joyas que vende. Este es su octavo préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma, siendo muy puntual en los pagos. Con el dinero solicitado viajará a otras ciudades a comprar más mercadería y así aumentar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Yobana is 25 years old, lives alone, and is single. She has sold jewelry for 8 years to pay for her expenses. She has worked ever since finishing high school because she did not have the opportunity to continue with higher education. With hard work, she was able to build up her business, and it is going very well for her. Yobana likes her work because she believes that it helps women improve their appearance and feel good about themselves. She has made many friends through the years who are now her most loyal customers. The difficult part of her work is the travel to different cities to get jewelry to sell. This is her eighth loan through Microfinanzas Prisma, and she is very punctual with payments. With the money she is requesting, she will travel to other cities to buy more merchandise and increase her income.

Translated from Spanish by Kelly Wester, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her business

loans.name: Rubi

texts.en:
Rubi Gonzalez B. N. lives in Pucallpa, Peru – the bustling capital of the Ucayali department in eastern Peru. The region is characterized by the meandering Ucayali River, a tributary of the Amazon. The weather is scorchingly hot and humid almost everyday and during the wet season, the city receives daily thunderstorms and rain showers.

Rubi lives in the city on Atahualpa Street with her husband – an electrician – and her two sons. Rubi has been taking out loans through the Talented Women communal bank for five years to support her shoe and clothing sales business.

Rubi is currently requesting a Kiva loan of 2,000 Nuevo Soles to help her finance the purchase of wines from the Southwestern coastal region of Peru. Rubi would like to sell these famous wines from the cities of Chinca and Ica as Christmas and holiday gifts. Rubi will also use her loan to stock up on shoes and clothing for her regular business activities.

loans.use: Rubi would like to purchase wines from the Chinca and Ica regions to resell for holiday gifts.

loans.name: Rusilda

texts.en:
Rusilda F. C. is forty years old and lives in the eastern jungle region of Peru. She and her husband and their two children live in the department capital Pucallpa, a bustling city and major transportation hub of the region.

Rusilda dedicates herself to several different ventures: she sells fish and raspadillas (snow cones) from her home, she maintains and rents a mototaxi; and she runs a small laundry business. Rusilda has been taking out loans with the Las Paykanas communal bank for three years and she uses the capital she borrows to support all of her endeavours.

Rusilda is requesting 1,100 Nuevo Soles to pay for her mototaxi's maintenance, to fund her daily fish purchases from the local river port, and to pay her laundry business taxes. She will repay her loan monthly over the course of four months.

loans.use: Rusilda would like to pay for the maintenance of her moto taxi, purchase fish to resell and pay for her laundry business.

loans.name: Maribel Olga

texts.es:
Maribel  es socia del Banco Comunal el Triunfo. 
Maribel es casada, tiene  43 años y tres hijos  de 12, 8 y 6 años, sus tres hijos están en el colegio.
Maribel  tiene su negocio que se llama “IVANKA”, realiza trabajos de fotocopiado, anillados, casi siempre ella atiende  sola, pero algunos días cuenta con la ayuda de su sobrino, si no tiene que cerrar su Tienda  por las tardes
Desde que Maribel esta en Finca se siente más tranquila, orientada puede solucionar los problemas de su  negocio.
Maribel necesita un préstamo de 2400 soles dinero los cuales  serán invertidos en la compra de una cortadora y arreglar el stand del local, quiere ampliarlo y remodelarlo.
Maribel sueña con  tener un propio local muy grande  y también implementarlo con una librería.
texts.en:
Maribel is a member of Triunfo Community Bank. Maribel is 43 years old, married, and has three children in school who are 12, 8, and 6 years old. Maribel has a business called "IVANKA," where she offers photocopying and binding. She almost always runs it alone, but some days gets help from her nephew if he does not have to close his store in the afternoon. Since Maribel has been with Finca, she has felt more calm and focused, and can resolve problems with her business. Maribel needs a loan for 2,400 soles which she will use to invest in a paper cutter and to fix the store's stall - she wants to remodel and expand it. Maribel dreams about having a large location of her own that she will also add a book store to.

Translated from Spanish by Kelly Wester, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Maribel needs a loan for 2,400 soles which she will invest in the purchase of a paper cutter

loans.name: Victoria Jesús

texts.en:
Victoria Jesus B. T. is 37 years old. She lives in Pucallpa, Peru – a major city in the eastern jungle region of the country. This steaming, humid city is situated on the banks of the Ucayali River, a tributary of the Amazon River. Victoria is a member of the Las Dalilas communal bank and has been taking out small business loans for 2 years to support her clothing sales business. Together with her husband - a chauffeur - Victoria earns enough to support her family of four children.

Victoria is currently requesting a Kiva loan of 1,200 Nuevo Soles to stock her inventory. She will purchase pants, shorts, polos, and t-shirts. She will repay the loan in monthly installments. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: Victoria would like to purchase more pants, shorts & shirts to sell.

loans.name: Casilda

texts.es:
Casilda   es socia del Banco Comunal el Triunfo. Casilda es casada, tiene  61 años y cuatro hijos  D. 41,40,38 y 35 años,  tres  D. sus hijos están casados.
Ella tiene una bodega que se llama “Katerine”, venD. abarrotes, cerveza, gas, gaseosas, dulces, ella venD. todos los días y atienD. en su bodega sola. 
Hace trece años que recibe préstamos y se siente más tranquila, ha podido  invertir más.
Casilda  necesita un préstamo D. 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. productos para su bodega (gaseosas, abarrotes, cerveza, etc.)
Casilda  sueña con  seguir trabajando e incrementar más su negocio.
texts.en:
Casilda is a member of the Triunfo Community Bank. Casilda is 61 years old, married, and has three children ages 41, 40, and 38, who are married. She has a grocery store called "Katerina" where she sells groceries, beer, and soft drinks. She is open every day and tends to her store alone. It has been three years since she received a loan, and she feels calmer and has been able to invest more in her business. Casilda needs a loan for 1,000 soles which she will use to buy products for her grocery store (soft drinks, groceries, beer, etc.). Casilda hopes to continue her work and grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by Kelly Wester, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Casilda needs a loan for 1,000 soles to purchase soft drinks, groceries, beer

loans.name: Alma Nubia

texts.es:
La Señora de nombre Alma Nubia Z. R. tiene la edad de 50 años, su estado civil es soltera, Doña Alma tiene 3 hijos de los cuales sus edades son las siguientes su hijo mayor de 28 años trabaja por cuenta propia su otro hijo de 23 años cursa el 4 año de secundaria de la carrera de biología y su hijo de 13 años cursa el 3 año de secundaria, sus sueños son de mejorar su casa para dejarle a sus hijos un  buen lugar para vivir ya que debido a la situación es muy difícil de realizar la compra de materiales de construcción que  están muy caros sus propósitos son de ampliar su negocio para así mejorar la economía de su familia para asegurar el futuro de sus hijos sus deseos son de darle lo mas necesario a sus hijos para que estos tengan una vida económica mejor para ellos mismos.
