La a actividad económica a la que se dedica es la venta de ropa en la que vende los productos camisa, zapatos, pantalones y ropa interior, la ubicación de su negocio es de forma ambulante, el tiempo que tiene de poseer su negocio es de 3 años, ella inicia este negocio por la necesidad de buscar un trabajo y lo empieza con la idea de esparcir sus productos a sus mejores amigos quienes fueron los que le dieron la mano para sacar delante este negocio y este  fue el método que decide implementar para llevar los productos hasta donde se encuentra el cliente su familia apoyo en este negocio, el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo por lo que tiene que realizar las diferentes compras en Managua y León ya que así tiene la solución de obtener de una forma mas favorable su mercadería y espera siempre tener el apoyo de la Fundación León 2000 y  de las organizaciones para salir adelante.
texts.en:
Alma Nubia Z. R. is 50 years old, single, and has three sons. Her oldest son is 28 and self-employed. Her 23-year-old son is in his fourth year of college, majoring in biology. Her 13-year-old is in his third year of secondary school.

Alma's dream is to make improvements to her home so she can leave her children a nice place to live. Since building materials are very expensive, it is difficult to achieve this goal. So, she would like to expand her business to enhance her family's future prospects. She wants to do whatever she can to assure that her sons improve their economic situation.

For three years, Alma has been a street vendor selling clothing, including shirts, shoes, pants, and underwear. She began this business out of economic necessity, spreading her merchandise among several trusted friends to help develop the business. In this way, she has been able to get her products to her customers.

She will use this loan for working capital to purchase merchandise in Managua and León, where she can obtain better prices. She hopes to always be able to count on the support of Kiva's partner Fundación León 2000 to help her get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Viviana

texts.en:
Viviana F. T. sells shoes and clothing for a living. She has a post in the local market where she offers sneakers, children’s shoes, and men’s and women’s clothing. The proceeds from Viviana’s business help support her family which consists of her husband (also a clothing vendor) and her three children.

Viviana has been borrowing money through Manuela Ramos for three years to support her business. She is a member of the Las Paykanas communal bank and she first started out with loans of just under $100.

Viviana is currently requesting a loan of 2,000 Nuevo Soles to purchase stock for her market stall. She will buy dozens of sandals, pants for women and men, blouses, and children’s t-shirts. Viviana plans to repay her loan monthly over the course of four months.

loans.use: Viviana would like to purchase mens', womens' & childrens' clothing and shoes to resell.

loans.name: Carmen Rosa

texts.es:
Carmen Rosa   es socia del Banco Comunal el Triunfo. 
Carmen Rosa es casada, tiene  49 años y cuatro hijos  de 27, 22,18 y 12 años,  el menor de sus hijos todavía está en la escuela y otro de sus hijos está en estudios superiores.
Carmen Rosa tiene su negocio hace ya treinta años, vende productos de belleza de todas las marcas, les ofrece a sus amigos y familiares, ella invierte paga y saca mas mercadería para su stock.También va a comenzar a vender ahora en el tiempo de verano raspadillas y cremoladas.
Desde hace diez años recibe los préstamos ha podido  invertir mas y es una gran ayuda.

Carmen Rosa  necesita  un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de productos de belleza por catalogo y en la compra de una máquina para moler hielo para la venta de raspadilla y cremoladas.
Carmen Rosa  sueña con  tener su propio negocio y trabajar con su familia, también ampliar el taller de cerrajería de su esposo.
texts.en:
Carmen Rosa is a member of the village bank el Triunfo. She is married, 49 years old and has four children aged 27, 22, 18 and 12. The youngest of her children is still in school while the others are pursuing continued studies. Carmen Rosa has been in business for thirty years selling beauty products of all brands. She sells to family and friends and uses her earnings to increase her stock. Now that it is summertime sh ealso plans to start selling snow cones (crushed ice with syrup on top). She has recieved loans for the past ten years which has allowed her to invest more money and has been a great help. Carmen Rosa needs a loan of 1000 soles (325 dollars) which will be spent buying more beauty products and a machine to crush ice for snow cones. She dreams of having her own business and working with her family, and also of improving her husband's locksmith shop.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Martyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchasing beauty products

loans.name: Janett Del Socorro

texts.es:
El nombre de la Señora Janett del Socorro Ramírez García tiene la edad de 42, su estado civil es de soltera Doña Janett tiene 5 hijos de los cuales su hijo mayor de 23 años trabaja por cuenta propia su otro hijo de 20 años trabaja por cuenta propia su otro hijo de 19 años trabaja por cuenta propia su hijo de 17 años cursa el 5 año de secundaria y su ultimo hijo de 10 años cura el 5 grado de  primaria, su compañero de vida labora como taxista, sus propósitos son de superar en su negocio para que este se amplié y tener mas producto para ofrecer sus deseos son no tener deudas para trabajar con su propio capital para obtener sus ganancias sus sueños son de son de proporcionar mejorías en lo económico para sacar adelante a su familia .


La actividad económica a la que se dedica es la venta ropa como: pantalones, camisas, shorts y ropa interior, la ubicación de su negocio es en el mercado la Estación, el tiempo que tiene de poseer su negocio es de 20 años, ella inicia este negocio por cuenta propia y con una canasta de productos en los vendía productos como: ropa interior, y camisas al paso del tiempo es que logra obtener su propio establecimiento y fue aumentando su mercadería y es así  como logra tener mas confianza en este negocio además se amplio instalando otro establecimiento de su pertinencia para tener mas confianza en su negocio por lo que nesecita realizar el financiamiento para capital de trabajo que será utilizado para la compra de mas productos ya que se acerca la temporada de la compra de uniformes, zapatos, cuadernos y mochilas ya que la compra de estos productos los realiza en Managua por lo que le resulta mas favorable la compra al por mayor en Managua.
texts.en:
Janett del Socorro Ramírez García is 42 years old, is unmarried and the mother of 5 children. Her elder children, aged 23, 20 and 19, all work independently. Her 17 year old son is enrolled in the fifth year of secondary school, and her youngest child is 10 years old and enrolled in the fifth grade of primary school. Her partner works as a taxi driver. Her goals are to expand her business and offer a wider selection of products. She hopes in the future to not have any debts, and to work with her own capital so she can increase her earnings. She also hopes to be able to afford improvements in order to build a better life for her family. She works selling clothes including trousers, shirts, shorts and underwear. Her business is located in the Estación market, and she has owned this business for 20 years. She started the business by herself with a basket of products for sale including underwear and shirts. Over time she was able to obtain her own stall and expand her merchandise, and in this way she has built up the reputation of her business. In addition she has expanded by opening another stall, and for this reason she needs a loan for working capital that will be used to buy more products such as school uniforms, shoes, notebooks and backpacks as the back-to-school season approaches. She will buy these products in Managua, where better wholesale prices are on offer.

Translated from Spanish by Sally Bolton, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Georgina Luz

texts.es:
Georgina   es socia del Banco Comunal el Triunfo. 
Georgina es casada, tiene  41 años y dos hijos  de 13 y 1 año,  el mayor está en la escuela.
Georgina  tiene su negocio de venta de productos de belleza Unique ofrece a sus amigos y familiares, ahora también va a comenzar en el negocio de la venta de productos de limpieza asociada con su hermano, ya cuenta con varios  pedidos.
Desde  hace cinco años recibe los préstamos que le han  ayudado a invertir más para su stock de productos de belleza.
Georgina necesita  un préstamo de 1600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de productos de limpieza (lejías, detergentes, ambientadores, etc.)
Georgina sueña con  una  tener una tienda propia.
texts.en:
Georgina is a member of the El Tiunfo Communal Bank. She is 41 years old, married, and has two children who are 13 and 1 years old. Her eldest child is in school. Georgina sells beauty products for a living, but would also like to start another business, selling cleaning products with her brother. They have already had some orders placed by friends and neighbours, so they are confident of business. Georgina has been receiving loans as a member of the Bank for 5 years now. She needs this next loan, of 1600 soles, so that she can buy cleaning products (bleach, detergents, air fresheners etc). Georgina dreams of owning her own store one day.

Translated from Spanish by Sara Sultan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy bleach, detergents, air freshner, etc.

loans.name: Zoidolith

texts.en:
Zoidolith I. P. is 32 years old.  She lives in Pucallpa, Peru – a major city in the eastern jungle region of the country.  This steaming, humid city is situated on the banks of the Ucayali River, a tributary of the Amazon River.  Zoidolith is a member of the Las Heroinas communal bank and has been taking out small business loans for 5 years to support her corner store, where she offers snacks and refreshments.

Zoidolith is currently requesting a Kiva loan of 1,300 Nuevo Soles to purchase bottled sodas, juices, candies and crackers to stock her store on Inmaculada Street.  She will repay the loan in monthly installments.  She is photographed above with some of the wares she offers from her stand.  It is only open in the evenings, in the morning Zoidolith takes care of her family and her household.  With the proceeds from her business, she is able to provide for herself and her children.

loans.use: To purchase bottled sodas, juices, candies and crackers for resale

loans.name: Esmeralda De Los Angeles

texts.es:
La Señora de Nombre Esmeralda de los Ángeles Velásquez R., tiene la edad de 31 años, su estado civil es casada, Doña Esmeralda tiene 2 hijos su edades son las siguientes su hijo de 10 años cursa el 6 grado de primaria y su otro hijo tiene la edad de 9 meses y no estudia, su compañero de vida labora en una empresa llamada impelco, los  propósitos son que su negocio crezca para invertir mas en mercadería y mantenerse activa en el mercado para seguir proporcionando a su familia el sustento de diario para ayudarle a su familia sus deseos son de tener salud para seguir trabajando en este medio de sustento y que sus hijos sean personas de bien y tengan un futuro en el plano profesional para que el día de mañana sepan manejar las situaciones que se les presenta.


La actividad económica a la que se dedica es la venta de ropa, cosméticos y perfumes, la ubicación de su negocio es de forma ambulante, el tiempo que tiene de poseer este negocio es de 8 años, ella inicia este negocio trabajando en una tienda en la vendía cosméticos de oriflame y comenzó a esparcir mercadería de ropa y perfumes por lo que no obtuvo mucha afluencia de clientes y necesitaba  sacar adelante a sus hijos  y no le resultaba invertir en algo en lo que no le generara los suficientes ingresos para su familia por lo que decide dedicarse solo dedicarse a la comercialización de ropa ya que esta la distribuye a los diferentes clientes que se lo piden por medio de encargo ya que así logra entregar los productos, el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo de prendas de vestir que son encargadas del extranjero y la compra de estas son muy caras por lo que tiene que pagar las deudas de su encargo.
texts.en:
Esmeralda de los Ángeles Velásquez R. is 31 years old, is married and has two children. Her older son is 10 years old and in the sixth grade of primary school and her younger son is nine months old. Her partner works for a company called Impelco. Her goals are to grow her business in order to invest more in merchandise and maintain an active presence in the market. In such a way she will be able to continue to provide support to her family on a daily basis. Her wishes are to have good health in order to continue working and supporting her family. She also wishes that her children grow up to be good people, are able to pursue professional careers, and know how to manage the situations that they will confront in the future. Esmerelda works selling clothing, cosmetics and perfume. She has owned this business for 8 years. She started this business working in a store selling Oriflame cosmetics. She then started to expand to selling clothing and perfume, but did not receive a large quantity of customers. Needing to support her children, it was not worthwhile to invest in something which did not generate sufficient income for her family, and for this reason she decided to concentrate on selling clothes. She distributes clothes to different customers who place orders which she fulfils. The loan is for working capital to purchase clothing which is ordered from overseas. The purchase of these items is very expensive, and for this reason she has to pay the money owing on the order.

Translated from Spanish by Sally Bolton, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Zolia

texts.en:
Zoila Arevalo is sixty-one years old and lives in the department capital Pucallpa in the eastern jungle region of Peru.  Zoila’s husband works in construction and together they have five children.  Zoila has been a member of the Talented Women communal bank for six years and she has used the money from her loans to support a food-selling business where she sells chicken and sausage.  She also sells tamales and chicken and rice dishes each night in front of her home.

Zoila is requesting a loan of 3,000 Nuevo Soles to fund her daily purchases of 20 kgs of potatoes, 3 liters of oil, a dozen eggs, and fresh chicken.  She will also purchase gas cans with which she will fuel her stoves.

loans.use: To buy potatoes, liters of oil, eggs, fresh chicken and gas cans of fuel

loans.name: Magali

texts.es:
Magaly  es socia del Banco Comunal el Triunfo. 
Magaly es casada, tiene  38 años y dos hijos  de 19 y 12 años,  el mayor de sus hijos está en la universidad y el último en el colegio.
Tiene su negocio de servicio de Internet que se llama “JYM”, el negocio funciona en su casa y lo atiende sola, La dificultades que ella presenta es que tiene  asma y su hija también sufre de lo mismo.
Hace siete años recibe los préstamos que le han ayudado a invertir e implementar el negocio.
Magaly necesita  un préstamo de 600 soles dinero que será invertido en el mantenimiento de sus computadoras, también va a cambiar teclados, audífonos, etc.
Magaly sueña con  tener otro negocio, y  comprarse un puesto en el mercado.
texts.en:
Magaly is a member of the village bank el Triunfo. She is 38 years old and married with two children aged 19 and 12, the oldest studying at university and the youngest still in school. She has a business called JYM which provides internet service which she runs herself out of her home. One problem Magaly has is that she suffers from asthma, as does her daughter. For seven years she has received loans which have helped her set up and reinvest in her business. Magaly now needs a loan of 600 soles which she will spend on computer maintenance and to buy better keyboards, speakers, etc. Magaly hopes to get another business and to buy herself a booth in the market.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Martyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: maintainence of computers for internet business

loans.name: Flor De Maria

texts.es:
Flor pertenece al Bancomunal Mujeres del Futuro. Flor de Maria, no pudo terminar sus estudios se quedo en el tercero de media con el tiempo se llego a casar actualmente tiene 33 años y cuatro hijos de 11, 7 3 y él ultimo de 5 meses de nacido, los mayores están en la escuela.

Flor de Maria empezó a trabajar limpiando casas lo hizo por mucho tiempo después decidió dedicarse a la venta de frutas en el mercado de Sevilla por su barrio por tiempo de un año y medio pero siempre le engañaban, en un cajón le daban fruta buena y en la parte de abajo estaba fruta malograda  perdiendo  capital, entonces como sus hijitos estaban pequeñitos decidió dejar el negocio y abrir en su casa un pequeño bazar hace medio año y cuenta con la ayuda de su mama, también sigue trabajando  limpiando casas por horas, le da tiempo para estar con sus hijos.

Flor de Maria solicita un préstamo de Finca  de 400 para poder invertir en su negocio de bazar, va a comprar mercadería de ropa,  ella nos cuenta que ha aprendido hacer más responsable en los pagos valora mas las cosas, no le gusta endeudarse y esta feliz por que esta  ganando  más.
texts.en:
Flor is a member of the village bank Mujeres del Futuro. She was unable to finish her studies because she got married. She is now 33 years old with four children ages 11, 7, 3, and the youngest just 5 months. The oldest children are attending school. Flor began working as a housecleaner, but later decided to focus on selling fruits in the market of Sevilla in her neighbourhood. She did so for over a year and a half but kept being deceived by providers who would give her boxes with ripe fruits on top, but rotten fruit beneath, which made her lose money. Since her children were so young she decided to leave this business and open a small shop in her home, which she and her mother have run for the past year and a half. She also continues to clean houses part time which gives her time to spend with her children. Flor de Maria is requesting a loan of 400 soles in order to invest in her shop, she will use it to buy clothing for resale. She says that she has learned how to be more responsible with payments and to value things more highly. She does not want to be in debt and is happy to be earning more money.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Martyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchasing clothing for resale

loans.name: Uputaua

texts.en:
Uputaua M., 36, is married with 4 children. She has many years of experience in the flea market business. She sells to the general public and tourists 6 days per week. She has 4 previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 800 Tala (~333 USD).

SPBD loans are Uputaua’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Her loan will be used to purchase bracelets, Samoan handbags, shoes, lavalava (traditional Samoan wrap-around waist cloths), and Samoan oil.

loans.use: purchase Samoan handbags, bracelets, lavalava, earrings, shoes, and Samoan oil

loans.name: Eddy Michel

texts.es:
Eddy es socio del Bancomunal Mujeres del Futuro 
Eddy es soltero tiene 29 años, tiene estudios superiores  de gastronomía y de ingles los cuales tuvo que deja por falta de dinero, empezó con un puesto en el mercado ropa interior, tuvo que dejarlo por falta de capital, actualmente es cobrador en una combi y hace seis meses ha empezado en el negocio de la crianza de codornices    
Eddy solicita un préstamo de 800 soles para invertir en el negocio de codornices  
El sueño de Eddy es establecer bien su negocio, terminar sus estudios de ingles, llegar a casarse ser un gran padre y dar seguridad a la familia.
texts.en:
Eddy is a member of the village bank Mujeres del Futuro. Eddy is 29 years old, single, and was studying food and gastronomy as well as English but had to drop out due to lack of funds. He opened a stall selling underclothes, but couldn't keep it running, again due to lack of funds. He is now working driving a small bus and seven months ago began a small business raising quails. Eddy is requesting a loan of 800 soles in order to improve his quail business. He hopes to get his business established, finish his English studies, and get married, taking care of his family and being a good father.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Martyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: investing in quail raising business

loans.name: Faimafili

texts.en: Faimafili T., 40, is married and has ten children.  She has many years of experience in the pancake business and sells to the general public seven days per week. She has had two previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 300 Tala (125 USD).  SPBD loans are Faimafili’s only access to capital because she has  never been able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Part of the loan will help to expand her shop and part will be used to purchase materials for her pancake business and thus help her to make money.

loans.use: Purchase flour, sugar, cooking oil, and a frying pan for her business

loans.name: Las Ardillitas Group

texts.en:
The women of the Las Ardillitas are requesting a loan of 5,600 Nuevo Soles to fund their various endeavours. The Ardillitas (or “Little Squirrels”) are a new bank: they are just completing their third loan cycle (each cycle comprising four months of payments) as a group. Because they are a new group, their loan amounts are small, varying between two and six hundred Nuevo Soles. They meet monthly in one bank member’s home near downtown Pucallpa, Peru – a bustling capital in the eastern jungle region of the country.

Most of the women in the group sell food for a living or operate a small corner store, or "bodeguitas", from their homes. The Ardillitas are requesting loans of individual amounts, but they collectively guarantee the repayment of the entire bulk loan. The bank members will be using the loan to fund a variety of individual businesses including: sales of fast food, bottled drinks, groceries, snacks, beauty products, artisanal crafts and bananas. Each woman will repay her portion of the bulk loan within the same four month term.

The bank members requesting a group loan are: Lucy Guinaraes Q., Margarita G. C., Adelina Y. S., Carmela Q. O., Juana A. B., Rogelia P. C., Reina D., Marcelina S. I., Antonia V. Y., Lastenia V. Y., Juana V. R., Jessica Liliana V. Q., Yurema Marice F. G., Adela Insalicio C., Elena V. S., and Priscila G. C..

The bank president is Lucy Guinaraes Q.; the bank treasurer is Juana A. B.; and, the bank secretary is Marcelina S. I..

loans.use: to fund a variety of individual businesses

loans.name: Silomiga

texts.en: Silomiga T., 44, is married and has four children.  She has many years experience in the fishing business. She sells to the passby traffic seven days per week. She has had one previous loan with SPBD and she expects her weekly net cash flow to be 800 Tala (333 USD).  SPBD loans are Silomiga’s only access to capital because she has never been able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Her loan will be used to purchase a fishing net, fishing equipment and a torch. Her husband and son are giving their full support to the business.

loans.use: Purchase fishing net, spear, torch

loans.name: Felipa

texts.es: Felipa tiene 60 años, es casada y vive con su esposo. Ella es una D. las personas más antiguas D. su localidad, es reconocida como una agricultora muy dedicada a sus labores, ya que muy D. madrugada sale a regar sus terrenos D. cultivos, los cuales son muy extensos, gracias a su esfuerzo en todo estos 40 años D. trabajo, ahora alquila sus terrenos, ya que por su edad no pueD.  ocuparse D. la producción misma D. sus terrenos, entonces solo cultiva en los terrenos más cercanos a su casa. Sin embargo, trata siempre D. obtener ganancias quincenales, ahora está dedicada al sembrío D. pasto para alimento D. los animales, los cuales son muy rentables en los mercados. Felipa es una socia fundadora D. su banco comunal, y como líder, es ejemplo D. responsabilidad, en sus 13 ciclos D. crédito nunca falló en sus pagos. La cantidad que solicita es para la compra D. abonos y fertilizantes para sus cultivos y para el mantenimiento D. sus terrenos.
texts.en:
Felipa is 60 years old, is married and lives with her husband. She is one of the oldest people in her community, and is recognized as a very dedicated farmer. She rises very early to go out and water her fields, which are very extensive. Thanks to her hard work over 40 years she is now able to rent some of her fields, as at her age she can't manage the cultivation of all of her landholdings. As such, she now only farms the fields closest to her house. Nevertheless she tries to always receive a fortnightly income, and right now is sowing pasture to feed animals which are very profitable in the markets. Felipa is a founding member of the community bank, and as a leader she sets an example of responsibility. In her 13 loan cycles she has never missed a payment. She will use this loan to buy manure and fertilizer for her crops, and for the maintenance of her fields.

Translated from Spanish by Sally Bolton, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase manure and fertilizer for her crops

loans.name: John

texts.es: John tiene 29 años, es soltero y vive con sus padres y sus hermanos. Anteriormente se dedicó a la agricultura, más adelante, gracias a sus ahorros, pudo adquirir un automóvil, lo que le permitió realizar lo que en realidad deseaba, que es el trasporte, desde hace un año pudo hacerlo realidad. Ahora sale muy de mañana a trabajar y prestar sus servicios de movilidad a las personas, las cuales en su mayoría son sus vecinos, esta labor le da grandes ganancias, lo difícil es cuando su auto tiene fallas mecánicas y debe hacer gastos por ello, para prevenir estas situaciones, John trata de dar mantenimientos mensuales a su automóvil. John está en su quinto crédito con MFP, y siempre ha sido un joven muy responsable en sus pagos. Con esta cantidad comprará los repuestos necesario que requiere su vehículo, para no tener inconvenientes futuros.
texts.en:
John is 29 years old, is single and lives with his parents and brothers. He used to work in farming, but by saving his money he was able to buy a car. His dream was to work in transport, and one year ago he made this dream a reality. Now he starts working very early in the morning, lending his transportation services to people, the majority of who are his neighbours. This brings in a good income for him, but it is difficult when his car has mechanical problems and he has to spend money on fixing it. To avoid this, John tries to give his car monthly tune-ups. This is the fifth loan John has received from MFP, and he has always been very responsible with his repayments. With this loan he will buy the necessary spare parts for his car, in order to avoid problems in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Sally Bolton, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for his car

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Tuilagiula

texts.en: Tuilagiula A., 38, is married and has five children.  She has many years of experience in the fishing business and she sells to the general public six days per week. She has had six previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 800 Tala (333 USD).  SPBD loans are Tuilagiula’s only access to capital because she has never been able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Part of the loan will help to start a new shop and part will be used to purchase a fishing net, fishing equipment and a canoe. Her husband is lending a helping hand to run the business.

loans.use: To build a shop and to purchase a fishing net, fishing equipment and a canoe

loans.name: Las Triunfadoras De Marko Jara Group

texts.en:
The women of the "Las Triunfadoras de Marko Jara" are requesting a loan of 7,900 Nuevo Soles to fund their various endeavours. The Triunfadoras (or “The Triumphant”) formed as a communal bank less than one year ago. Because they are a new group, their loan amounts are small, varying between three and eight hundred Nuevo Soles. They meet monthly in one bank member’s home on Pomorrosa Street in a suburb of Pucallpa, Peru. The city is a bustling regional capital and major transportation hub of the Amazon River basin area in eastern Peru. The construction of the highway fifty years ago, linking Pucallpa to Lima, marked the beginning of a new epoch for the booming capital. No other city in the jungle is connected to the country’s capital by a paved road; for this reason, all major shipping throughout the Amazon Basin to Lima passes through Pucallpa.

The women of this communal bank all work in and around Pucallpa, operating small businesses from corner stores out of their homes to stalls in local markets. The majority of the women in the "Las Triunfadoras de Marko Jara" bank sell some sort of product for a living. The Triunfadoras are requesting loans of individual amounts, but they collectively guarantee the repayment of the entire bulk loan. The bank members will be using the loan to fund a variety of endeavors including: sales of vegetables, shoes, candy, bananas, furniture, and bottled drinks. Each woman will repay her portion of the bulk loan within the same four-month term.

The bank members requesting a group loan are: Milena Liliana G. F. (s/.500), Danitza Ivette M. T.(s/.500) , Ines Magaly G. F. (s/.800), Rosa O. P. (s/.800), Graciela P. R. (s/.800), Teresa D. Pilar M. S. (s/.800), Ada Luz H. D.(s/.500), Corina T. V.(s/.500), Elena L. L.(s/.500), Janeth Savely F. I.(s/.500), Zoila S. L. (s/.500), Enith C. E.(s/.300), Milka Liceth D. A. D.(s/.300), Pilar D. R.(s/.300), and Elizabeth L. U.(s/.300).

loans.use: finance a variety of business endeavours including sale of vegetables, potatoes, sweets, etc.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.es: Juliana tiene 57 años, es separada, vive con su hija y su nieta, a quien cuida. Todos estos, 50 prácticamente, se ha dedicado a la crianza de animales menores, ya que desde muy pequeña le gustaron los animales y siempre los cuidaba y alimentaba, al crecer, encontró en ellos, la posibilidad de una actividad económica y de negocio, entonces se dedicó a venderlos, ya que en los mercados solicitan grandes cantidades de carne de cuy o conejo para consumo en los diversos restaurantes turísticos que hay en las ciudades cercanas. Lo difícil es matar a estos animales y vender su carne,  es por eso que prefiere venderlos vivos. Juliana está en su 13vo crédito con MFP, y seguirá siendo cumplida y responsable como hasta ahora. Con el dinero solicitado adquirirá nuevas jaulas o corrales para la crianza adecuada de sus conejos, debido que éstos aumentan en cantidad rápidamente.
texts.en:
Juliana is 57 years old, separated, and lives with her daughter and granddaughter who she looks after. For almost 50 years she has been raising small animals as she has always been fond of animals and has taken care of and fed them since she was a little girl. When she grew up, she discovered the possibility of an economic activity and a business and then she began selling them as the markets request huge amounts of guinea pig or rabbit meat for the restaurants for tourists in nearby towns. It is difficult to kill these animals and sell their meat, so she prefers to sell them alive. Juliana has her 13th loan with MFP and she is very punctual and responsible. With this loan she will buy new cages to raise rabbits properly as the numbers increase rapidly.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase new cages for rabbits.

loans.name: Faaleo

texts.en: Faaleo Leui, 64, is married and has six children.  She has many years of experience in the ice cakes and pancakes business. She sells to the villagers and general public six days per week. She has had three previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 400 Tala (166 USD).  SPBD loans are Faaleo’s only access to capital because she has never been able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Her loan will be used to purchase things to run her ice cake business as mentioned above. Another part of her loan will be used to renovate her home and for her personal use.

loans.use: Purchase a freezer, sugar, cordial, plastic cups, and chinese lollies

loans.name: Fofoga

She has had three previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 800 Tala ($333 US). Her loan will be used to purchase boxes of chicken, bunches of bananas, sacks of taro, and a large cooler in which to store ice-cakes and drinks. One of her daughters is helping her with the business.

loans.use: Purchase cooking stove, chicken, bananas, taro and a large cooler

loans.name: Mariana

texts.es: Mariana tiene 28 años, es madre soltera, vive con su madre y su hija. Hace 6 años quedó embarazada y tuvo que iniciar un trabajo para mantener a su hija, su madre la apoyó para instalar una tienda en su casa, y gracias a ella pudo  tener su negocio propio, en el cual se ocupa durante todo el día tratando de mejorar constantemente y tener la mercadería necesaria para el consumo diario de los pobladores, y gracias a ser la única tienda en los alrededores de su localidad le da buenos beneficios. Durante el día es cuando hay más clientela y mayores ventas, pero lo difícil es trasladar la mercadería necesaria desde la ciudad hasta su pueblo. Mariana es nueva en MFP, y espera nivelar su trabajo con las demás personas de su grupo, con respecto a su responsabilidad y compromiso. Con la cantidad que solicita invertirá en la compra de mercadería para surtir su  negocio.
texts.en:
Mariana is 28 years old, a single mother who lives with her mother and her daughter. Six years ago, she got pregnant and had to find a job to support her daughter. Her mother helped her open a store in her home. Thanks to her mother, she was able to have her own business at which she works all day in order to improve her situation. She wants to have all the goods needed for the villagers' daily consumption, and because hers is the only store in the vicinity she does well. She gets most of her clients and most of her sales during the day. She says it is difficult to transport the needed goods from the city to her village. Mariana is a new member of MFP, and she expects that she will live up to the other people in her group in terms of her responsibility and commitment. She will invest this loan in goods to stock her store.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase the merchandise in her store.

loans.name: Mary

texts.es: Mary tiene 28 años, es casada y vive con sus dos hijos menores de edad. Desde muy pequeña supo cómo era el trabajo en las chacras y aprendió las labores agrícolas, hace 6 años empezó a invertir en la producción de alfalfa, hierba que sirve para la alimentación de los animales. Cultivar y vender este producto es muy rentable, ya que la gran mayoría de la población de su zona tiene animales y buscan los pastos necesarios para alimentarlos, y Mary trata de satisfacer la demanda, para ello tiene que cortar los pastos cada quince días para venderlos. Este es su 13avo crédito con MFP y desde el inicio no ha dejado de ser cumplida con sus pagos respectivos de sus cuotas de devolución de préstamo.  Con el dinero que solicita comprará abono para sus terrenos de alfalfa.
texts.en:
Mary, 28, is married and lives with her two young children. From the time she was a girl, she knew what it meant to work on a farm and she learned the jobs required to run one. Six years ago, she started growing alfalfa, a grass that is used to feed animals. Growing and selling alfalfa is very profitable because most of the people in the area keep animals and have to feed them. Mary meets the demand. She has to cut the alfalfa every fifteen days in order to sell it. This is her 13th MFP loan and she's never missed paying an installment on a past loan. With this loan, she will buy fertilizer for her alfalfa crop.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizer for farming business.

loans.name: Kalala

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es: Nancy tiene 32 años, es casada, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos menores de edad. Es agricultora, pero también se dedica a la crianza de animales menores en su casa desde hace 10 años, actividad con la cual se siente muy comprometida, ya que gracias a ella puede tener el dinero suficiente para cubrir la alimentación de sus seres queridos, además le agrada levantarse muy de mañana y estar ocupada, porque el trabajo le alegra la vida, y la hace sentirse útil y beneficiosa para su familia. Pero sin duda, lo que más le gusta es estar junto a sus seres queridos, quienes le brindan el apoyo necesario para seguir esforzándose como hasta hoy, sobre todo, lo más gratificante es ver sus animales muy gorditos, porque así puede obtener mejores ganancias. Nancy está iniciando su crédito con MFP, es una mujer muy trabajadora, lo cual garantiza la devolución del dinero de manera  favorable y oportuna. La cantidad que solicita será usada en la compra de animales de raza para mejorar su calidad y su costo.
texts.en:
Nancy, 32, is married. She lives with her husband and their 3 young children. She's a farmer but she also raises livestock, something that she's done for 10 years. It's work to which she's dedicated because thanks to the business, she's had the money to better feed and clothe her loved ones. She also likes getting up very early and staying busy during the day because work for her is one of life's pleasures and makes her feel that she's doing something useful for her family. Without a doubt, though, the thing that Nancy likes best is being with her family who provide the support necessary for her to keep striving. What gratifies her most is seeing her animals get fatter so that she can ultimately sell them. Nancy is just starting at MFP. She's a hard-working woman, a sure guarantee that her loan will be repaid. The loan will be used to buy animals with good blood lines to improve the quality of her stock and the price they fetch.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy animals for livestock business.

loans.name: Anixa

texts.es: Anixa tiene 30 años, es madre de 2 hijos y otro que viene en camino, vive junto a su conviviente quien la apoya en todo. Ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotes y productos de primera necesidad desde hace 3 años y lo que le gusta de su trabajo es conocer mucha gente y dar un trato amable al momento de atenderlos. Además le es rentable porque gracias a este negocio y a su carisma cuenta con una gran clientela que la aprecia mucho. Lo más difícil es no contar con un local adecuado para la venta de sus productos. Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP. Con el dinero solicitado tiene el propósito de ampliar y construir un kiosco para su negocio, además de comprar más productos para surtirlo adecuadamente.
texts.en:
Anixa, 30, is the mother of 2 children with another on the way. She lives with her parter who completely supports her work. She has operated a business selling groceries and everyday items for 3 years. The things that she likes best about the work are meeting lots of people and providing fast and friendly service to her customers. She makes money thanks to the business and her own charisma which draws in an appreciative base of customers. The difficult thing for her is not having a shop from which to sell her products. This is Anixa's second MFP loan. With this loan, she will expand and build a kiosk for the business. She'll also buy more products to better stock the business.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a kiosk for grocery business.

SPBD loans are Maulalo’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. This loan will be used to purchase baking ingredients and equipment.

SPBD loans are Noella’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.The purpose of the loan is to purchase a frying pan, a cooking pot and other cooking equipment.

loans.name: Mtetwa's Group

texts.en:
Mtetwa, 26, is married with one son of 2 years old. She owns a video library in Mwananyamala. She started this business three years ago and works daily from 8am until 10pm. She is able to earn a monthly profit of about US$ 217.

This will be Mtetwa’s third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the first two to increase the inventory of her library, and she wants to open a beauty salon so she has started to buy things for the salon and has paid the loans back successfully. She now hopes for a new loan to improve the salon.

Mtetwa will share this loan with subgroup B of the Serena group. The subgroup has 8 members who run shops, a salon, and sell cosmetics, food, and shoes. These members hold each other accountable in paying back their loans. In the picture, Mtetwa is second from right front row.

loans.use: To start up and improve her little salon

loans.name: Zohirboy

texts.en:
Zohirboy A. is 23 years old. He is married with 2 kids. Zohirboy provides taxi services with his car. He has been in this business for the last 3 years. Zohirboy is always trying to provide high quality services but at the same time make the prices attractive for his customers. He is doing his best to make his business stable and profitable as he is the main bread-winner in his large family.

Zohirboy is ready to work from the early morning till late at night in order to keep his customers and obtain new ones. Today he is planning to replace the car's fuel supply system with one using gas as a fuel, as this is cheaper than petrol. For this reason he is requesting US$ 800 for a term of 8 months. He thanks everyone supporting him and promises to repay the loan in a timely manner. The well-being of this family is in your hands.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing of a kapron gas-cylinder for his car's fuel supply system
